texts.en: Salimon is 45 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lagos State in Nigeria. She sells frozen food. She has been in business for 15 years. She needs a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more frozen food to sell. Salimon says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Agaïssa

texts.fr:
Madame Agaïssa M. a 40 ans, mariée et mère de  six enfants, elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Médine, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle s’initie  aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment  l’achat et la vente de  bazins teintés, de gingembre,  de draps de lit, de chaussures, de savons, etc. il y a plus de dix  ans. 
Elle achète et coud des pièces de bazin teintés, en chemises masculines pour les revendre. Composée entre autres de voisines et de collègues de son époux,  elle est beaucoup sollicitée  de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de cinq  ans. Après 6 prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartiers (Association BENKADI de Médine), elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 15 complets de bazins teintés, 4 pièces de pagnes wax, 20 complets de draps, 2 cartons de savons, 5 paires de chaussures féminines etc. Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso) ensuite elle les revend à domicile et de façon ambulante à travers la ville de Sikasso au comptant en détail  et à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Agaïssa M. is 40 years old and a married mother of six. She lives with her husband and their children in Médine, one of the popular areas of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region in the republic of Mali). Having not had the chance to move forward in school for social reasons, she started businesses buying and selling dyed damasks, ginger, bed sheets, shoes, soaps, etc. more than ten years ago. She buys and sews pieces of dyed damask into men's shirts in order to sell them. She is sought after by her clientele, which is comprised of her husband’s neighbors and colleagues, due to the quality of her products. In order to better satisfy her growing clientele, she has decided to turn to microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the last five years. After 6 group loans with a neighborhood women’s association (Association BENKADI de Médine), she is on her fifth individual loan, and all of her previous loans have been properly repaid. She plans to use this loan to buy 15 suits of dyed damask, 4 pieces of Wax fabrics, 20 sets of sheets, 2 boxes of soaps, 5 pairs of women’s shoes, etc. She stocks up at Bobo Dioulasso (republic of Burkina Faso) and then sells her stock from home or traveling around the city of Sikasso for cash or credit. She foresees earning 100,000 CFA francs in monthly profit from this loan, which will essentially be used to increase her business, contribute to her family expenses, repay her loan, and reinvest into her business.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous items

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is married to Jessie T. who works as a tricycle driver in their village. The couple is blessed with five healthy children. Petronila lives with her husband and children in the village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. Her husband’s income in the tricycle transport business is their primary source of income. Aside from that, Petronila sells different kinds of vegetables in their village to be able to help her husband in earning more income. Together, their income is not enough to sustain the daily needs of their family, especially the educational needs of their children. Thus, she wants to have a hog raising business in order to have additional income to survive well. 

Petronila wants to ask ASKI to provide them enough funds to maintain and expand their business. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 ($250 US) to be used for the general repair of their tricycle. This will help to have the tricycle in good running condition to satisfy their passengers. The excess amount will be used to purchase additional vegetables for her to sell. Also, some of the loan will be utilized to buy some piglets and feed supply for her hog raising business. The loan will be of great help in making their business become more productive and it will help them to earn more profit. Petronila believes that through her sacrifices and faith in God, she will attain her desires in life.

loans.use: To repair the tricycle, to purchase vegetables to sell, to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet D. is from the village of Kauswagan. She is 34 years old. Juliet is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing cargo transport services to local community members. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Juliet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Juliet from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate her business

loans.name: Sainiso

texts.ru: Джалолова Сайнисо – женщина 52 лет. Сайнисо замужем у нее 4 детей. Сайнисо узнала о нашей программе кредитование у односельчан и решила попробовать. Сайнисо занимается продажей продуктов питания и хозтоваров у нее есть собственный магазин. Сайнисо не имела возможности расширится из за финансовых ресурсов, теперь она получила кредит у нас и ее бизнес дает хороший прибыль. Сайнисо также о своим мужем каждую неделью торгуют на рынках Аппон, булок и Гудос Аштоского района.
texts.en:
Sainiso D. is 52 years old, married and has 4 children. She found out about our lending program from her neighbors and decided to give it a try. Sainiso is involved in the sales of food products and household goods at her own store. Sainiso has not been able to expand her business due to lack of financial resources. She received this loan from us, and now her business is more profitable. Sainiso and her husband also sell at the Appon, Bulok and Gudos markets in the Asht district every week.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and expansion of assortment

loans.name: Gairat

texts.en: A. Gairat is 46 years old and married with four children. He sells women’s shawls in the central market of Shahrituz. In the sixteen years of his activities he has managed to acquire his clientele. Now, Gairat‘s business is their main source of income, allowing him to improve their living conditions and provide his children with education. Gairat requests 7,400 Somoni to purchase new women’s shawls in order to increase his range of goods to sell. Gairat would like to thank everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new women's shawls in order to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Pardakhol

texts.en:
A. Pardakhol, age 42, is a married woman. She and her husband have two children. In the midst of their agricultural jobs, they show a great deal of optimism and confidence, putting all their effort in the farming of vegetables, which they later offer to wholesalers. All this effort is paying off, because they have recently started the construction of their own house. This has been a great source of motivation for them and, therefore, they wish to improve the quality of their products through a better use of raw materials and seeds. They are requesting a loan of 2600 Somoni which will help them to finish the construction of their dream house for which they have yearned so long.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Nike

texts.en: Nike is 35 years old and married with two children. She sells cosmetics and bottled water. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50, 000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell.  She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a store owner in the rural village of Pulay Luna, Isabela. She is married to Gilbert M., who is a farmer. They are blessed with a 28-year-old daughter, Virginia, who was able to graduate from high school. They now have two grandsons who bring joy to their family.

Lydia's retail business has been instrumental in supporting the needs of their family. For this reason, she wants to maintain her store. She is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 PHP to use as additional capital for her store. She hopes that the business will become more productive and fruitful in the future. Lydia also shares her main quotation in life, which is “Patience is her key to success.”

loans.use: additional capital for her store

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros.
Magaly es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Magaly tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hermana, además Magaly junto a su esposo tiene un carro con el cual realiza taxi.
Magaly necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza y gaseosas.
Los sueños de Magaly son construir su casa de material noble y comprar otro carro.

loans.use: Para la compra de cerveza y gaseosas.

loans.name: Deny

texts.en:
Denys M. is 33 years old, married with 3 children between 12 and 4.

Denys has been shopping for one year working from 6h00M o clock up to 11h00 P.M   by employing 2 people. Denys after realizing that his investment is too low to get enough profit   to satisfy his family, he needs his first loan from Vision Finance Company s.a  for expanding his shop through purchasing more goods. After getting this loan, Denys hopes to get more profit than before and with that profit, he hopes to build a better future for his family and help many people by creating jobs for them.

loans.use: For purchasing more merchandises

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: La señora Betty, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 47 años y es madre D. 03  hijos, los 03 que aun depenD. D. ella.Betty, es una mujer perseverante, eficiente y capaz. Se dedica a la venta D. ropas y productos D. belleza, en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa. En la actualidad, le esta yendo muy bien, cuenta con clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y saben D. su negocio. Su espíritu luchador, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, comprará  más mercadería D. ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra D. productos D. belleza, D. la línea natura, avon y Esika.Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.

loans.use: Comprará mercaderia de ropa

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El Sr. Rubén Q. R. tiene 30 años de edad y vive en casa de sus padres en Asentamiento Humano Los Ficus – Camino a Huacachina – ciudad de Ica. 
Ellos les han brindado dos ambientes para que él habite junto a su hija de 8 años la cual asiste a un colegio de la zona. El Sr. esta separado de su pareja desde hace 2 años y él es quien se encarga de los gastos de su hija. 
Cuenta con experiencia crediticia en otra entidad donde ha cancelado puntualmente y se dedica al transporte desde hace 8 años.
Con sus ahorros ha logrado comprar una mototaxi de segunda lo que le permite un mejor ingreso y así poder comprar un juego de dormitorio y mejorar el ambiente de la habitación de su menor hija.
Es un hombre muy emprendedor y luchador, sigue adelante por su hija quien es su motivo de vivir. Ha logrado acumular bienes. Goza de buenas referencias y los vecinos dicen que es bien trabajador.
texts.en:
Sr. Rubén Q. R. is 30 years old and lives in his parents’ house in the settlement of Los Fica located along Huacachina Road in the city of Ica. His parents have provided two rooms for him and his eight year old daughter, who attends a local school. Rubén has been separated from his partner for the past 2 years, so he is in charge of his daughter’s expenses. He took out a previous loan with another institution and repaid it on time. Rubén has been working in the transportation sector for 8 years. With his savings, he was able to purchase a secondhand motorcycle taxi. This enabled him to generate a better income so that he could buy a bedroom set and perform renovations to his daughter’s room. Rubén is a determined, hardworking man. He continues to press forward for the sake of his daughter, who is his reason for living. He has good references and his neighbors say he is a good worker.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perform renovations to his daughter's room

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 52 years old. She is widowed and has four children. All of her children are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Vida is a trader. She trades in pastries. She fries the pastries by the side of the road in her community and sells them to retailers. Vida has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Janes Ann

texts.en:
Janes Ann S. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Janes Ann maes and sells banana cue snack in the local community. Janes Ann has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

Janes Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that will help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is fifty-three years old. She is divorced and has four children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region in Ghana. Fishing and related businesses are the major ways to make a living here. 

Paulina is a fish monger. She says she buys fresh fish from the local fishermen/women and smokes them herself. She hawks to sell and supplies to food vendors. Paulina has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Armie

texts.en: Armie G. is from the village of Sinian, Baliangao. She is 39 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Armie owns and operates business producing rice on their own rice field. However, in addition to the earnings from their farm, her main source of income comes from selling bananas in the local community. Armie has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. On March 31st, 2007, Armie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Armie is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and chemicals. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Seu

texts.en:
Seu Y. is an old married woman who currently lives with and cares for two kids. The other five of her children are married and have already started new family homes. She is a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals for the family. 

Presently Seu Y. relies on the income from her husband and her children, who work in different occupations. Her husband is a taxi driver, while her children are fish-sellers and garment workers. Seu Y. has a plot of forest land that is covered with grass; she hopes to clean up her land, on which she will build a new home. 

Seu Y. needs to hire a laborer to help clean up her land, but she doesn’t have enough money yet. Therefore, she decided to request a loan from Kiva through HKL.

loans.use: To hire labor to help clean her land

loans.name: Falilath

texts.fr: A. Falilath est née en 1972 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Falilath s'est installée au quartier Foun-Foun, dans le quatrième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à YAYA Mourana un transitaire, Falilath est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. C'est avec ses enfants et son mari qu'elle vit. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins et venir en aide à son mari, Falilath vend de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce, bouillie de maïs) et aussi divers produits à Porto-Novo. C'est à Cotonou et à Ikpinlé, un marché de vente de produits vivriers, que Falilath s'approvisionne. Falilath avait bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Falilath ambitionne accroître la taille de son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de ses clients. Mais compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose, Falilath sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Falilath was born in 1972 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Ten years ago, she got situated in the Foun-Foun quarter, in the 4th district of the city of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Married to YAYA Mouran, a shipping agent, she is the mother of three children who are all in school. She lives with her three children and husband. Together, the couple ensures that family expenses are covered. To meet her different needs and to help out her husband, Falilath sells food (rice served with sauce; and cornmeal porridge) and also a variety of goods, in Porto-Novo. She stocks up in Cotonou and at Ikpinlé, a market for staple foods. Falilath had benefited from two ALIDé loans, which she has repaid. Her ambition is to increase the size of her business and to cope better with the demands of her customers. But given the few financial means at her disposal, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of corn and rice;and sauce condiments

loans.name: Manuelito

texts.en: Manuelito C. works in someone else's business providing motor transport services. He is 26 years old and married, from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Manuelito has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Manuelito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Manuelito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be his twelfth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Silvia Julia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 44 años de edad, se separó hace 12 años y actuamente vive con tres de sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Paiján, en la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad. Ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de diez años se dedica a la venta de emoliente (bebidas calientes elaboradas con hierbas naturales) en un carrito especialmente diseñado para esta actividad. Ella nos comenta que anteriormente trabajaba como obrera agrícola y que unos amigos la animaron a ofrecer su producto. Silvia ofrece su producto de 4am a 9am  el mercado de la ciudad y de 5:30pm a 8:30pm en el terminal terrestre de la ciudad.

Este producto goza de muy buena acogida en la zona por lo que Silvia desea ampliarlo, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que desea utilizar en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de más emoliente.

Silvia es una mujer alegre y muy emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener un futuro mejor, ella ya ha trabajado anteriomente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Silvia, 44, has been separated for the last 12 years and currently lives with three of her four children in Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For over 10 years she has sold emolientes (hot herbal beverages) from a small, specially designed for this activity, cart. She tells us that she used to work as a farmhand and some friends encouraged her to offer her product for sale. Silvia works from 4am until 9am in the municipal market and from 5:30pm until 8:30pm at the city's bus station. This product is very well received in the area so Silvia wants to increase production. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy ingredients to make more emoliente. Silvia is a cheerful, very enterprising woman. Her greatest wish is to provide her children with the opportunity for a better future. She has collaborated previously with our institution and has shown punctuality and responsibility with respect to her repayment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her soothing herbal teas.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
Froilan, vive la zona Villa San José de Yunguyo, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El esta separado de su esposa hace bastante tiempo, vive junto a sus hijos en una casita en alquiler.
 
Se dedica junto a sus hijos en  la confección  de chamarras de cuero y billeteras, los cuales los vende al por mayor a sus clientes en las diferentes tiendas de la ciudad.


El crédito lo destinara en la compra de cuero y otras materias primas para su producción.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro y tercero vía Kiva; la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Froilan lives in El Alto's Villa San José de Yunguyo neighborhood. He has been separated from his wife for quite some time; he lives with his children in a small rented house. With help from his children, he makes leather jackets and wallets, which he sells at wholesale to various stores in the city. He will use the funds to buy leather and other raw materials for his shop. This is his 4th loan with Impro and 3rd through Kiva; the evaluation done indicates that he qualifies for loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather.

loans.name: Juana Matilde

texts.es: Juana es de 43 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos 1 varón y 3 mujeres, con el apoyo del esposo han establecido una venta de costes típicos en la plaza de la localidad, es el tercer crédito que solicita en ASDIR los anteriores los pago sin problema, demostrando su responsabilidad, solicita nuevamente el financiamiento para ampliar el capital en mercadería.
texts.en:
Juana is 43 years old, married, and has four children (one son and three daughters). With the support of her husband, she established a vending post in the town square where she sells traditional skirts. This is the third loan she has requested from Asociación ASDIR. Her previous loans were repaid without any problems. Juana has demonstrated that she is responsible, so she is requesting a new loan to increase her capital for acquiring merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam A. Y. is a small businesswoman who is married, with two children. She runs a business selling charcoal to customers in Vituka ward, Dar es Salaam. She purchases her goods wholesale directly from the producers and sells to retail customers. Charcoal is the main source of domestic power in developing countries due to the high cost and inefficiency of electrical power. She is requesting a loan of 700,000 TZS to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Sefulu

texts.en:
Sefulu Lee L. is 47 and married with 3 children (ages 5 - 15).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Sefulu has 3 years of experience in this business.  Sefulu needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 280 talas or US $117 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Sefulu joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Sefulu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucia tiene  29 años, esta casada con el Sr Gustavo Flores Gonzalez, tienen dos hijos menores de edad. 
Ella  tiene un puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicado dentro del Mercado Municipal de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, el mismo se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. 
Trabaja en esta actividad desde el año 2000. Su vivienda está  ubicada  en zona alejada  del centro de la ciudad por lo que ella debe salir muy temprano de su casa  para abrir su negocio.
El crédito será de ayuda para la compra de prendas de  invierno  para  niños y adultos.
Lucia anhela poder contar con su propia Boutique  en la cual se pueda manejar dentro de su propia casa .
texts.en:
Lucia is 29 years old, and she is married to Gustavo Flores Gonzalez. They have two minor children. She has a sales stand, which is located inside the Municipal Market in the city of San Lorenzo. She sells articles of clothing for women, men, and children. She has been doing this work since the year 2000. Her house is located in a region far from the center of the city. Therefore, she needs to leave her house very early to open her business. The loan will be helpful in buying clothes for winter for children and adults. Lucia longs to be able to have her own boutique, which she would be able to run inside of her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes for women, men, and children

loans.name: Peace Kwagala Juliet Group

texts.en:
K. Juliet is a 35-year-old businesswoman. She is married with eight children, five of whom are in school. She also takes care of two orphans, one of whom is in school.
Juliet has run a retail shop business for over ten years. She is using her loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, soap, and so forth for resale. Her dreams are to improve her capital and educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, soap, etc.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Demetria, de 43  años, vive en su casa propia junto a  su esposo y su hija Margot (7).Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar arduamente por el bienestar de su familia incursionando en variedad de oficios. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de condimentos, y este negocio le genera ingresos económicos necesarios para brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Ella ofrece estos condimentos en un mercado cercano a la zona por donde vive, prepara diferentes salsas y especias como ocopa, ajíes licuados, ajos molidos, entre otros, y tiene la preferencia de  las amas de casa que frecuentemente adquieren estas salsas  para la preparación rápida de sus comidas . Además paralelamente se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos de belleza que vende por catalogo a sus amigas y conocidas. En el futuro quiere instalar  un negocio más estable para lograr  administrarlo desde su casa, pero se siente tranquila en sus trabajos porque quiere salir delante de a pocos.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y promete que será muy puntual con los pagos de sus cuotas.Demetria tiene planeado invertir  el dinero del crédito en la compra  de mayor cantidad de ingredientes que necesita  para la preparación de sus condimentos y también invertirá una parte en la compra de algunos productos de belleza que se encuentren en promoción.
texts.en:
Demetria, 43, lives in her own home with her husband and her daughter Margot, 7. Since she was very young, she has worked hard for the well-being of her family and has had a variety of jobs. Currently she sells condiments. This business generates the necessary economic income for her to provide a high quality of life to her family. She offers these condiments in a market that is near the area where she lives. She prepares various sauces and spices like ocopa (a spicy sauce made of peanuts, chili peppers, and herbs), chili sauces, ground garlic, and others. The housewives in the area prefer her and frequently acquire their sauces from her to prepare their food quickly. She also sells various beauty products by catalog to her friends and people she knows. In the future, she wants to establish a more stable business and to administer it from her home. She feels at peace with her jobs because she wants to get ahead little by little. This is her second loan that she has had with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she promises to be very punctual with her repayments. She plans to invest the money from her credit in the purchase of a larger quantity of ingredients that she needs to make her condiments. She will also invest part of it in the purchase of beauty products that are on sale right now.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies that she needs for her business

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda, de 27 años, es una mujer emprendedora, que vive con su pareja Aldo (30) y sus dos hijos, en su casa que es  propia.Cada mañana se despierta desde muy temprano para dirigirse a cuidar sus cultivos de café, junto con su esposo, con quien lleva trabajando en la agricultura  8  años. Lo que más le gusta es obtener una producción de calidad, pues refiere que así sus productos se comercializan más rápido, y obtiene mejores ganancias. Sin embargo, su dificultad se presenta a la hora de trasladar sus cosechas a los diferentes mercados donde comercializa, pues son muy delicados. Como su oficio es rentable, ha logrado construir su casa, comprar varios terrenos agrícolas, que le generan buenas  ganancias, por lo que se siente muy orgullosa. Para mas adelante tiene planeado mejorar la productividad de sus tierras, pues desea plantar más frutos oriundos de la selva peruana.Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se muestra muy interesada en las decisiones que toma su grupo comunal, porque esta integrado por personas muy solidarias y responsables.Herlinda tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono que necesita  para esparcirlos sobre sus plantaciones de café, ya que desea mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
27 year old Herlinda is an enterprising woman who lives in her own home with her partner Aldo (who is 30) and their two children. Every morning she wakes up very early to drive to her fields to tend her coffee plants. She does this with her husband, and they have been working in agriculture for 8 years. What she likes most is to have high-quality crops because this means that her crops can be sold quickly and get good prices. However, it is difficult to move their crop to the different markets where they are sold as they are very delicate. Because her job is profitable, she has been able to build her own house and buy some agricultural land that brings her good profits, and she is very proud of these achievements. In the future, she plans to improve the productivity of her land and wants to plant more fruits that are native to the Peruvian jungle. The is the first time that she has requested a loan from MFP and she has shown herself to be very interested in the decisions that her loan group makes because the group is comprised of people who are very supportive and responsible. Herlinda plans to use the loan she is requesting to buy sacks of fertilizer that she needs to spread on her coffee plantation to improve the quality of her harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve the quality of her crops.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 40 years old and married with three children, ages 1, 13 and 16 years old. Jeanne has a photocopy machine and she uses this machine to provide photocopy services to her customers. The hours of her business are from 7 am until late in the evening hours.

Jeanne needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s. a.  to allow her to expand her business by purchasing one more photocopy machine. She plans to look for a market in a school where she can place this photocopy machine. If she is successful in purchasing this photocopy machine as well as getting this market place, she will hopefully earn more profit which will allow her to continue taking care of her children and save for a better future.

loans.use: To buy one more photocopy machine

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred B. is from the village of Burgos, Isabela. She is 46 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Mildred owns and operates a business raising pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Mildred joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Mildred is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Osmar Silvino

texts.es:
El señor Osmar  tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres,  donde tiene instalado un  taller  mecánico de automóviles  desde hace  más de 5 años. 
 El taller pertenecía al padre pero actualmente Osmar esta a cargo, cuenta con todas las herramientas necesarias para poder realizar con eficiencia su trabajo. 
Solicita el préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de una nueva compresora  para así cumplir puntualmente a su clientela.
texts.en:
Mr. Osmar is 30, single, and he lives with his parents. More than 5 years ago an automobile repair shop was set up there. It belongs to his father but Osmar is currently in charge. The shop is equipped with all the necessary tools so that the work can be done efficiently. He is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya to buy a new compressor so that the the work can be completed on time for the customers.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a compressor

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca G. is a married woman who lives in Bato, Samboan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a business venture to buy and sell scrap gold. Her husband Falconiere G., who is 54 years old, works as a welder to earn his living. They have 2 children who are 31 and 34 years old. Rebecca joined NWTF- Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF- Project Dungganon, Rebecca has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for the business so that she can continue to save up for the future and to support the maintenance of the family.  Rebecca G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. Her photo was taken during the end of her weekly center meeting because her scrap gold was already sold.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital for scrap gold business

loans.name: Sania

texts.es:
Sania es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua.
Sania es casada, tiene 2 hijos que ya son independientes, Sania vende ropa a pedido, sus productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares, la mayor parte de sus ventas son al crédito.
Sania necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, zapatos y casacas.
El sueño de Sania es tener una tienda de radiadores.
texts.en:
Sania is a member of the Communal Bank “Wiracocha”, which means “Sun God” in Quechua. She is married and has two children who are independent.

Sania sells clothing upon request. She offers her products to friends and relatives. Most of her sales are made on credit. She needs a loan of 1500 PEN to invest in the purchase of trousers, shoes, and jackets. Her dream is to open a store where she sells radiators.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, shoes, and jackets

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly S. is from the village of Brgy. Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 45 years old. Jolly is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jolly owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jolly has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jolly joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jolly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jolly is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jolly from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Unidas Para Alcanzar El Exito Group

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 30 años, trabaja en el área de limpieza para la municipalidad de su distrito, con el fruto de sus ahorros y mucho trabajo ha podido comprarse una moto taxi (medio de transporte muy usado en Perú)  este vehiculo lo alquila y  le genera  ingresos diarios  a pesar que no es mucho dinero  es otra entrada que ella tiene, lo que quiere hacer mas adelante es vender la moto y con sus ahorros quiere comprarse un terreno construirlo poco a poco para poner su  propio negocio una jugeria  algo que conoce muy bien ya que antes ha trabajado en dicho negocio, el dinero de su préstamo lo utilizara para hacer un mantenimiento general a su moto para tenerla operativa y seguir haciéndola trabajar el grupo al cual pertenece es nuevo le han puesto como nombre “UNIDAS PARA ALCANZAR EL ÉXITO” nombre que las 8 socias han escogido por que se identifican de esa manera.

*Carmen esta sentada abrasando a la niña.
texts.en:
Carmen is 30 years old and works in the area of cleaning for the municipality of her district.  With her savings, and a great deal of hard work, she has been able to buy herself a moto taxi (a popular means of transportation in Perú).  She rents this vehicle, which generates daily income for her.  Although it’s not a lot of money, it’s another tool for her to make a living with.  What she would like to do in the future is sell the moto and use her savings to buy a plot of land to start her own juice business.  She knows this type of enterprise well, since she has previous experience in it.  

She will use the money from her loan to do general maintenance on her moto, in order to keep it operating and continue working.  She belongs to a group that has called itself “UNITED FOR SUCCESS”, a name chosen by the 8 women members because they can identify with it.

* Carmen is seated, holding the little girl.

loans.use: To maintain her moto-taxi.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
K. Annet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is married and has no children. Annet has been running a retail shop for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar, soap for sale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Annet hopes to own a wholesale shop.  Annet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to play netball.

loans.use: purchase sugar, soap for sale.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” ubicado en el distrito de Azángaro, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 03 hijos, con grado de instrucción de educación secundaria.

La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela  Ramos con un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizara para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de animales caseros.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital y poner una tienda de ropas.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the “Azangarinas Valientes” community bank which is located in Azángaro district, Azángaro province, Puno Department.  She is 32 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 3 children.  She completed her secondary education.

Luz Marina is a new member who has recently begun working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  She will use her loan for 500 nuevos soles to increase the working capital of her business selling domestic animals.

Her dream for the future is to have more capital and to set up a clothes shop.

What she most likes about her community bank are the meetings.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen E., age 58, lives in the Province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. Yen E. is a married woman who is devoted to her four children. All of them are employed in different jobs, and they always share their salary with Yen E. every month. Yen E. and her husband have a few farms that they inherited from their grandparents. This couple now plant peanut and potato on their farmland, and they always get a good result from their crops. In Cambodia, we have two kinds of TV, one is color TV and the other one is black and white TV. People who live in the province use black and white TV, so they use battery to connect with their black and white TV for watching TV and to light their house. In order to earn more income, Yen E.’s husband wants to buy a machine for entering water into battery for his neighbors and other villagers who use black and white TV. That is the reason why Yen E. is requesting a loan from Kiva. Note: Yen E. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a machine for entering water into battery.

loans.name: Esinyen

texts.en:
Esinyen E. is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  He has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town since 2005.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of 20,000 KES in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy dry foodstuff for sell in his shop.

In the future, Esinyen hopes to grow his retail shop to a mini supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase dry foodstuff for his shop

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget K. lives in the Nakulabye Kiyaye neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her father and two sisters. For the last 10 years, she has made a living running a beauty salon. She works seven days a week, both at the salon and by selling beauty products out of her home. She has applied for a loan for 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy cosmetics, creams and hair weaves. Bridget lives in a home that she rents, and has access to electricity and piped-in water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics, creams and hair weaves

loans.name: Raquel De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Raquel  es una pequeña comerciante, que inicio hace cuatro años con sus ventas, de librería, comenzando con pocos productos en el barrio, la ventaja es que no hay negocio cerca, que venta estos productos, lo que le ayudo a la captación de clientes.
Luego para invertir más, comienza hacer financiamiento en donde logra mejores niveles de ventas. 
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo hará la división de los cuartos ya que parte de estos los tiene con sabanas, lo que no tiene condiciones de privacidad. Comprara materiales como: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, piedrín y otros para hacer los intermedios.
texts.en:
Raquel is a small merchant that started with her paper goods sales four years ago.  She started out with just a few items in the neighborhood.  The advantage, however, is that there is no other business nearby that sells the same products which has helped her acquire customers.

She will use the new loan today to subdivide her house into rooms because some of them are marked off with sheets and she has no privacy.  She will buy materials and supplies like:  concrete blocks, cement, iron rods, gravel and others to build the interior walls.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies like: concrete blocks, sand, cement and iron rods to start.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and 5 siblings. He works in a small local restaurant. In parallel, he is pursuing his education at the university. With his business income, he is able to help his father with the education fees.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his university education fees. In the future, he is planning to start his career in an appropriate company where he can use his education skills.

loans.use: to pay for his university education fees

loans.name: Gharib

texts.en:
Gharib G. lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Banjamin. He is married and was unable to finish high school. He has three children – a 23-year-old daughter and two sons (18 and 21). Both Gharib and his wife have been working on the family farm for 25 years. He also helps his relatives with produce grown on the farm. 

He would like a loan to purchase seed potatoes and fertilizer. According to his business plan this investment will increase the family income by 20 percent. His dream is to see all his children happily married. He particularly is looking forward to being a grandfather. He likes living in Banjamin, the village where he was born, surrounded by good friends and his extended family.

loans.use: To purchase seed potatoes and fertilizer

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
O. Matluba is 41 years old. She lives in Dushanbe city with her husband, three sons and two daughters. Her husband is a businessman. 

For over 6 years, Matluba has been running her own business. She is engaged in clothing sales. Matluba sells children’s clothes in the market of Korvon in Dushanbe.  Earlier, she traded in the Center Market.   Matluba orders her goods from China and has a regular supplier.  She has a commercial shop the size of 1.5x2 meters, which she obtained  two years ago.   

Thanks to her business income, Matluba is able to provide for her family and pay for her children’s education.  Matluba would like to get a loan of US$1800 to purchase new goods and expand her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy more children’s clothes to sell in her shop

loans.name: Duo Mujeres Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Duo Mujeres con esperanza:Lidia Veronica G.: inicio su negocio con ventas de cosmeticos luego se dedico a la venta de productos por catalogo y ahora tambien se dedica a la venta de oro puro,a lado de sus hijos es una persona que que ha salido adelante para sequir luchando por su familia su deseo mas grande es ver a sus hijos profecionales ella nos cuenta que solicita este credito para la compra de cosmeticos ya que por la epoca es cuando mas tiene demanda de sus cliente.
Doña Ricarda lucia:de 42 años tiene 2 hijos, ella tiene una tienda de productos comestibles de primera nececidad ella dese seguir invirtiendo en su tienda y asi tener una mas grande ya que a tenido un aumento en su ganacia,ella solicita este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera nececidad y asi generar mas ganacias para poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
"Duo Mujeres con Esperanza" Group:

Lidia Veronica G. began her cosmetic sales business and then began selling products by catalogue.  She also sells pure gold.  Along with her children, she has been able to get ahead by struggling daily in the hope that they will have professional careers.  She plans to use the loan to buy cosmetics because now is the time of year when there is most customer demand.

Doña Ricarda Lucia, age 42, has two children.  She has a grocery store and sells basic needs items.  She wants to continue investing in her store so she can expand and increase her income.  She plans to use the loan to buy basic needs items and generate more earnings to support her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and basic needs groceries

loans.name: Merhamat

texts.ru:
Marhamat yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey smeyoy. Marhamat jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Marhamat B. 26 let. 
On uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uludsheniya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Marhamat is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. Marhamat is married and has one child.  Marhamat B. is 26 years old. 
He has been working as a herdsman for four years.  He started this business with his father.  Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy cows to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Othman

texts.en:
Othman is a young man from Palestine. He has a children's clothing store in the city. Othman finished school but couldn't find a job therefore he started a clothes store.

Othman, who is photographed here, wants to have a good season's returns, so he took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger amount of summer clothes which will attract more customers.

Othman is a man with a good reputation and known for commitment and good manners.

loans.use: to purchase children's summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Chido Group

texts.en:
Lawson is a 58-year-old married man living in the town of Masvingo. He has two children aged 12 and 19, both are attending school. 

Lawson has been running a general store selling groceries and alcohol for five years. He employs five people. He says the main challenges his business faces are financial problems.

Lawson has requested a loan of $400 to buy more groceries. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will improve the welfare of his family.  Lawson sees himself as a wholesaler within the next 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es: La señora Avelina se dedica a la venta de botellas de plástico. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más botellas pues tiene clientes que le compran mucho. Vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos. Avelina cliente se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron ya que pudo mejorar y aumentar su capital de trabajo. Esta es la tercera vez que el crédito va a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Avelina sells plastic bottles. She needs this loan to purchase more bottles because she has customers who buy a lot. She lives in a rental in the Alto Irpavi zone in the city of La Paz. She is a single mother and has two children. Avelina is very happy with the loans she has received because she was able to improve and grow her working capital. This is the third time that she has received a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bottles for selling wholesale to her customers

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with 4 children. She is 29 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store for 4 years.

Jane sells items like detergent soap, vinegar and biscuits. She usually earns about 8000 PHP per month.

Jane is requesting a loan of 18000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, spices, shampoo and other daily use products.

In the future, Jane hopes to expand her store. She also hopes to have a higher income so she can sustain her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, spices and shampoo

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en:
Natiq is a hardworking person and he makes an effort to give his family the best. Natiq is only 29. He is married and has three children. He lives in an internally displaced settlement, carrying out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. With his first loan from AqroInvest, Natiq was able to contribute to his herd and buy additional calves.

With the experience gained over five years in the purchase and sale of cattle, Natiq has been able to bring stability to his family. He is requesting a loan of 1,200 AZN to purchase more cattle to create more income for his large family. Natiq promises to repay his loans as well as his previous ones.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector de 36 años, es soltero, vive en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada  de Pomahuaca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad  agrícola, ganadera y turística (cuenta con museos y sitios arqueológicos muy bonitos).

Desde hace varios años Hector cuenta con un espacio amplio que lo alquila como cochera en al zona donde vive, es un negocio rentable ya que no tiene competencia, con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar todos sus gastos personales.

Ha solicitado Hector un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de un portón metálico de segunda mano pero en buen estado y para ampliar su cochera ya que cuenta con espacio, con los cambios que va realizar sus clientes van aumentar y por lo mismo sus ganancias, lo que le permitirá cubrir su crédito y al tener mejoras económicas, tendrá más comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Hector, age 36, is single and lives in his own home which only has electricity. His home is located in Pomahuaca, which belongs to the Cajamarca department. This zone is characterized by agricultural, livestock, and tourist activity (it has very beautiful archeological sites and museums).

For several years Hector has had a large space, in the zone where he lives, which he rents out as a garage. This is a profitable business because he has no competition. With his income, he is able to cover all of his personal costs.

Hector has requested a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of a second-hand but good-condition metal door, and to expand his garage. These changes will increase his customer base and thus his earnings, which will allow him to pay off his loan and have better economic conditions. He will have more comforts in his home.

loans.use: to purchase a door, and expand his garage.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells different types of frozen meat, fish, and chicken in Elmina, Ghana. She is separated from her husband and has one child. Her husband provides assistance to help care for their child. Her loan will be used to buy additional fresh meat and fish to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an additional refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy additional fresh meat and fish

loans.name: Angela Vanessa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nueva Ciudad Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Angela, tiene 25 años  de edad, está soltera y estudia en el primer semestre de Ing. Comercial en la Universidad Laica de Manta. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por tres  ciclos y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha podido empezar un negocio que le permite ganarse algo para sus estudios.

Es una chica muy trabajadora que además de estudiar en las mañanas le ayuda a sus padres en una tienda de víveres que ellos tienen, en las tardes y en este mismo lugar también se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene tres meses  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien ya que también vende en la Universidad a sus compañeros de clases.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería.

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y llegar a ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Ciudad Alfaro” (New City of Alfaro) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are known nationally and internationally; it’s the place the famous straw hats come from.

Ángela, 25, lives here.  She’s single and is in the first semester of Commercial Engineering at Manta’s Universidad Laica.  She lives in her parents’ house.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and she likes it because the loans have made it possible for her to start a business that allows her to earn a bit for her studies.

She is a very hardworking young woman who besides going to classes in the morning helps her parents in a grocery store they have.  During the afternoon she also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories) in the same place.  She sells on credit and collects payments weekly.  She’s been in this activity for three months and does very well since she also sells to her university classmates.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.  Her dreams are to finish her studies and become a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
A caring lady, Razia carries out her responsibilities as a housewife by staying at home. She makes the utmost effort in providing comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs.  She is known in her community for her hospitality. She is always ready to help her family members and in general. No one gets complaints from her on any reason.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who operates a computer center where he sells computer parts (cables, computer mouse and keyboards etc) to his customers on reasonable rates. He sells the genuine items, and that’s why people prefer buying from him than others. With the loan, he will buy computer parts to put in his shop for selling. 

Razia is confident that her husband’s business will be established better after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy computer parts for resale.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 53 years old and married with seven children. Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Edna has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store  for a year and also earns an income from raising pigs. Edna aspires to save enough in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for resale.

loans.name: Tsatsral

texts.en:
Tsatsral is a 27-year-old young lady entrepreneur who has two children, who are two and four years old. Both of them attend kindergarten. Her family lives in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, which is located in the outer ger district (a district without basic infrastructure) of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 

Tsatsral has been supporting her family by operating a clothing retail stall at the largest outdoor market of Mongolia, for six years, with the help of her spouse.  She usually sells women's clothes, which she imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. As she is a friendly person, she has already had her own constant customers. 

Tsatsral wants to expand her business in order to increase her working capital. So she is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase clothes from Ereen city to sell for this high shopping season. Her long-term goal is to improve her living conditions by renovating her current small house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David, es uno de los microempresarios que lleva tres prestamos, los cuales a invertido en el taller, actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo, que lo utilizara para comprar repuestos (neumáticos para llantas, carburadores, cadenas y tubos) de esa forma tendrá todo lo necesario para trabajar y poder darles un buen servicio a sus clientes, dichos prestamos le han servido para compararse repuestos y hasta el momento ha mostrado buena moral de pago.
El sueño de David, crecer en su negocio y aumentar en clientes.
texts.en:
David is a microentrepreneur who has had three loans which he has invested in his workshop.  The current loan he is requesting is to buy repair parts (tires, carburetors, chains and pipes) so he will have all the materials necessary to give his customers good service.  The loans he has had to date have allowed him to buy repair parts and so far he has been good about paying on time.

David's dream is to expand his business and increase his customer base.

loans.use: To buy tires, chains and pipes for his workship.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan produces doors, windows and overhangs. He needs to make some financial investments to purchase new machines for production. With new machines he will be able to make the production process more effective and make products with more quality. This is very important for him to meet his clients' demands and attract new ones. The development of his business will help Vardan to increase the business income and ensure a brighter future for his family. Vardan lives together with his wife and two sons.

loans.use: to pay for new production machines.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a Kenyan and married with two children aged two and ten. His wife operates a grocery shop and he runs a metal shop in which he makes cookers, iron boxes and other items. The business is located in a busy market downtown and the customers he gets are those around the area. The challenge he faces is the high cost of purchasing the scrap metal. He is using his loan of kes 30,000 to buy scrap metal to grow his business and get more income to take care of his family. His future dream is to become a leading supplier of the items he sells. He describes himself as very hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal

loans.name: Felictus

texts.en: Felictus lives in Kampala, Uganda with her five children, two of whom are currently enrolled in school. She also helps support one other member of her family. She works seven days a week at two jobs: selling bananas and cleaning the facilities of the Kampala City Council. She is applying for a loan for 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas to sell to her customers. Her main business challenges are the high cost of transportation and the seasonal nature of her work. Her goal for the future is to help improve her family's living standards. She lives in her own house but does not have access to electricity or piped-in water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and providing food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel es mecánico tiene 20 años dedicándose a este oficio, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Donde su vivienda  es pequeña por lo que empezó a construir mas cuartos en la planta alta, pero le esta haciendo falta la losa de concreto ya que necesitan sus hijos su propio espacio en la casa. 
Desea tener un mejor patrimonio, seguridad y comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is a mechanic who has 20 years of experience in that profession; he is married and has two children.  His house is small, and therefore he started constructing more rooms on the top floor.  However, he lacks concrete slabs for construction, and his children need their own space in the house.
Juan Manuel wants his family to have more wealth, security, and comfort.

loans.use: to purchase concrete slabs for construction.

loans.name: Faiz Elahi's Group

texts.en:
Faiz Elahi is 48 years old, very active and performs her routine tasks very well. She also sews clothes for her neighboring clients to earn income for her family. She started this business long time ago because her husband who is a tailor was not able to fulfill the financial needs of the family alone.
Faiz has given birth to 3 sons and a daughter. All of them are attached to sewing and tailoring profession.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further improvement of her sewing business. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her finishing the orders on time and increase her profits.
She is confident that an investment will help making her business more profitable and she will be able to buy some dowry for her daughter who is now near to marriage age.
Note: "In the photo, the lady who has raised her hand is Faiz elahi."

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, Salome has operated a grocery business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge with delayed payments from those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer demand. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, cabbages and green vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, cabbages and green vegetables.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 23 años, es una mujer buena, amable y trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene una hija de tres años, viven en una casa propia en donde comparten la alegría de educar y criar a su hija por quien hacen todos los esfuerzos y sacrificios necesarios para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Elena consiste en la venta de golosinas y productos de consumo de preferencia de los niños, posee un puesto en donde realiza su venta de golosinas. Éste se encuentra ubicada en uno de los parques mas concurridos de su ciudad, su día normalmente comienza a las 8 de la mañana y termina pasadas las 6 de la tarde.
