ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bhyanti

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Bhyanti M.. She is married and has 3 children, ages 35, 30 and 22. In 1995, she established her general store. She supports her family working 7 hours a day, 6 days a week. She wishes to use this loan from Patan BPW to increase the inventory of her store. In the future, Bhyanti plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her general store.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An H. (pictured with her loom), is a widow with five children, three sons and two daughters. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

An has been a silk weaver since she was young. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase silk material for continuing her weaving business. She will use a part of her loan to buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials and buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighbors and local clients in order to earn the money to help fulfill the basic needs of her family. She is married to G. N., who drives a three-wheeled rickshaw and provides transport services to his clients. They own and reside in a two-room brick house in a housing colony named Al-badar, located in Arifwala, which is a small city in Punjab that is famous for its dairy industry. They have two sons and three daughters.  

Kosar is a very caring mother and has raised her children very well. Due to poor financial conditions, she was only able to manage to provide for the education of her first three children, but she is hopeful that with the help of better income she will be able to send her remaining children to school as well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to apply toward her husband’s business. The tires on the rickshaw are worn down and direly in need of replacement. With the loan, her husband will repair his rickshaw. Kosar is hopeful that with this loan investment her husband’s income will be improved and her family will be able to live in a better financial condition. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has responsibly paid her installments and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To repair the rickshaw and replace its tires

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartoons of fish, dried meat, crab etc.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget C., 58, is married and resides with her husband and seven children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat temple. C. is a housewife, while her husband is a carpenter and a farmer who earns an income of about 5 USD per day. She has to spend 30 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 50 USD on other necessary expenses every month. She is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase fertilizer to use on her rice field. In the future, she plans to use any additional income to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.'s husband appears in the photograph because C. was not available.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to use on her rice field

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a 35 years old married man and father of three children, living in Bint Jbeil. Salim has sold fruits and vegetables since 2009.His business is new and he is constantly improving it. It’s the only suitable business in his area  and his clients claim his that  products are of good quality. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy stands to continue upgrading his shop. In this way he can add more space to add more products to put on display. Salim hopes to open a wholesale market in the future.

loans.use: To continue upgrading his shop

loans.name: George

texts.en: K. George is an individual client from Rukungiri.  He is 35 years old and married with 2 children. George is an agriculturalist involved in the growing and sale of matooke (bananas of the plantain type) from Kyatoko.  He sells to both the local people and travelers.  He is able to make an average profit of 260,000, in addition to the sale of coffee and a retail shop he has in the same area. George needs a loan to be able to upgrade his 6-year-old banana plantation to give him more revenue. He is a very hardworking gentleman and plans to build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: To upgrade plantation

loans.name: Los Gemelos Group

texts.es:
Marco forma parte del banco comunal “Los Gemelos” conformado por 21 emprendedores pertenecientes a la comuna de Maipú. En la foto se encuentra al centro y usa un gorro blanco y sus lentes encima.
El negocio de Marco consiste en la elaboración y venta de productos de panadería y pastelería en su casa, desde hace más de 2 años. También hace 4 meses, se dedica a la venta de helados de máquina, ya que la venta de los productos de panadería disminuye en el tiempo de calor. 
Marco comenzó con su negocio independiente, cuando se dio cuenta, por su experiencia laboral, que el trabajo de panadero no es muy conveniente. Su esposa, quien también trabaja con Fondo Esperanza,  lo apoya en el negocio. 
Con este préstamo comprará mezclas para los helados y barquillos.  
Su sueño es tener una amasandería.
Tiene dos hijos: un niño de 11 años y una pequeña de 5 años.
A Marco lo que más le gusta de Fondo Esperanza es la oportunidad que le dan a los emprendedores, cuando les entregan los préstamos, para salir adelante con sus negocios. Además para él los créditos han sido un gran apoyo para mantener su negocio.
Maipú es una comuna ubicada al este de Santiago, capital de Chile, región Metropolitana. Designada como la comuna más grande de Chile es llamada Cuna de la Patria debido a importantes hechos históricos ocurridos en esas tierras durante la época de la Independencia, como la Batalla y el Abrazo de Maipú entre los libertadores de Chile Bernardo O´Higgins y Argentina, San Martín.
texts.en:
Marco is part of the "Los Gemelos" (Twins) community bank which has 21 entrepreneurial members who live in the town of Maipú.  In the photo, Marco is in the middle wearing a white cap with sunglasses on top.

Marco's business is making and selling bakery and confectionery products in his home.  He has been doing this for more than 2 years.  He has also been selling ice cream from an ice cream machine since sales of his baked products fall during the hot weather.  Marco started his own business when he realized, through his own work experience, that a baker's work isn't very convenient.  His wife, who also works with Fondo Esperanza, supports him in his business.

He will use his loan to buy mix for his ice creams and cones.  His dream is to own an 'amasanderia' (a type of Chilean bakery).  Marco has two children: an 11 year-old boy and a 5 year-old girl.  What Marco most likes about Fondo Esperanza is the opportunity that they give entrepreneurs when they provide them with loans to get ahead in their businesses.  Also, the loans have been a great support to him in keeping his business running.

Maipú is a town located to the east of Santiago, capital of Chile, in the Metropolitan region.  Designed as the biggest town in Chile it is called the 'Birthplace of the Nation' owing to the important historic events that have taken place on these lands during the Independence period such as the Battle and Embrace of Maipú between the liberators of Chile, Bernardo O'Higgins, and Argentina, San Martín.

loans.use: Mix for ice cream and cones

loans.name: Jebrael

texts.en:
Jebrael A. is an ambitious man – the hardships in his life didn't stop him from finding a way to take care of his daughter, two sons and wife. Jebrael doesn't have enough money or a degree to start his own shop. He started with a small amount of capitA., buying a small number of gift items and home items to sell door-to-door. Jebrael also sells souvenirs, as Bethlehem is a tourist attraction.

Jebrael now has customers who ask him for certain gift items and home items that he buys and brings to them. He came to FATEN and took out a loan to purchase a large number of items ordered by his customers.

Jebrael appears in the picture above.

loans.use: To purchase gift items to sell

loans.name: Reemberto Fabian

texts.es:
En EL Barrio Santa Clara de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Activas.

Aquí conocimos a Remberto, el tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, en la cual vive con sus padres y sus hermanos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace  tres ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer y los intereses son muy bajos.

Tiene un taxi amigo en el cual trabaja todos los días, esto lo hace a la par de sus ventas ya que también se dedica a la venta de ropa, le ayudan su hermana y su mamá ya que cuando el tiene que realizar una carrera le atienden su negocio, también aprovecha que tiene su carro para realizar sus ventas a domicilio, visita a sus clientes para entregar su productos y realizar los cobros ya que deja a crédito. Sus productos los compra en  Guayaquil.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Sus sueños son tener su licencia de chofer profesional y tener un autobús.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) communal bank meets every two weeks in the Santa Clara neighborhood in the city of Manta known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by national and foreign tourists because it’s one of the country’s and America’s most important ports on the Pacific.

This is where we met Remberto, 19.  He’s single and lives in his parents’ house with his parents and siblings.  He’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and likes it because the loans are easy to make and interest is very low.

He drives an informal taxi every day and also is a clothing retailer.  His sister and mother help him out because if he has to do a taxi run they help him tend to the sales.  He also takes advantage of the fact that he has a car to do door to door sales; he visits his customers to deliver merchandise and collect payments since he sells on credit.  He buys his products in Guayaquil.

He will use this loan to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  His dream is to get a professional driver’s license and own a bus.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Achan

texts.en:
Achan sells alcohol.  She is 45 years old, married, with nine children.  Four of them go to school. 

Achan needs a loan to stock more alcohol to sell.  She hopes to build a house to rent to others, with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi T. is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a fisherman and he contributes to the provision of family basic needs from his earnings. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Mwanamisi has operated a fresh water selling business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the hot, dry season when availability of water is low. She dreams of expanding her business and living a comfortable life in the future.

 She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase a tank to reserve more water.

loans.use: to purchase a tank to reserve more water.

loans.name: Norik

texts.en: Norik P. lives with his wife and mother in Tolors, a village in the Syunik region. Norik is disabled. He works as a school guard. However, the main income for this household comes from farming and land cultivation. Norik has applied for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel for the spring season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Duo Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
Duo Vista Hermosa: lo Integran Albertina C., Delfina C., ellas son casadas tiene dos hijos viven con su esposo y viven en diferentes aldeas.
Albertina C. se dedica a la venta  de guipiles tipicos ella encarga la elavoracion de guipiles de diferentes estilos y colores y entrega los pedidos de guipiles en su municipio cada 11 dias ella entrega 40 a 50 guipiles y 25 fajas tipicas de diferentes colores.ella nos cuenta que nececita el credito para la compra de ropa tipica ya que tiene mucha denanda de sus clientes.
las dos se dedican a la venta de ropa tipica y nececitan capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
The "DUO VISTA HERMOSA" Group is comprised of Albertina C. and Delfina C., each of whom is married, has two children and live with their husbands in different villages.  Albertina C. sells typical "guipiles" which she orders in different styles and colores.  She makes delivery of 40 to 50 guipiles and 25 typical girdles in different colors every 11 days.  She needs the loan to buy the clothing since there is a high demand among customers.

Both members sell typical clothing and need working capital.

loans.use: To buy wholesale typical clothing

loans.name: Isaie

texts.en:
Isaie is 31 years old and married with two children, aged 2 and 5. He has a store selling foodstuffs such as tomatoes, rice, beans, and cassava flour.  His business is well organized, and he employs one person to help him. He has five years of experience and is open from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.

Isaie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more foodstuffs. He will reinvest the profits in his business.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs such as tomatoes, rice, beans, and cassava flour.

loans.name: Lulongo Sanyu Group

texts.en: 27 year old Florence has been running a food sales business for 6 years now in Lulongo food market in Mubende. The happily married mother of 5 says selling many of the cash crops she grows and harvests from her farming gardens has significantly impacted on the welfare of her family. She says she has been able to earn disposable income, which enables her to make ends meet on a daily basis, and that her weekly business profits are about 100,000 shillings. With this loan she is going to purchase better fertilizers for her farming gardens. She reckons this will improve her crop yields, which in the long run will mean selling her crops at a higher market price.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to use in her farming gardens.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo, 45 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. He has been growing corn for almost 25 years. At the last cropping, his net income was 8,000 PHP. He's asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. He would like to maintain his relationship with Kiva lenders to request larger loans in the future so that he can grow his corn farm productively.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Mirna Del Socorrro

texts.es:
La señora Mirna del Socorro es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es docente en la escuela rural de Caña de Castilla. Ella es casada con el señor Benito quien se dedica a la agricultura y tiene cuatro hijos los cuales son su inspiración. 

El crédito de ella es personal ella lo utilizara para mejoras de la infraestructura del hogar.
texts.en:
Mirna del Socorro is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She is a teacher at a rural elementary school in Caña de Castilla.  She is married to Benito, who works in agriculture, and has four children who are her inspiration.

This loan is for personal use.  Mirna del Socorro will use the loan to make improvements to her home's infrastructure.

loans.use: to improve her home's infrastucture (roof)

loans.name: Seoung

texts.en: Seoung, 29, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Seoung sells groceries, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 90 on food and USD 4 on the other necessary expenses. Seoung is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Arcily

texts.en:
Arcily is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Arcily has a retail shop that sells fruit and green bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional stock of fruit and vegetables.

Arcily is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Arcily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, sugar and herbs and spices for making her tamales and atol

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 56 years old and married to Stephen. Together they are blessed with three grown-up children. She practices farming in the area of Kasarani. She has been in this business for the last six years and gets an income of KES 6,000 per month.

She is applying for her fourth loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase seeds and rent more shambas (plots of land). She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business and educate her last born to college level.

She hopes to complete her house and buy more shambas for farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and rent more shambas (plots of land)

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela, D. 48 años, es una mujer emprendedora que no le teme a los retos ni al trabajo, esta casada y es madre D. dos hijas D. 20 y 12 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas. El trabajo D. Estela consiste en atender su propio multiservicios que tiene en su casa, esta muy implementado y tiene D. todo, además ella presta sus servicios como costurera, lleva con este trabajo ya cinco años, lo hace con sus hijas quienes le ayudan cuando ella esta un poco ocupada con la costura. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que pueD. hacer dos actividades al mismo tiempo, además siempre tiene ingresos y muy buenos clientes ya que ahora tiene un contrato con una tienda D. disfraces a quienes abastece semanalmente. Espera mas adelante poder ampliar su multiservicios, además D. instalar un taller donD. pueda coser con mayor comodidad. Este es el crédito número 8 con MFP y esta muy contenta D. trabajar con su grupo ya que los considera buenos copañeros D. trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos para su multiservicio y algunos pequeños materiales para la costura, como hilos y telas.
texts.en:
Estela, aged 48, is an enterprising woman who is not afraid of challenges or work. She is married and the mother of two daughters, aged 20 and 12. She lives in her own house with her husband and her two daughters.

Estela's work consists in running her multiservice business in her home. It is well implemented in her neighborhood and has everything. In addition, Estela offers her services as a seamstress. She has had this business for already five years. She runs it with her daughters who help her when she is busy sewing. She likes her work because she can do two activities at the same time, she has always an income and she has very good customers. Currently she has a contract with a costume store with weekly deliveries. She also hopes to expand her multiservice business and set up a workshop where she can sew more comfortably.

This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very happy to work with her group because her fellow members are good colleagues. Estela will use her loan to buy products for her multiservice business and a few small items for her sewing activity, such as threads and fabrics.

loans.use: to buy threads and fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy products

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 46 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with four school-aged children. 

Tessie runs a retail store at home selling assorted items like coffee, milk, soft drinks, "checheria", canned goods, noodles, sugar, salt and other basic necessities needed by everyone. She has had this business for ten years already. It is done on a credit and cash basis.  She earns approximately PHP 1,000 a month from store operations. She has requested a loan  of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to invest in expanding the range products to sell.

Tessie joined the GDMPC family earlier this year. This is the first loan ever she'd made in the cooperative. In the future, Tessie hopes to obtain good return from this investment and acquire enough revolving funds for the business. She plans to expand and improve the current business and offer more products soon.

loans.use: To invest in expanding range of products to sell.

loans.name: Zivamutunyo Kyamujanju Group

texts.en: Agatha is a member of Zivamutunyo Kyamujanju Group. She is married with a child aged 8-months and lives in a rented house in Karuguuza, Uganda. She has a retail shop and she has been operating it for 6 months. She started by buying 2 calves, reared them and then sold them to start the retail shop. She faces a challenge of thieves who break into her shop and her dream is wholesale shop. Agatha needs the loan to buy rice, paraffin and tea leaves to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”ATIPAY”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Ligia; La socia tiene 45 años de edad, la socia es casada , la socia tiene 1 hijo de 20 años y trabaja en una empresa de telefonía y ella paralelamente a esto desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de ropa para vender a sus amistades, la socia solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de ropa.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Ligia, 45, is a member of the “Atipay” communal bank which is located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.  She’s married and has a 20-yar-old son.  She works for a telecommunications firm but also sells clothes among her acquaintances and wants to use the loan to buy clothes.  She’s asking for the loan to buy clothes.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 48 years old, married to an accountant and has four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in bulk in South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.
Victoria has requested this loan through Kiva partner, BRAC South Sudan, to order for more charcoal for resale. She will use her profits to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Miri

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 56 years old, married, and the father of four children, one of whom works.

Miri has owned a food market since 2001. He sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products, and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs as well as sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there is a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2100 in order to repair and fix his market’s walls and floors and to make new showcases. He is aiming to earn more profits so he will have the opportunity to provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to repair his market and make new showcases.

loans.name: Guillermo Enrrique

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien inicio hace 10 años con un pequeño puesto de refracciones de bicicleta. En el cual invertirá el crédito con la compra de los siguientes productos como ejes traseros, pedales, candados, llantas y neumáticos.
Él está casado con la señora Gema quien es comerciante en el mercado local.
texts.en:
Sr. Guillermo is a hardworking and enterprising gentleman. Ten years ago, he started a small bicycle repair shop. He will invest this loan in the purchase of the following supplies: rear axles, pedals, locks, rims, and tires.

Guillermo is married to Sra. Gema, who is a merchant at the local market.

loans.use: to buy rear axles, pedals, locks, rims, and tires.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar, de 31 años de edad, habitante de Condega municipio de Estelí, tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad. El es comerciante dueño de una pulpería. Comenzó con este negocio Hace 5 años cuando regreso de Costa Rica en donde trabajo y con lo que gano regreso  a su pueblo y estableció su pulpería  con ayuda de su madre y su esposa el administra la venta donde el realiza las comprar para surtir la venta y ellas le ayudan atender ele negocio. Adicional el da clases de ingles en un instituto vocacional para jóvenes donde este tipo de enseñanzas en muy poca ya que la mayoría de los jóvenes e dedican a labores del campo y no tienen mucho acceso económico para estudiar. 
El requiere el préstamo para surtir su pulpería de productos tales como enlatados, detergentes, gaseosas, jugos, pan, leche, huevo, pollo, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite ya que son parte del inventario que más buscan sus clientes y de los cuales necesita mantener surtida su pulpería para vender. Entre sus planes según nos cuenta el desea convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora de alimentos.
texts.en:
Cesar, 31, lives in a neighborhood of Esteli called Condega.  He has an 11-year old son.  He owns a general store, a business that he started 5 years ago after returning from Costa Rica.  He used the money that he earned before to stock the store and his wife and mother help him tend it.  He also teaches English to young people at a local vocational school.  The classes are welcome because it's not easy for local youths, most of whom work on area farms, to raise enough money to pay school fees.
Cesar will use the loan to buy supplies of canned goods, detergents, soft drinks, juices, bread, milk, eggs, chicken, rice, sugar, beans and cooking oil, all of which are products that his customers most want to buy.  In the future, he would like to develop a wholesale supply business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his general store.

loans.name: Shangalamwe A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Shangalamwe A Group in Western Kenya! Grace is the facilitator of the Shangalamwe A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Grace  takes care of one child at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Grace had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 17 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Grace was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Grace  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Grace will educate her child and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Shangalamwe A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Carmen Pilar

texts.es:
Carmen Pilar tiene 24 años es soltera, vive  con el hijo de 5 meses de edad  y los padres. Vive en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas.

Ventanilla VALLE ALTO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.
Carmen Pilar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es tener dinero para su hijo por que es madre soltera.

Le gusta  cuidar con su hijo.
texts.en:
Carmen Pilar is 24 years old.  She is single and lives with her 5-month-old son and parents in Voluntad de Dios, in Ventanas canton.

The Valle Alto community bank is located in Voluntad de Dios, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Carmen Pilar is a farmer who grows corn.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas and makes her sales in Ventanas market.  She requested this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The loan will help her to increase her income which will allow her to provide for her family and invest in her farming.  Her dream is to have money for her son because she is a single mother.  She likes to take care of her son.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 51 years old, married to Benson, and they are blessed with two children. She has been in a quarry business for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 10,000. which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Margaret will use the loan to buy a quarry ground. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to buy a lorry for transporting the stones, which will increase her income and help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy a quarry ground.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN II sont  toutes des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à BARAKOLOBOUGOU, un des villages de la  préfecture de Dioïla.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MAMA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the SABOUGNOUMAN II  group are married women who, on average, are 31 years old with four children.  Most of them live in polygamous families in Barakolobougou, one of the villages of the Dioïla Cercle.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season.  They grow millet and groundnut.  They are on their fifth loan with the institution.

With this new loan, Mama (second from the left in the sitting row) is planning to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment, and to pay for the cost of plowing on roughly 0.25 hectare of land where she cultivates groundnut.

Crop production is sold after the harvest in the town of Fana, to both men and women customers.

She expects to make an average profit of 80,000 CFA francs per season. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of plowing and weeding, to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small equipment.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay is 48 years old and married. Her family consists of her husband and five children, one of whom just graduated from high school this year. Chhay and her husband manage a rice farming business on their own land in Kampong Cham province. Farming is the sole source of their income. Chhay wanted to support her daughter in her education at the university in Phnom Penh, but her family’s resources are very limited and she can’t afford to send her daughter to school. For this reason she would like to borrow a loan of 1,600 US dollars to cover the four-year program costs of her daughter. Her daughter, Sokunthea, plans to enter the Faculty of Accounting and Finance at Western University in Phnom Penh. Chhay has complete confidence in her daughter that she is committed to her course, and believes that education is one of the key factors to alleviate the poverty. Chhay and her daughter appreciate the help of people all around the world who have contributed their funds to programs like Kiva via its partners, HKL, which will allow students from low-income families to continue their educations.

loans.use: to cover the four-year program costs of her daughter.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 39 años de edad, se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que tenía 15 años de edad, desde esa edad le comenzó a ayudar a su padre quien toda su vida la dedico a la agricultura, ahora él  trabaja en dicha actividad y decidió emprender esta actividad porque está cerca de su casa y ha sido una tradición en la familia, además no tuvo la oportunidad de poder prepararse académicamente ya que su padre no pudo darle todos los estudios, su padre ayuda a cultivar el maíz.  Ahora en día  Pedro quiere cultivar cinco hectáreas  de terreno y darle  un mejor inversión  a su cultivo.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar semilla, abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, pago de mano de obra, cultivar las 5 hectáreas de terreno. Su nivel de vida mejorara debido a que tendrán un mejor ingreso económico, el cual servirá para pagar la cuota del crédito y ayudar un poco más a sus padres y así  tener más posibilidades de superarse y llevar una vida más tranquila.

El sueño de  Pedro es de poder cultivar mas tierras,  para tener mayores ingresos para que su hijo pueda graduarse de la escuela y así poder seguir con sus estudios, ya que él no tubo esa oportunidad pero quiere que su hijo pueda tener sus estudios y sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda del crédito.
texts.en:
Pedro is 39 years old. He has made a living from agriculture since he was 15 years old. From that age he began to help his father who all of his life worked in agriculture. Now, he works in that sector. He decided to undertake this activity because it is close to his home and has been a family tradition. Furthermore, he did not have the opportunity to be able to prepare himself academically since his father was not able to provide studies to him as his father helped cultivate corn. Currently, Pedro wants to cultivate five hectares of land and provide a better investment to his crops.

The loan that he is requesting is to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, and to pay farmhands to cultivate the five hectares of land. His standard of living will improve since he will have a better income which will be used to make the loan payments and to help his parents a little more. Thus, he will have a greater possibility of improving himself and having a more peaceful life.

Pedro’s dream is to be able to cultivate more land to have a higher income so that his son is able to graduate from school and so be able to continue with his studies since he did not have this opportunity. He wants his son to study and he knows that he can do so with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, and to pay farmhands to cultivate 5 hectares of land.

loans.name: Raban

texts.en:
Raban is a farmer rearing chicken and goats. He is from Kagadi- Uganda and has been in Poultry farming most of his life. Through farming he has been able to build a house and educate his 4 children. In future, he wants to buy a vehicle to help him in transporting his chicken and goats to the city.
He wants a loan to buy chicken for rearing.

loans.use: To buy chicken for rearing

loans.name: Muhammed

texts.en:
Muhammed is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He is hard working person. He is 48. He married and has 2 children. He began his business 18 years ago and it allows him to support to his family. He borrowed the amount of $400 to renovate for repairing cars. Muhammed is mechanic. He has been engaged in this business for 8 years. He works as the master. The second time he borrowed the loan amount of $800 and with this loan he enlarged and renovated the area of his garage. 
Muhammed applies for a loan amount of $400 to buy the spare parts and to expand his business area.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts and to expand his business area

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Anna would like to buy sacks of flour, sugar, salt, packs of laundry detergents and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: M. Ismayil is 46. He has been an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorniy Karabakh since 1993. He is married and has 3 children. He  opened his small private trade a year ago and now he is going to improve his business, enlarging the store on a $1200 loan he borrowed  from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: reconstruct his small market to a supermarket

loans.name: Yous

texts.en: Mrs. Yous N. is a 48 year old widow living in Kampong Cham Province with her two children.  She works by farming their land, and also selling liters of gasoline.  Her children help her to sell gasoline to motor-bikes and cars traveling by.  The family can earn nearly $10/day when they pool their income.  They currently don't have the capital to purchase more gasoline to sell, even though they know it is profitable.  They will use this loan to purchase more gasoline to sell.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline

loans.name: Sabuhi

texts.en: Mr. Sabuhi is  a low income, vulnerable man. He is 25 and lives with his parents in Saatli city in the central part of Azerbaijan Republic. Sabuhi has a herd of five cows. He started his business five years ago when he bought his first cow with money he had saved up. He purchases young calfs, breeds them and then sells them in the city market. The business is profitable, but requires investment from time to time. Sabuhi plans to increase the number of animals in the herd and his application has been approved in Normicro Saatli branch for $500. He hopes he can successfully collaborate with this micro credit organization and with KIVA.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline O. is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives with her family in Benin City, where she operates a hairdressing saloon. She fixes and braids hair for people, and has been doing this for two years. She is seeking a loang of $250 to enable her to buy more hair products to expand her business. Roseline plans to repay the loan in 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more relaxers and hair cream

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia is a member of the community bank La Amistad in the district and province of Moyabamba, in the department (region) of San Martín. She works selling groceries in her house, which is located on Jaen Street in the Vista Alegre neighborhood of the city of Moyabamba. She started her business with a credit from the community bank and went along growing her business, little by little. She started with a table on which she displayed a few products. The business has grown thanks to her effort and the good service she provides to her clients. Lucia decided to start the business despite not being able to count on the support of her husband because she is a very hard working person with good business skills. What's more, generating her own income nourishes her self esteem and allows her to contribute to the expenses of helping her children get ahead.

This loan of 1800 soles (Peruvian currency), which she'll repay in 4 months, will buy groceries such as rice, sacks of sugar, boxes of milk of many different sizes and brands, boxes of oil, packages of detergents, boxes of noodles, onions, sacks of garlic, and other products to better stock her business. She wants her clients to find what they are looking for when they come to her store; her sales are stronger when she offers a variety of merchandise. She takes advantage of the fact that she has no competition in her neighborhood.

Lucia is 37 years old with 3 children. She now has her husband's help in the business, as well. Lucia is happy with what she does and satisfied by the resuilts she has achieved up to now. Her clientele has grown, which also has helped her improve her economic situation and contribute to covering the family 's expenses. Her goal is to one day have a kiosk across from her house. A grade school is currently under construction there, and she wants to be prepared when it opens for classes so that she can increase her business by selling refreshments.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lucia es socia del banco comunal La Amistad del distrito y provincia de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su casa que está ubicada en el Jr. Jaen S/N del sector Vista Alegre de la ciudad de Moyabamba. Se inició con el crédito del banco comunal y poco a poco fue creciendo. Se inició en una mesa con algunos productos. En la actualidad el negocio ha ido creciendo gracias a su empeño y la buena atención que les brinda a sus clientes. Decidió iniciar el negocio a pesar de no contar con el apoyo de su esposo porque ella es una persona muy trabajadora y hábil para el negocio, además genera sus propios ingresos, alimenta su autoestima y le permite apoyar con los gastos que requiere para sacar adelante a sus hijos.

El préstamo de S/. 1 800.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará abarrotes como arroz, azúcar en sacos, cajas de leche de diferentes marcas y tamaños, aceite en cajas, paquetes de detergentes, fideos en cajas, cebolla , ajos en sacos, y otros productos para surtir mejor su negocio porque quiere que sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan, cuando hay variedad aumentan las ventas. Ella aprovecha que no tiene competencia en su barrio.

Tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, ahora cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, está contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos hasta la fecha, su clientela aumentó, eso también ayudó a que mejore su situación económica y apoye en los gastos familiares. Su meta es contar con un kiosco al frente de su casa, porque al frente se está terminando de construir un instituto y quiere estar preparada para cuando inicien las clases para ampliar su negocio con la venta de refrigerios.

loans.use: Buy groceries as inventory: rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Kamuli A4 (Iii) Group

texts.en:
Christine is 35 years old and married with six children. Her current business is tailoring. Edith sells used clothes and wants to use the loan to add in stock. Catherine sells raw foods. Jalia is a charcoal seller and wants to use the loan to add in stock.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to invest more in their tailoring, used clothing, food and charcoal businesses.

loans.name: Bath

texts.en: Mrs. Bath L., 45, works as a grocery vendor making an average of $1.50 a day of profit. Her husband Mr. Moy Sareth, 46, works as a construction laborer making an average of $1 a day of profit to sustain and provide a better life for his family. They have 7 children, two of which work as laborers in Thailand normally earning around $2 each per day. Another one of their children is also a laborer but works in the Siem Reap province typically earning $1 a day of profit. This couple hopes to use this loan to buy housing supplies to build a house. They hope to receive a loan of $500 from KIVA.

loans.use: Use this loan to purchase housing supplies

loans.name: Santos Domingo

texts.es:
Mr. Santos is a very happy and sociable 52-year-old man. He says he is a happily married man with a hard-working woman who has supported him in achieving all of his dreams. They have 6 children and they would have liked to have more. Five of them work and one studies. The Santos family is one that loves working and agriculture. The whole family works together to harvest an area of Pineapple, and one of coffee and bananas. It has been 28 years since Mr. Santos began working the land he loves so much. His wife sells the products that harvest and buys other products from producing neighbors so she can sell them at the Oriental market, one of the largest in the capital. Mr. Santos also earns some extra income by transporting products from other producers from the fields to the markets using his truck. Mr. Santos is requesting a loan to acquire agricultural supplies which are necessary to maintain the crops. His dream is that his children inherit the love to work the land that with great effort he and his wife acquired, and that some day their children will inherit.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Santos es un hombre alegre y muy sociable de 52 años de edad, dice que es un hombre felizmente casado con una mujer trabajadora que lo ha apoyado en todos sus sueños, tienen 6 hijos y hubiera querido tener mas, 5 de ellos trabajan y 1 estudian aun, son familia de amor al trabajo y la agricultura. Todos apoyan en el trabajo de cultivo de 1 manzana de Piña 1 manzana de café y 1 manzana de plátano, tiene 28 años trabajando la tierra que tanto ama. Su esposa comercializa lo que ellos producen y compran a otros vecinos productores para vender en el mercado Oriental, uno de los mas grandes de la capital. También tienen una camioneta de tina que él maneja y trabaja haciendo viajes a otros productores y gana por cada viaje del campo a los mercados en donde los comercializan. Este señor solicita el crédito para insumos agrícolas que son necesarios para el debido mantenimiento de la cosecha. Su sueño es que sus hijos hereden el amor al trabajo a la tierra que con gran esfuerzo adquirieron sus padres y algún día heredaran con amor.

loans.use: To Purchase Agricultural Supplies

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Mrs. Lang K. is a 46-year-old farmer who makes about $2 per day. Her husband makes about $1 per day making palm sugar. They live in Boeung Ghort village, Siem Reap province, and have six children, two of whom are married and three of whom are young. K. requests a loan of $250 to purchase rice stock to resell. This loan will help improve their business and increase family income.

loans.use: To purchase rice stock to resell

loans.name: Dina Margarita

texts.es:
Señora Dina Margarita belongs to the Communal Bank of the Americas, located at Jr. Emancipación Mz. F Lt. 30, in the Calleria District of the Ucayali Department. She is 49 years old and is the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a merchant. With the first loan of S/. 300 that Dina received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a small grocery store.

Now she has a store that is stocked with various products like grains and textiles. With the help of her children she manages the business and household chores.

With this loan of S/, 1,000, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy: 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 sack of salt, preserves, vermicelli noodles, milk, cold cuts, sweets, sodas, etc.

Dina is now able to meet certain objectives like educating her children, which is the reason for all her effort. At the end of her professional career, it will give her much satisfacion to know that all that she is doing is bearing fruit that will improve the lives of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dina Margarita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Américas, ubicado en el Jr. Emancipación Mz. F Lt. 30, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, es así que Dina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta de abarrotes. En la actualidad tiene una bodega que esta surtiD. de varios productos de pan llevar, también con pasamanería, con la ayuD. de sus hijos atienden el negocio y se distribuyen las tareas domesticas. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de sal, conservas, fideos, leche, embutidos, golosinas, gaseosas, etc. Dina ahora puede lograr algunos objetivos que como la educación de sus hijos que a base de mucho esfuerzo están terminado su carrera profesional, eso la hace muy feliz saber que todo lo que hace esta teniendo frutos que más adelante será para el bien de todos.

loans.use: With this loan, Dina will buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Thanks to the love and support of her family, Monica is more and more motivated to carry on each day. She has always been a very enterprising woman and for the last 12 years she has been selling medicine from a small pharmacy that she opened from her home. She would now like to re-open this pharmacy after improving the infraestructure of her house so that she can also rent a part of it and thereby earn enough to support her kids. It is for this reason that she would like a loan; as it will allow her to improve the atmosphere of the building. You can support the noble labour of this very hard-working mother.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Mónica, está cada día más animada a seguir adelante gracias a la motivación y al amor de su familia, ella siempre ha sido una mujer muy emprendedora y hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de fármacos en una botica que instaló en el local céntrico de su propia casa, y ahora su deseo es poder reabrir esa botica y a su vez mejorar la infraestructura de su casa para poder arrendar cada ambiente y de esta manera tener los ingresos necesarios que necesita para el sostén de sus hijos. Por este motivo solicita un préstamo los cuales le servirán para mejorar los ambientes de su inmueble. Vosotros podéis apoyar la noble labor de esta trabajadora madre de familia.

loans.use: An injection of capital to improve the building before renting it/Inyección de capital para mejorar su inmueble a fin de prestar sus servicios de alquiler.

loans.name: Maria Hermelinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria is 43 years old, lives in the Ticuantepe neighborhood, is married and has three school-aged children. Her husband works as a bricklayer and Maria is a businesswoman who sells used clothing. She has three years experience and started her business on her own efforts. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of packaged clothing in bulk so that she can improve her income. In the future she will grow her business and attract more clients, allowing further education to her children.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria tiene 43 años de edad, habita en el barrio de Ticuantepe, es casada y tiene tres hijos estudiando, su esposo trabaja como albañil. Doña Maria es comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y tiene tres años de experiencia e inició con esfuerzos propios. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar una paca de ropa para el negocio y así obtener mejores ingresos. A futuro es incrementar el negocio y captar más clientes y brindar más educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of packaged clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Tak

texts.en:
Tak P., age 51, lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been selling groceries in front of her home and is able to earn up to US$1 of profit per day. Her husband, Hing Sim, age 45, is a local construction worker who has built houses since 1993.  He is able to earn around US$4 per day.  Mrs. Tak P. used to be a housewife but her husband’s income was not enough to support the family, so she started selling groceries to help with the family's expenses. Together, the couple has three children, two of whom are employed and the other one is too young to work.
Mrs. Tak P. is seeking a loan of US$500 from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to add to her inventory of groceries, as she has many customers now.

loans.use: To add inventory to her grocery business, as she has a growing number of customers.

loans.name: Mrs. Chroek Phean Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chroek P. is the village bank president of the village bank which consists of sixteen people who live in Taing Pon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Chroek P. sells coal in the local village. Aside from this, she breeds cows and is raising two. Her husband, Mr. Sem Tuen, owns a small kiln where he can make coal for his wife to sell. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so Mrs. Chroek P. decided to ask for a loan to buy wood for her husband to make coal. Mrs. Chroek P. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending school while the youngest one is only three years old. There are three men who are shown in the picture, instead of their wives. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay aN. principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to repay. Most clients start to make payments maN. months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy wood for her husband to make coal for her to sell

loans.name: Meyling Raquel

texts.es: Doña Meyling tiene 31 años de edad, con dos hermosos hijos que estudian, habita en un bario que se llama Villa Liberta en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja en una institución de aduana como técnico en bodega, su negocio es la venta de prenda de oro y prendas de plata, también vende cosméticos que son productos que se venden bastantes por su variedad de estilo, bonitas y accesibles a los cliente vende al contado y al crédito de la quincena, en este negocio tiene tres años de experiencias, inicio con prestamos en bancos comunales, pues ha sido de gran ayuda para su bienestar económico. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para comprar prendas de oro y plata ya que viene la temporada buena en las ventas. A futuro es tener un local fijo en una avenida central donde pueda captar mas clientes y ofertar sus productos, también desean comprar su propia casa ya que donde están es donde la mama y su anhelo es tener una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Meyling is 31 years old, with two beautiful children that are studying. She lives in a neighborhood called Villa Liberta in the capital of Managua. Her husband works in a customs-house as a technician in a cellar. She sells ornaments of gold and silver. She also sells a lot of cosmetics because of the variety of beautiful and accessible styles. She sells these to her clients by cash or on credit, paid fortnightly. She has three years of experience in this business, which began with loans from community banks. It has been a great help for her economic well-being. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy ornaments of gold and silver, since a good season for her sales is coming. In the future, she wants to have a fixed location on a central street where she can capture more clients and offer her products. She also wants to buy her own house, because she lives with her mother now, and her desire is to have a dignified home for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ornaments of gold and silver

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda K. is a 55-year-old mother whose husband has no steady income. So, to cover day-to-day necessities, she is processing and selling dried apricots with the help of her daughter, who is pictured in the photo. She uses all the money she makes to care for her two children and provide for their education. Mavluda has six years of experience processing and selling dried apricots. She is very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today, Mavluda requests 2500 Somoni ($750) for the term of 9 months. She is going to use the loan for purchasing dried apricots with the purpose of processing them to increase her sales. With your help this will be possible. Mavluda and her daughter express their gratitude for everyone supporting them and promise to repay their loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Buy dried apricots to process and sell

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Mr. Ven K. is 45 years old, and is a local carpenter who makes furniture such as tables, chairs, beds, and cupboards for sale. He currently has an income of $4 per day, which is the main source for covering his family's expenses. His wife, Mrs. Chorn Ronn, age 39, sells groceries, and also raises pigs from her home. They have six children, one of whom is employed. Ven is applying for a loan to buy a wood scraping machine to help in his work. The family live in Koktlokroam Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy a wood scraping machine

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia J., 47 years old, is a member in good standing at the Mangrove Center. She is married to Ricardo, who works as a "Kagawad" (Barangay Councilor). With the little honorarium of being a Barangay Councilor, they also have a little fish pond and coco farm which yields income once every three months.

What worries the couple most is how to survive in their daily needs. Even if the couple spends only within their limits, they cannot manage their finances wisely. That's why they thought of starting up a "sari-sari" (variety) store. They asked Paglaum MPC to finance their store. They said it's a good opportunity to invest in a business that they are comfortable to handle. A loan was released, with which they immediately bought canned goods and bottled drinks. They also tried selling animal foods and even fruits and spices in their little store. Emelia said that it takes a lot of patience to achieve success. In the future, they want to see their children establish their own careers and be able to expand their store into a convenience store with a wide variety of goods.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and bottled drinks to sell in their store.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Tim I., 53, pictured wI. her husband, lives in Takeo Province where she is able to make about $50 each day operating a small restaurant selling wines, beers, other alcoholic beverages and soft drinks. Her husband, Em Yun, 57, has a business renting musical instruments. The couple has four children, three employed and one a student.

Mrs. Tim I. would now like to take out a loan of $1200 to purchase a small truck to transport her husband's music equipment.

loans.use: To purchase a small truck.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina O. has been selling drinks and clothes for the past five years. She sells to people in her community. She needs the loan amount of 100,000 naira to purchase more drinks and clothes to sell.

Paulina is 43 years old and married with seven children. Her husband is a distributor of drinks. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has owned a small food store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for the past 8 years. She belongs to Tushikamane group (Group code 2006).  Every day she works at her business for 10 hours. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Rose is married, and has six children, ages 20, 17, 10, 5, 4 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en:
Joumana is a 46 year old divorced woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her two children.

She has owned a clothing shop for eight years. Joumana requested a loan $3000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop.

Joumana has been a micro-credit client for seven years now and has always paid on time. Her previous loans helped her improve her shop by diversifying her merchandise, as well as help her financial situation. Joumana's clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t have start up capital. She plans on expanding her shop.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Seraua Group

texts.en:
Seraua is the group leader of Seraua group. There are three members in this group. They would like to expand their businesses.

They want to take a loan of 22500 Afghani for the term of 8 months. Seraua wants to take a loan for the business of embroidery. She wants to buy a new machine for her business. Shogofa wants to take a loan for her father, who has a general store and wants to buy more materials for his shop that are in demand in his market. Zhraw wants to take a loan for a tailoring business. They are thankful to AFS, Kiva's partner, and Kiva.

loans.use: for expanding businesses

loans.name: Swalia C Leila Ayikoru Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Leila A. is 32 years old and married with three children. She has one boy and two girls who are all going to school. She has seven dependents.

She has been selling cassava flour for over nine years. She will use this loan to purchase bags of cassava flour for sale. Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour for sale.

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru: Вахобов Икром Абдукаримович 1971 год рождения ,женат имеет 1 ребёнка .Жена Вахобова Саодат  .Место жительства Шахристанский район ,район Шахристан. Клиент занимается живодноводством  уже около 10 лет дома .Клиент имеет 5 голов крупного рогатого скота .Дополнительный семейный доход клиент занимается переработкой молока. Он  сам является   сотрудником налоговой инспекции.Всем своим знакомым и друзьям Икром рекомендует нашу организацию и благодарит наших доноров.
texts.en:
Ikrom Abdukarimovich V. was born in 1971. He is married and has one child. He and his wife Saodat Vahobova live in Shahristan district. Ikrom has raised cattle at home for more than ten years, and has five head of large-horned cattle. Processing the milk is an additional source of family income. Ikrom also works at the tax revenue service. Ikrom recommends MicroInvest to all his acquaintances and friends and is grateful to our donors.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy Z. is from the town of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 54 years old, married, and has three adult children. Lucy owns and operates a specialized retail business, primarily selling animal feed and rice in the local community. She also does dressmaking. Lucy has been engaged in her businesses for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Lucy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for her dressmaking and additional capital to expand her retail business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials for her dressmaking and to expand her retail business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine believes that God had made His own way to provide what her family needs. She is very thankful for all the blessings she has received and, with that, she also shares her blessings with others in simple ways.  Josephine and her husband Edwin have three children; two of them are attending school.  Their youngest is just two years old and Josephine is also preparing for his future education as she also believes in the saying that “time is gold”.

Josephine believes that, with the help of Kiva lenders, her hog raising business will become more progressive. She is again requesting financial support to further sustain the growth of her business. She wanted to borrow at least PHP 4,000.00.  This amount will play a big part in enhancing her hog raising enterprise.  She hopes and prays that lenders will continuously support small entrepreneurs like her to be free and alleviated from poverty.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Lorta Uaquene

texts.pt:
Lorta Uaquene N. nasceu em inhambane tem 56 anos de idade e solteira mãe de 4 filhos dos quais três já falecidos. actualmente vive com seu filho mais novo já casado e com seus 3 netos estes que vão a escola.

Lorta inicia os seus estudos muito tarde devido à falta de condições, pois seu pai a abandonou ainda criança deixando a com sua mãe esta que era uma simples camponesa alegando que ele ia trabalhar na vizinha áfrica do sul, não tendo voltado ate entao.com15 anos lorta inicia seus estudos fazendo assim a 2 classe do antigo sistema e esta fica grávida e abandona os estudos, pois tinha que cuidar dos seus 3 filhos estes que perdem a vida no tempo da guerra. Lorta fica muito desesperada apos a morte dos seus filhos, e a sua irmã convida lhe para morar com ela em namaacha uma vila na fronteira da suazilandia, apos sua chegada começa a trabalhar como empregada domestica durante 5 anos.com o fundo colectado ela inicia o seu próprio negocio e constrói a sua própria casa com o rendimento ganho nos negócios, mas devido aos preparativos do casamento do seu filho ela fica na beira da falência e pede empréstimo a hluvuku no valor de 8.000.00MT para reforçar o seu negocio valor este que foi pago com muito sucesso. Estes 10.000.00MT serão usados para aumentar o volume do seu stock tem viajado 1 vez em cada semana, pois ela tem vendido 2 vezes por semana quartas e sábados onde no mercado informal shoprite onde há intercambio de produtos vindo de paises fora tem de lucro 5.000.00MT. responsabiliza se pela sua mãe esta que vive com ela em sua casa e consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00MT 

Este e o segundo empréstimo de lorta na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. os primeiros 8.000.00.MT foram usados para reforçar os seus negócios, e  Estes 10.000.00MT serão usados para aumentar o volume do seu stock. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir a casa do seu único filho.
texts.en:
Lorta Uaquene N. was born in Inhambane, is 56 years old, and has mothered four children, three of whom have passed away. Now she lives with her youngest child, who is married, and her three grandchildren, who all go to school.

Lorta began her school studies very late, due to a lack of means. Her father abandoned her when she was an infant, leaving her with her mother, a simple farmer. He said that he was going to work in neighboring South Africa and has never returned to this day. At age 15 Lorta began her studies and made it through second grade in the old educational system. Then she became pregnant and stopped her studies, having to take care of her three children, who later lost their lives in wartime. Lorta was quite hopeless after the death of her children, and was invited to live with her sister invited in Namaacha, a village on the border of Swaziland. After she arrived there, Lorta worked as a domestic worker for five years. With the money she saved, she began her own business. She built her own house with the earnings from her business. But the expenses for her child's wedding left her almost bankrupt, and she requested a loan from Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner) for 8,000 meticais (MT) to bolster the value of her business. She very successfully repaid the loan. This current loan of 10,000 MT will be used to increase the volume of stock for her business, for which she travels once a week. She sells twice a week, on Wednesdays and Saturdays, at the informal market, Shoprite, where there is an exchange of products coming from other countries and she makes a profit of 5,000 MT. Lorta takes care of her mother, who lives with her in her house, and also is able to save 1,000 MT per month.

This is Lorta's second loan from Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. The first 8,000 MT were used to strengthen her business, and these 10,000 MT will be used to increase the volume of her inventory. She is confident that she will repay the loan early and will ask for another loan to finish the house of her only child.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory for her business

loans.name: Temitayo

texts.en:
Temitayo sells clothes, shoes, bags and jewelry. She is 42 years old and she has four children. She lives in Abeokuta and she is the leader of her lending group.

Temitayo is requesting the loan of N140,000 to enable her to buy more shoes, clothes and jewelry to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, shoes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther C. sells soft drinks in Elmina. Esther has a junior high school education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Esther has been selling soft drinks since 2006. She is responsible for the upkeep of the house. 

Her loan will be used to buy more soft drinks on a wholesale basis to resell at the market. She hopes to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more soft drinks on a wholesale basis to resell at the market.

loans.name: Khayal

texts.en:
Khayal has been in poultry business for 4 years. He lives in Baku city. This man was born in 1988. 
Khayal is single. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy poultry and feed for improving his poultry business.

loans.use: to buy poultry and feed

loans.name: Mable

texts.en: Mable N., 36, owns a bar which she has operated for three years.  She has six children, all of whom are going to school. Her husband, a photographer, helps her in the business most of the time. She is using the loan to purchase drinks such as sodas, Red Bull, Smirnoff, and beers to expand the business. She also has a saloon behind the bar. Her aim is to educate her children and, God willing, set up a new business.

loans.use: To purchase additional drinks to expand the business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 27 años, vive en una amplia casa con su esposo Ney de la misma edad, y sus dos pequeños hijos, Gabriel de 8 y Patrick de 5 años. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de comida en una de las zonas más populosas del distrito donde vive. Empezó como ayudante de su suegra y ahora comparten el negocio. Para eso, debe levantarse muy temprano a cocinar, y lo que la motiva es que el negocio es rentable y cada día tienen más clientela, pues en su mayoría sus clientes son los obreros que trabajan en grandes obras de construcción. Al promediar la una de la tarde, después de repartir sus porciones de almuerzo, regresa a su casa para atender a sus hijos y al caer la tarde se dedica a la venta de accesorios de uso personal para mujer que ella misma hace a mano, para ello se instala en la parte de afuera de un colegio y espera la salida de las profesoras y jovencitas para ofrecer sus artículos. Para el futuro, Norma piensa implementa una librería bazar, ya que sabe que este negocio también es rentable.  
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta porque todas las señoras que trabajan en su banco comunal son muy puntuales y responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mercadería al por mayor para abastecer su cocina y ofrecer mayor cantidad de porciones a sus asiduos comensales.

loans.use: Compra de comestibles e ingredientes para sus comidas

loans.name: Kiganda 3 Namunga Sarah Group

texts.en: N. Sarah is the president of her group. She is 33 years old and blessed with nine children, seven of whom are in school. She also has two dependents in school. For over seven years, Sarah has been operating a butcher's business, selling pork. She is using her loan to purchase and sell pork to her customers. Sarah is a hardworking businesswoman whose goal is to improve her business and offer good quality pork joints. She also dreams of purchasing a plot of land to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase pork to sell

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is a 50-year-old married mother of seven children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town. However, the majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation along side other trading activities. Dora is a trader. She trades in cereals (maize) and other food stuffs. She buys the goods from nearby communities and treks to sell. She also sells at the local market to food vendors in her community. Dora has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Fabiana Flavia

texts.es: La señorita Fabiana  es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006 ahora se encuentra en su sexta secuencia tiempo durante el cual se ha podido observar que la misma es una persona trabajadora y con ganas de superacion, lo cual se ve reflejado en el negocio que atravez del tiempo ha ido creciendo poco a poco.  La actividad economica que realiza es la venta de articulos varios en su pequeña tienda de barrio ubicada en la calle R. al lado de su domicilio.  Ella vive en csa familiar conjuntamente con su señora madre a la que colabora con los gastos familiares  y tambien junto a ellas vive su hermano.  La sañora Faviana invertira el prestamo en la compra de insumos para su negocio como ser viveres por cantidad, gaseosas y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fabiana has been our client since 2006 and she is now in her sixth sequence. During this time she has proven to be a hard-working person who wants to excell, which is reflected in her business which has grown little by little. She sells different articles from a small local store located in the Calle R. next to her home. She lives in the family house with her mother who she supports with the family expenses, and a brother lives there as well. Mrs. Fabiana will invest the loan in buying products for her business, such as supplies, soft drinks etc.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in supplies for business.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 25-year-old single man living in Hebron, Palestine. He is a driving instructor. Rami is very friendly, organized, and has a relaxed teaching style.

Now, Rami needs a loan of US$2,500 to buy the necessary training materials and tools for his driving school so he can give the best lessons to his students.

loans.use: To buy the necessary training materials and tools

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20206030040) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Yên Hậu 1 (Yên Hậu nhóm 03).


H. is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, H. works in someone else's business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.
