She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20206030041) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20206030042) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


3.  Vũ Thị Huệ (20206030043) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


4.  Đàm Thị

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Lilia's Group

texts.en:
Lilia C. is from the village of Minallo. She is 50 years old. Lilia is the group leader of a 5-member  loan group offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lilia C..

Lilia is married. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling eggs in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mahmadsolih

texts.en:
D. Mahmadsolih is married and the father of four children. He works as a farmer everyday. Educated until secondary school, he had to quit early because he couldn't afford to attend. Bestowed with a good work ethic, Mahmadsolih has wholeheartedly committed himself to agriculture. Thanks to his hard work, he has today become a man known for his determination and serves as an example and reference for other farmers. He is growing vegetables: potato, onion, carrot and others. Mahmadsolih is now seeking a loan of $3,000 US to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his crops in the hopes of being well prepared for the upcoming season and to produce a good harvest at the end of the season. He can then better meet the needs of his family and improve his work conditions.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Sally's Group

texts.en:
Sally R. is from the village of Capellan in Ilagan, Isabela. She is 29 years old. Sally is the leader of a 15-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Sally R..

Sally is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sally owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Sally has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Sally joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sally has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sally is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Sally's sixth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene P. is a 32 year-old rice farmer. She started farming in 1999. She lives in Surallah, Cotabato together with her two children. The farm that she has been tilling for several years is what helps her pay the daily expenses in their home. She desires a bountiful harvest so that she will be able to accommodate the needs of her family.

She has applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. If ever she gets a loan, she will be able to increase her harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
Yeni es socia del Banco Comunal Laureles.
Yeni es casada, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Yeni tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donD. venD. repuestos D. carros, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Yeni necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. aceite.
Yeni sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Yeni is a member of the “Laureles” comunal bank. She is 25 years old, married, and has two children. She sells auto parts from a rented location daily. She needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to invest in motor oil. She hopes to be able to expand her business one day, and also hopes that her children will have professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in motor oil for resale

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Olga es de 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene una hija, se dedica a la compra venta de delantales típicos en la localidad, en ASDIR es el segundo crédito que solicita, el anterior lo pago bien, el financiamiento lo necesita para ampliar su capital de trabajo lo invertirá en la compra de mas delantales para surtir su venta y ganar más clientes, con la ayuda de su esposos pagaran el préstamo.
texts.en:
Olga is 33 years old and married with one daughter. She sells traditional aprons in the market. This is her second loan from ASDIR. She paid off her previous loan without any problems. She needs the financing to increase her working capital, which she will use to buy more aprons to supply her business and gain more clients. She will pay off the loan with her husband's help.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more palm oil to serve customers.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 33 años, casada con Adolfo de 40 años, quien se dedica a la agricultura, juntos tienen tres hijos, Wendy de 14 años, Andy de 09 años y Estrella de 05 años. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace varios años se dedica a vender Fruta de forma ambulatoria, dentro de uno de los mercados de la zona en la que vive, así como también a domicilio, donde previamente sus clientes le hacen el pedido respectivo. Mientras, su esposo Adolfo tiene varias chacras en Tingo María, ubicada en la selva central, lugar donde vive, ya que su oficio de agricultor no le permite descuidar de sus cultivos. Es por ello que Norma, cada 15 días viaja a esa ciudad para traer la cantidad de fruta que necesita para vender. En tanto, Adolfo va a visitar a su familia cada fin de mes. De esta manera, esta sacrificada pareja trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia, puesto que saben que todo esfuerzo tiene su recompensa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará para viajar a la selva y traer más mercadería, además quiere comprar cajas de madera, que es donde pone la fruta que ella ofrece.
texts.en:
Norma, 33 is married to Adolfo, 40, who is a farmer; they have three children: Wendy, 14, Andy, 9 and Estrella, 5, they all live together in their own home. She has been an itinerant fruit merchant for several years in one of the local markets where she lives; she also sells door-to-door filling previously placed orders from her customers. Meanwhile, her husband Adolfo has several fields in Tingo María, located in the central jungle, which is where he lives because farming does not permit him to neglect his crops. Because of this, Norma travels to that city every two weeks to bring the fruit she needs to sell. Adolfo comes to visit his family at the end of each month. This is how this very dedicated couple works hard and makes sacrifices for the success of their family because they know that every effort has its reward. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She will use the funds to travel to the jungle to bring more merchandise; she also wants to buy wood crates which are what she uses to display her fruit for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more fruit and wooden crates.

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es:
EL Banco D. emprendimiento SANTA RITA, viene trabajando ya dos ciclos atrás este banco se caracteriza por ser puntual en los pagos y ser muy solidarias. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como: cosmeticos ollas en aluminio ,atencion en su tienda y otras a la elaboracion D. mantas ,macrame y tejidos.

La Sra. ROSAURA es una D. las socias mas aniguas, ocupa el cargo D. presidenta la sra tiene como actividad una tienda D. barrio,con el prestamo a surtido su tienda comprando mercaderia como refescos, conservas, galletas, detergentes, bebidas, pañales, etc, con esta actividad ya tiene varios años y D. este modo colabora con los gastos D. la casa.

La Sra. ADRIANA ocupa el el cargo D. secretaria, esta socia trabaja en una empresa D. limpieza tambien ella se dedica a la elaboracion D. tejido en macrame, con el prestamo otorgado a comprado material para la elaboracion D. mantas a pedido ya que tiene muchos clientes y tiene que realizar entregas.

La Sra. VIQUI ocupa el cargo D. tesorera esta socia se dedica a la cofeccion D. mantas y realiza macrame con el prestamo otorgado a comprado por mayor lana, cintas para la realizar sus mantas, es una socia muy trabajadora y responsable siempre viendo a que actividad dedicarse.

Todas las  socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos sacan adelante a sus familias solas, estan muy agaredecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Santa Rita community bank has completed two loan cycles, and can be characterized as being punctual with its payments and V. united. The members sell products such as: cosmetics, aluminum pots, some work in general stores and others make ponchos, macramé items, and weavings. Rosaura is one of the oldest members of the group, and is the president. She has a neighborhood store, and with the loan she will stock her store with soda pop, jelly, cookies, detergent, beverages, diapers, etc. She has had the store for several years and in this way meets her household expenses. Adriana is the secretary, and she works in a cleaning business and she also makes macramé weavings. She will use the loan to buy materials to make custom ponchos as she has many customers and orders to fill. Viqui is the treasurer and makes tablecloths and also macramé weaving. With the loan she will buy more wool and belts for making her ponchos. She is a hard-working and responsible member who always has work to do. All the members are hard-working and responsible and in many cases are the sole supporters in their families. They are V. grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in awarding the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is in the business of selling irish potatoes and cassava tubers at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of onions to sell. Susan is 41 and a widow with five school-age children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy AVON, ZERMAT, ORIFLAME products

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: Jhonny, de 25 años, vive en la casa de sus padres solo con ellos,  pues sus 7 hermanos, son  independientes y ya tienen sus familias propias.Se desempeña en la labor de construcción civil, durante todos los días útiles de la semana, mientras los fines de semana se dedica al cultivo de café, plátanos y cítricos. Recuerda como su padre le enseño todas las técnicas agrícolas necesarias, para ser un buen agricultor, y en la actualidad  sus plantaciones lucen bien cuidadas, por otro lado le incomoda viajar varias horas para llegar a sus terrenos, pero asegura que “vale la pena, porque todos los esfuerzos son recompensados en la cosecha y las buenas ganancias durante la comercialización”.Como su oficio es  bastante rentable, ahorra algo de dinero para el futuro, pues tiene planeado estudiar la profesión de  ingeniería civil.Es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se muestra muy entusiasmado de continuar laborando junto a los integrantes de su grupo comunal, porque esta integrado por personas responsables  en el pago de sus cuotas.Jhonny tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos de café para mejorar la producción de sus futuras siembras.
texts.en:
Jhonny is 25 years old. He is the only one living with his parents since his seven siblings are independent and have families of their own. Jhonny works in civil construction during the weekdays. On the weekends he grows coffee, bananas, and citrus fruits. He remembers how his father taught him the necessary farming techniques so that he could become a good farmer. His crops currently receive the proper care, but it requires that he travel several hours to reach his farmland. Even though it is a bother, Jhonny says, “It is worth it because all of my efforts are rewarded at harvest time and I generate good earnings at the market.” Since his job is quite profitable, he is able to save money for the future because he plans to study civil engineering.

This is the second time he has received a loan from MFP. Jhonny is excited to continue working with the other members of his Communal Bank because they are responsible when submitting their payments. He plans to invest the money he requested in the purchase of several sacks of compost that he will apply to his coffee crops so that he can improve the production of his future harvests.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Faizi

texts.en:
T. Faizi is married and has 3 children. With the faith that his children would go to college to get ahead, he started a business of processing and selling the dried apricot to be able to make enough money to pay for their schooling. This is why he started this business 5 years ago. He is experienced in this kind of business that allows him to expand his clientele day by day. Right now Faizi needs a loan of 4500 Somoni. He is going to spend the loan for purchasing apricots further to process it into dried apricots and to sell. Faizi will be able to feel proud that through much effort, his children went to college and are honorable people. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy apricot for expanding his business

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en: Jesus C. is from the village of Manaoag. He is 50 years old and is married with four adult children. Jesus owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-four years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jesus joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Jesus is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his 6th from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Biakou Essi

texts.fr: G. est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé qui est un  quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. elle a ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle a appelé "coiffure extra". elle y a associé plus tard le commerce de produits cosmétiques. sa clientèle ne cesse de grandir car elle accueille bien ses clients et leur offre des produits de qualité. elle souhaite faire croître le commerce de produits cosmétiques. elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour l'achat de 4 cartons de divers produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Mrs. G. is married and the mother of 2 children. She lives with her family in the Adidogomé neighborhood, on the outskirts of the city of Lomé. She opened a hair styling salon which she named "Coiffure Extra." Later, she began to sell cosmetic products as well. The number of customers is always growing, as she takes good care of them and sells quality products. Mrs. G. wants to increase her business in cosmetic products. She is asking WAGES for her first loan, in order to buy 4 boxes of assorted cosmetic products.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Delia's Group

texts.en: Delia D. is from the village of Muñoz West. She is 48 years old and is the group leader of this eleven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Delia D.'s Group. Delia is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling wood and wood-related products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Delia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of pepper to sell to her customers

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon N.  is 52 years old, and her husband, Mr. Saret Soun, 60 years old, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, They were married in 1980 and have five children; three sons and two daughters.   

Phon has been operating a business-laundry at her home for a year. Her husband is a Cyclo taxi driver.  Cyclo is a bicycle attached with a rickshaw in the front. 

Phon’s son hopes to launch a business-selling cell phones, but he does not have capital.  Therefore, Phon is asking for her first loan of loan of $700 to help finance her son.

loans.use: To help finance her son purchase cell phones for resale.

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida T. is the leader of the group. She is 33, married. Her husband is a herder, and raises 8000 soms per month. The couple has 5 children; the elder are school pupils, the younger are at home. The family is engaged in cattle breeding, they have been doing it for 16 years since 1994, when Farida’s husband, using the profits from selling apples, could afford to buy 4 sheep for breeding. Now, the family keeps 70 livestock animals and 3 cows. The loan purpose is to purchase more cattle. In future the family plans to build a new house.

Ilyas T., 32, is married. His family has 2 children; Ilyas supports his family financially by cattle breeding. The loan purpose is to purchase more farm animals. 

Nazira M., 35, is married. Her husband is a private taxi-driver. The couple is raising 4 children. Nazira is eganged in breeding livestock animals, and she hopes to obtain the loan in order to purchase 5 livestock animals. 

Kerimbai C., 42, is married, and has 3 children. In 2000, the family began to resell cattle in the local market. Kerimbai wants to use the loan to increase commodity circulation. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Roberto Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto de 39 años de edad, es separado de su esposa,  tienen dos hijos que viven con su esposa pero el les apoyo con la educación y su alimentación, es doloroso cuenta el Sr. Roberto ya que no puede vivir con sus hijos pero trata de estar el mayor tiempo con ellos,  el  vive en Alquiler en el Barrio el recreo zona plan 3000, trabaja como chofer hace  ocho años.  El sr. Roberto  ahora es dueño de su propio microbús,  Al   Sr. Roberto se le refinancio el crédito para la reparación de su microbús (reparación de caja, muelles y  cremalleras en general, etc. ) . EL señor esta muy agradecido y sorprendido por la rapidez que se le otorgo el crédito y por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Roberto is 39 years old, separated from his wife, and has two children who live with his wife but whom he helps to feed and educate. Roberto says that it's painful for him not to live with his children, but he tries to spend as much time as he can with them. He lives in a rented home in the Plan 3000 neighborhood and has been working as a driver for the past 8 years. Roberto owns his own minibus, and is refinancing his previous loan in order to  repair his minibus (ignition, shocks, general repairs, etc.). Roberto is very grateful for the support provided to him and impressed by the speed with which he was given a loan.

loans.use: Minibus repairs

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is 46 years old.  She sells second-hand clothes in a very busy open air market.  She has been engaged in the business for twenty-one years.  She hopes to expand her shop into wholesale in the future.  Through Faulu Kenya, she is able to save her money.  She has requested 30,000 KES to buy more trousers to sell.

loans.use: To buy trousers to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase slippers

loans.name: Fred Kyoma

texts.en: B. Fred Kyoma is from Rukungiri. He is 59 and married with eight children and is involved in growing and selling matooke with his wife. He operates from Kanyamuhe village. Through hard work, he is able to make 150,000 UGX in monthly profits. He is also involved in the sale of coffee to the coffee factory in his area and this supplements his income. He needs a loan to improve his plantation by applying manure.

loans.use: To buy manure to boost plantation production

loans.name: Magoma Nezikokolima Group-Mityana

texts.en: Emmanuel K. is 45 years old, married, and has five children.  He is a member of the Magoma Nezikokolima group-Mityana.  Emmanuel has been operating his pub business in Kiyoganyi trading center for 20 years. He says he got ideas on how to run a business from his parents.  Before that, he was working as a bartender and doing some farming. Emmanuel's business generates 20,000 shillings weekly. With this loan, Emmanuel is going to buy more crates of both soft and hard drinks to sell at his pub.

loans.use: To purchase crates of both soft and hard drinks for resell at his pub

loans.name: Beatriz Stella

texts.es:
Debido a las necesidades económicas para sobrellevar los gastos del hogar y sacar adelante a sus tres hijos en compañía de su esposo, Beatriz Stella R. M., decidió desde hace 10 años montar su propio negocio, una venta de comidas que inició con las tradicionales empanadas y que hoy ya ofrece muchos más productos para deleitar a los clientes de la zona. 

De domingo a domingo esta emprendedora trabaja en su negocio esperando incrementar sus ventas con el fin de continuar supliendo las necesidades de su hogar, aunque como ella misma lo afirma, no es fácil puesto que hay días en los que las ventas son pocas, lo que no le permite obtener buenas ganancias; sin embargo Beatriz no se rinde y sueña con tener un restaurante propio en el que pueda ofrecer variedad de platos. 

Actualmente Beatriz necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas reformas locativas en su casa y allí poder ubicar su negocio para que atender mejor a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, así mismo, necesita comprar insumos para empezar a ofrecer nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Given the financial requirements to cover the household expenses and to provide for their three children, Breatriz Stella R. Mejia and her husband decided 10 years ago to set up their own business. She sells prepared foods, though she started out selling traditional breads. Today she sells many other products to cater to the clients in the community. 

From Sunday to Sunday this enterprising woman works her business, endeavoring to increase her sales in order to keep the ability to cover the needs of their household. She attests to the fact that it is not easy and there are days when the sales are low, resulting in diminished earnings. But Beatriz never gives up and she dreams to have her own restaurant from where to sell a variety of foods. 

Beatriz requests a loan to carry out some improvements in her home, to be able to set up her business and improve the way she attends to her clients, and increase her sales. She also needs to purchase ingredients to start making new foods.

loans.use: To remodel their home and to purchase ingredients.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. María Eugenia es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre soltera de dos hijos, se dedica a laborar como maestra de educación primaria en un colegio de la localidad desde hace 18 años. Una de las necesidades que tiene esta señora es adquirir un crédito para pagar los gastos universitarios de uno de sus hijos el cual está cursando el 2do años de su carrera profesional por tal razón decidió solicitar su tercer préstamo en Ceprodel para pagar dichos gastos con la satisfacción de cumplir su plan de inversión y así heredar a sus hijos un futuro profesional y un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Sra. María Eugenia is from the town of El Sauce and a single mother of two children.  She has been working as a teacher at the local elementary school for eighteen years.  One of her needs is to acquire a loan in order to pay the university expenses of one of her children who is in his second year toward earning a professional degree.  For this reason, she decided to request her third loan from CEPRODEL to pay these expenses so that she could satisfy this plan of investment and provide her children with a chance to achieve a professional future and a better standard of living.

loans.use: Pay for her child's university expenses

loans.name: Adizatu

texts.en:
Adizatu M. sells porridge in Nyame Bekyere, Cape Coast. Married with three children, her earnings from porridge sales supplement her husband’s earnings as a cleaner. She contributes to their children’s school fees and utility bills. 
Her dream is to provide her children with a meaningful education. Her plan is to increase her earnings by growing the volume of porridge she sells. She needs a loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare more food. Also, the loan will help her buy in bulk to ease the pressure from inflation. The extra earnings will go towards saving for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare more food.

loans.name: Sainte Jeanne D'arc Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAINTE JEANNE D'ARC est créé le 15 juillet 2010 au 6ème cycle du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont de la même communauté Ecclésiale. L'activité principale du groupe est le petit commerce et l'élevage de porcs/ Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois des femmes catholiques de Sainte Thérèse. 

Madame Élisabeth S. (debout à l'extrême gauche de la photo, emmitouflée d'un pagne) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de trois enfants de son frère.

Elle fait du petit commerce d'huile de palme et de beignets. Elle mène cette activité depuis longtemps, bien avant qu'elle ne soit membre du groupe. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'augmenter son niveau de production en renforçant son activité

Son objectif est de prendre en charge les besoins de sa progéniture et ceux des enfants qui lui sont confiés. Et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en:
The SAINTE JEANNE D'ARC solidarity group was created on July 15, 2010 in the 6th cycle of the Banc Villageois of the Catholic Women of Sainte Thérèse, to which it belongs. It is composed of ten women from the same church community. The group's main activities are small trade and raising pigs. 

Mrs. Élizabeth S. (standing at the far left of the picture and wrapped in a pagne) is the leader of the group. She is 40 years old, a widow, and the mother of six children. She is also responsible for three other children entrusted to her care by her brother. She sells palm oil and beignets. She started this activity long before she became a member of the solidarity group. 

Her new loan will allow her to boost production by strengthening her business. Her goals are to provide for all the children in her care, and to increase her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: Buying palm oil and flour to make beignets

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena S. is a married woman with three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling lesos (Khangas), a traditional African shawl or wrap. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and becoming self-reliant in the future.

Zena decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of lesos (Khangas) for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of lesos (Khangas) for resale

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam A. lives in the Lugala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Miriam has a business of selling secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Miriam sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail. Miriam has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Miriam include thieves and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own house. Miriam lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of secondhand clothes for resale

loans.name: Judith Maria

texts.es: Judith  Maria E. V., tiene 48 años y un negocio de variedades donde vende mercancía como sabanas, toallas, ropa femenina, y en general  artículos para toda ocasión; ella inició este negocio con la venta de calzado a través de los créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo;  así fue incursionando en otras líneas, logrando adicionarle detalles para el hogar, ropa para toda ocasión, perfumes, bolsos,  sabanas etc. su sueño es lograr comprar un apartamento para rentarlo y ampliar su negocio para obtener mas ingresos, pues como es cabeza de hogar  y depende totalmente de su negocio, Judith necesita desarrollar otra forma de obtener un ingreso adicional para aumentar su bienestar y el de su familia. Este es su crédito # 19 con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará productos encargados por sus clientes a propósito de la temporada comercial que se avecina y que inicia con el día de las madres en el mes de Mayo: detalles para el hogar, ropa y calzado, que venderá mediante el sistema de financiamiento y también de contado a sus clientes,  a quienes ofrece los términos adaptados a las posibilidades de pago , a sus gustos y necesidades reales.
texts.en: Judith is 48 years old. She has a variety store business where she sells sheets, towels, women’s clothes and articles for special occasions. She began this business by selling shoes, after receiving a loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. After this she started selling other products such as articles for the home, clothes for all occasions, perfumes, bags, sheets, etc. Her dream is to buy an apartment and rent it out. In this way she will increase her income. She would like to grow her business in order to have more income as she is the head of the household and is totally dependent on her business for survival. Judith needs to develop other forms of income in order to insure the well being of her family. With her nineteenth loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and her first loan from KIVA, she will buy products requested by her customers for the season, which begins with Mother’s Day in May. She will buy things for the home, clothes and shoes that she sells buy financing her customer’s purchases or allowing them to purchase them on layaway. She helps them finance their desires and their needs.

loans.use: to buy objects for the home, clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Las Malinches Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Malinches, está localizado en la comunidad de Tétela del Volcán, en el estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por las señoras Adelaida y Raquel ellas van a comprar con su crédito jabón, azúcar, refrescos, aceite, leche, etc. Para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, las señoras Herminia y Genoveva van a comprar abono e insecticida para fumigar y darle mantenimiento a sus huertas y produzcan más fruta, la señora Anastacia va a comprar Durazno y aguacate, la señora Consuelo va a comprar alimento para criar sus cerdos, la señora Adelaida tiene 66 años de edad, ella tiene 10 hijos todos son mayores de edad ya se casaron y ya trabajan, ellas son Ofelia de 48 años de edad, Raquel de 47 años de edad, Roberto de 46 años de edad, Albertico de 44 años de edad, Evelia de 42 años de edad, Victoria de 40 años de edad, Ismael de 38 años de edad, Fidencio de 36 años de edad, Delfina tiene 34 años de edad y Edgar de 32 años de edad, ella tiene su tienda de abarrotes y sus huertas de aguacate, ella solicito su crédito para comprar mercancía jabón, aceite, refrescos, jugos, sabritas, Gamesa, maíz, huevo, papel higiénico, sardinas, atún, pañales, veladoras, dulces, pan, etc. Para tener surtida su tienda de abarrotes, ella inicio su negocio hace 8 años su hija le dio dinero y pensó en poner su negocio compro la mercancía para su tienda, ella también tiene su huerta de aguacate cuando hay que trabajar en las huertas contrata a un peón para que trabaje en las huertas abonando o cortando la fruta. Su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para comer, para los gastos y para cuando se enferma, ella está muy emocionada con este préstamo porque va a surtir su tienda para que se vea bonita y tenga mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientes, ella quisiera que tenga salud, que sus hijos estén felices y que estén bien. Las integrantes quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Estamos agradecidas con ustedes que nos apoyan para crecer nuestros negocios”. Tétela del Volcán es fresco, hay árboles frutales, duraznos, aguacate, pera, capulín, tejocote, ciruela, cuajinicuil.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called Las Malinches. It is located in the Tétela del Volcán community, in the state of Marelos, Mexico. 

To stock their store, group members Adelaida and Raquel will use their loan to purchase soap, sugar, beverages, oil, milk, etc. Herminia and Genoveva will purchase fertilizer and insecticide to fumigate and treat their orchards so that they produce more fruit.  Anastacia will purchase peaches and avocados. Consuelo will purchase feed to raise her pigs.

Adelaida is 66 years old, and has 10 older children that are married and working; they are as follows: Ofelia who is 48 years old, Raquel who is 47 years old, Roberto who is 46 years old, Albertico who is 44 years old, Evelia who is 42 years old, Victoria who is 40 years old, Ismael who is 38 years old, Fidencio who is 36 years old, Delfina who is 34 years old, and Edgar who is 32 years old.  She has a small grocery store and an avocado orchard. She is requesting a loan to stock her store by purchasing merchandise, such as soap, oil, beverages, juices, snacks, corn, eggs, toilet paper, sardines, tuna, diapers, candles, candies, bread, etc.  She thought to start this business 8 years ago, after her daughter gave her money which she used to purchase merchandise for her store. She also has an avocado orchard. When it is time to work in the orchard, she hires a laborer to fertilize and cut fruit. Her business is important because it allows her to earn income to eat, pay for expenses, and for when she falls ill. She is very excited about this loan because it will allow her to stock her store so that it looks nice and so that she has merchandise to offer her clients. She wishes to be in good health and that her children are happy and well. 

The group members would like to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad that, “we are very grateful to you for supporting us so that we can grow our businesses.” 

The Tétela del Volcán area is cool, and there are many peach, avocado, pear, wild cherry, hawthorn, plum, and cuajinicuil fruit trees.

loans.use: purchase oil, beverages, juices, snacks, corn, eggs, toilet paper, sardines, tuna, diapers, candles, candies, bread, etc, to stock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame Rokia est âgée de 23 ans, célibataire et mère d’un enfant.  Elle vit chez son père dans une famille traditionnelle au  quartier Pelengana  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné  l’école en classe de 9ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) par suite d’épuisement de scolarité, elle s’initie rapidement au  commerce de condiments au marché. Elle jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. Elle  mène cette  activité  depuis 3 ans. 
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a  fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 12 mois. Après un  1er  prêt individuel correctement remboursé, elle est à son 2ème prêt  qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter 1 tonne d’oignon et bien d’autres paquets de condiments, dans la zone office du Niger (Dougabougou, Seribala etc.).
Madame Rokia vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes. Elle espère  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 100 000 FCFA, qui  lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins du fait qu’elle est célibataire et mère d’un enfant et d’aider son père dans la prise en charge de certaines dépenses familiales. Son ambition est  de mener plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Ms. Rokia is 23, single and the mother of one child.She lives with her father in a traditional family in the Pelengana neighborhood of Ségou (4th administrative district of the Republic of Mali). 

She left school in the 9th year of "fundamental" (according to the education system in Mali) and quickly got started in selling condiments at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years and is very well known, with a lot of customers. With the goal of increasing her working capital to meet demand from her customers, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso, and has been associated with them for 12 months. After one individual loan that was repaid correctly, she is now on her second loan  which she plans to use to buy 1 metric ton of onions and other condiments, in the "Office du Niger" area (Dougabougou, Seribala, etc.).

Ms. Rokia sells for cash and on credit to customers who are women. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 100,000 CFA francs, which will allow her to meet her own needs as she is a single mother, as well as to help her father with some family expenses. Her ambition is to have several income-generating activities.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has three children, two of whom are attending school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past 4 years, Esther has been operating a business selling Kikoi clothing.  In addition, she also sells charcoal as another source of income.  Her major challenge is the high cost of transporting charcoal in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 40,000, Esther she wants to purchase bundles of Kikois and sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy kikoi clothing and charcoal

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer es un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa, el tiene  28 años de edad y 2 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pitipo. Esta es una comunidad tranquila dedicada sobre todo a la agricultura y ganadería.

Elmer se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno lechero, tiene varios años de experiencia en este negocio y lo ha sabido conducir bien. Las ganancias que Elmer obtiene son destinadas totalmente a sus hijos. Además,  Elmer cuenta con una mototaxi en la cual realiza un servicio de transporte público que le genera ingresos adicionales.

Elmer solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar una cabeza de ganado vacuno, la cual engordará y venderá a posteriori. Este será el primer paso para ampliar su negocio. Elmer tiene muchos deseos de superación pues quiere darles a sus hijos la mejor educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elmer is an existing client of Edpyme Alternativa.  He is 28 years old and has two children in his care.  Elmer lives in his parents' home which is located in the rural area of Pítipo district.  This is a quiet community where people mainly farm and raise lifestock.

Elmer's business is buying and selling dairy cattle.  He has several years experience in his business and he has known how to run it well.  Elmer directs all of the profits that he makes towards his children.  He also owns a motorcycle taxi with which he provides a public transport service.  This makes him additional income.

Elmer is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a head of cattle which he will fatten and later sell.  This will be his first step in expanding his business.  Elmer has a great desire to improve himself as he would like to provide his children with the best education and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Khuth

texts.en:
Khuth has been spending her life cultivating crops in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap Province. This is a skill she had learned from her grandparent when she was young. Her husband is a craftsman. Two of their children assist him in the business and the other two are still studying in school.  

Khuth will use her loan to buy more equipment to support her husband in his crafts business. Mrs. Khuth and her husband wish to borrow some fund for supporting on their business present. Both of them would like to borrow from KIVA in order to expand on their craft business currently. In the future, she wants to built a big new house than present.

loans.use: to expand on their craft business.

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.en:
Abdumalik is a small business owner from Khujand, a city in the central part of Northern Tajikistan. He works to support his family by selling footwear at a busy central market called “Panjshanbeh”. Abdumalik has been in business for about eight years and makes around $200-$300 per month. Eventually he would like to open a second vending location to increase his sales and profits. Abdumalik has requested a loan of $1,500 USD to add to his working business capital. He has developed a good reputation and credit history with IMON International. We look forward to many more opportunities to assist Abdumalik with the success of his business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Dolores Isabel

texts.es:
Dolores, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 17, 15 y 12 años D. edad, ella se dedica a la fabricación D. totillas desD. hace 11 años, este oficio se lo heredo su madre, D. este negocio ha logrado mantener a sus hijos.
Ella solicita un préstamo pues necesita invertirlo en maíz y leña, para abastecerse y tener la posibilidad D. aumentar la producción, este préstamo ayudara grandemente a la economía D. Dolores, pues la compra la hará por mayoreo, obteniendo a mejor precio el maíz.
Su objetivo es dedicarse al negocio, contar con financiamientos que le permitan crecer y D. igual manera ayudar a sus hijos en la educación y alimentación.
texts.en:
Dolores lives with her husband and three children, ages 17, 15, and 12.  She’s been making tortillas for the past 11 years; a traD. that she learned from her mother.  This business has allowed her to support her children.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy corn and firewood in order to stock her business and have a chance to increase her production.  This loan will be of great help to Dolores’ finances and will allow her to buy corn in bulk at better prices.

Her goal is to dedicate herself to her business, use the financing to help her grow, and in the same manner help feed her children and pay for their education.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is 23 years old, single and earns a living by selling eggs. He has been in this line of work for five years and earns a profit of KES 10,000 a month. He is applying for a loan for KES 50,000, which he will use to buy more eggs to sell. He hopes to use the additional income made possible by this loan to expand his business and continue his studies.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Daria

texts.es: La Sra. Daria  se dedica a la fabricación y comercialización de muebles de madera como ser roperos, cómodas, peinadores, juntamente con su esposo el taller se encuentra en su domicilio donde vive en alquiler hace 6 años; tiene experiencia de 10 años  realiza la distribución de los muebles; tiene dos hijos actualmente ella se hace cargo de los estudios y manutención de sus hijos tanto la Sra. como su esposo; su trabajo es abnegado ya que comienzan la producción de los muebles desde la madrugada hasta entrada la noche; indica que es la única fuente de ingreso,  la señora revela  que el crédito  es de gran ayuda porque con este dinero aumentara capital de trabajo comprando madera para aumentar la producción asimismo la comercialización de los muebles de madera.
texts.en: Mrs. Daria works alongside her husband making and selling wooden furniture like closets, wardrobes, and vanities. The shop is located at the house which they have been renting for six years. She has been in this business for ten years selling furniture to different clients. She and her husband have two children who they are supporting through their studies. She works selflessly from the early morning until after nightfall. The furniture sales are her only income. Mrs. Daria says the loan is of great help because it will give her the capital to purchase more wood. This will allow her to increase production and as a result sell more furniture.

loans.use: purchase wood to make furniture

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is 41 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 19 years old.

Nerissa is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She and her husband till their land together. They grow rice and corn crops to sell. Aside from farming, Nerissa also sells barbecue and chorizo to the people in her community.

Nerissa has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She will also pay the rent for the tractor. She hopes to have a stable income that will enable her to sustain her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en: Amarjargal is 49 years old and lives with her children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her daughters work at local companies. Amarjargal operates a clothes trading business. She sells her clothes by visiting offices and business companies. Starting from March 2011, she rented a commercial space at the local market and sells clothes from there. She is requesting a 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to buy more clothes and to expand her business activity and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Faridah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with twp children who go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week .She has been in business for the last four years. Farida has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second hand clothes. Her major challenge includes transportation and electricity. Her goal is to educate her children to the university level and to start importing second hand clothes. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water .Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es: Carmen  vive al sur de la ciudad en un barrio muy alegre y popular, con su hija de 35 años. Allí desarrolla su negocio de confección y venta de ropa, actividad a la que ha estado ligada desde sus 14 años de edad, cuando aprendió con su madrastra y posteriormente realizó estudios con los que perfecciono este arte, hasta convertirlo en su tarea diaria con la que generó ingresos para lograr que su hija se convirtiera en diseñadora textil y ahora trabajar con ella, en su propio negocio.  Sus principales líneas son ajuar de bebés, bolsos en telas  entre otras confecciones. Su meta es aumentar su capital de trabajo, para en un futuro tener su propia casa. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará una fileteadora industrial y materias primas para responder a pedidos de su  clientela, mejorar sus tiempos productivos y la calidad de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in the south of the city in a very cheerful, popular neighborhood with her 35-year-old daughter.  She carries out her clothes making and selling business there, an activity she’s been associated with since she was 14 years old when she learned it from her step-mother and later took courses to perfect her art until it became her daily activity to generate income so that her daughter could become a textile designer.  Now, they work together in their own business.  Their main lines are infant wear and cloth bags, among other items.  Her goal is to increase working capital to have a house of her own in the future.  

She is applying for her first Fundación Mario Santo Domingo loan at present that she’ll use to buy an industrial overlock serger sewing machine and raw materials to meet customer demand, improve her production times and the quality of her items.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and raw materials.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: L"emprunteur est un tailleur marié et pere de quatre enfants.Il exerce cette activité depuis pres de 15 ans.Il a démarré avec une seule machine et a beacoup travaillé pour acquérir un local trés bien placé et trois machines à coudre.Sa clientèle a beaucoup augmenté et cela lui procure des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille.Il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter une nouvelle machine  à coudre  beaucoup plus moderne et plus performante.Son ambition est d'ouvrir un centre de formation des jeunes au métier de tailleur.
texts.en: This borrower is a married tailor and the father of four children. He has been in his trade for almost 15 years. He started out with only one sewing machine and has worked long and hard to acquire a workshop that is well-located and three sewing machines. His clientele has grown a lot and that brings him in income that allows him to support his family. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy a new, more modern and more efficient sewing machine. His ambition is to start up courses to teach young people the tailor's trade.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a divorced woman with three children who are enrolled in school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her children.

Mwanakombo has operated a vegetable stall for the past three years; she sells from home and her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where there are low sales during the dry spell due to poor harvests. She aspires to expand her business and open a grocery in the market area.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase tomatoes, onions, carrots and cabbages for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of access to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions, carrots and cabbages for her business.

loans.name: Bisael

texts.es:
el sr. Bisael tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha procreado 1 hijo, Bisael se dedica a la caficultura y tiene experiencia de 2 años en el manejo de café, el cultivo de cafe ha sido suficiente para generarle los ingresos para dar el sustento a su familia. Bisael utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel de energia solar, bisael esta seguro que la calidad de vida de su familia mejorara.
dejaran de utilizar candiles para alumbrarse y tambien podra utilizar horas de la noche para realizar otras actividades en su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Bisael is 32 years old. He lives with a partner and they have 1 child. 

Bisael grows coffee and has two years experience in the handling of coffee. The coffee harvest has been sufficient enough to generate the income he needs to make a living for his family. 

Bisael will use the money from the loan to buy a solar energy panel. Bisael is confident that the quality of life of his family will improve. They will have stopped using oil lamps for light and also would use the nighttime hours for other household activities.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Isabe

texts.es: Isabe, de 25 años es una madre responsable. Vive en compañía de Juan, su esposo desde hace 7 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Xiomara y Mayte a los que cuidan en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. Como una reciente pareja con responsabilidades. Ellos distribuyen sus actividades, su esposo se dedica al trabajo de carpintería, soldadura y mantenimiento del gobierno local de su zona, ahí obtiene un dinero mensual, que le paga el estado peruano. Además ella se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, cuenta con 30 ejemplares, los cuales comercializa en la ciudad de Jauja, durante la feria. Pero la actividad que realizan juntos es la agricultura, con la siembra de maíz, papa y habas, los que realizan en terrenos agrícolas heredados, “eso me permite ahorrar mucho”, afirma. Ahora planean comprar sus casa propia, saben que con trabajo y ahorro lo lograrán. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “hacienda” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo de todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Isabe de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla y fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de alfalafa.
texts.en: Isabe is 25 years old and is a responsible mother.  She lives with Juan, her husband of 7 years.  They have 2 children, Xiomara and Mayte, who live with them in their in-laws’ home, located in the community of Ataura.  As a young couple with responsibilities they divide up their activities.  Juan makes a living from carpentry, welding, and doing maintenance work for the local government of their region, from which he earns a monthly income from the Peruvian government.  Isabe makes a living raising guinea pigs—she has 30 of them, which she sells in the city of Jauja during its festival.  The economic activity that the couple work on together, though, is farming: they grow corn, potatoes, and beans on their family’s agricultural fields, which, as Isabe says, “allows me to save a lot.”  They are now planning to purchase their own house, and they know that with hard work and saving they will achieve it.  Isabe belongs to the “Hacienda” communal bank and this is her first loan with MFP.  She is happy to receive your support, which will enable her to stay in business.  She also promises to be punctual in making her payments, since her group is made up of responsible and supportive individuals.  If Isabe receives your support then she will invest the money in purchasing seeds and natural fertilizer for her next crop of alfalfa.

loans.use: to purchase alfalfa seeds and bags of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Pamba W.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Pamba W.Group in Western Kenya! Irene is the facilitator of the Pamba W.group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Irene takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Irene had a very good maize yield, harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Irene was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Irene and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Irene will educate her children and pay back her loans.

In 2012, the members of Pamba W. group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Irene with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has been operating a salon for six years.  The 29-year-old lady works hard in her business to provide for her child.  She has employed one person in the business to assist her in her tasks.  She also does farming to supplement her income.

She hopes to grow her business to generate more income in the future.  She has requested 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair braids, weaves and nail polish.

loans.use: To buy Hair braids, weaves and nail polish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle for meat

loans.name: Saranchimeg

texts.en:
Saranchimeg is a 46-year-old married entrepreneur who lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, which is an area without basic infrastructure. Her husband works at a court organization while their children attend local university and high school. 

Saranchimeg has supported her family since 1999 by operating a children's clothing business and a grocery store. Currently, she sells clothes at the second largest outdoor market of Ulaanbaatar city. December is a very busy shopping month, so entrepreneurs need more products or working capital after December of each year. 

Saranchimeg is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes to sell for the upcoming season in order to increase her working capital. She is a very trusted client of Transcapital Co Ltd.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell in the upcoming season

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married and has four children. Grace operates a grocery shop at Asebu Ekroful, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a driver. Grace uses her income to help her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Grace will use the loan to purchase more groceries to give variety to her customers. With the new profits, Grace will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to offer variety to her customers.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson used his previous loan to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business. Since his dream is educating his children and increase his daily savings, he intends to buy more motorcycles and hire them out, having discovered this business as a direct answer to his dream. Wilson needs this loan to buy a second motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du BENKADI I sont par des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et  en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles à Kantola, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, AMI, deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,5 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 225.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Benkadi 1" are married women averaging 35 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in Kantola, a village in Commune de Guegneka, in Dioïla Prefecture. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of further carrying out their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown are millet and peanuts. They are on their third collaboration with the institution.

With this new loan, AMI, who is the second person standing from the right in the photo, intends to buy supplies and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 1.5 hectares of millet and peanuts. After the harvest, the produce is sold in Fana City to a customer base composed of men and women. 

AMI plans on making an average profit of about 225,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, weeding, and sundry farm equipment

loans.name: Kondokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KONDOKPO composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Léontine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 40 ans. Léontine est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Marcellin. Le couple a quatre enfants, scolarisés et à leur charge. Léontine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Léontine vend des boules d'akassa et du sodabi (boisson locale), ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Léontine s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Léontine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe KONDOKPO, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des vivres et du sodabi.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis 2011 ,rassemble des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le petit commerce et l'agriculture

Faty qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 55 ans,est mariée et mére de 05 enfants dont 02 filles.

Son activité est le commerce d'arachide.

Elle compte acheter 300 kg d'arachide à 275f le kg,soit une valeur de 82500f.

Avec le bénéfice,elle compte renforcer son épargne  et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was established in 2011 and is comprised of members who live in the same village and work in retail trade and agriculture. 

Faty, who is found on the far right in the photo with her hand raised, is the featured borrower of the group. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of five children, of whom two are girls.

Faty works selling groundnuts. She plans to buy 300 kilograms of groundnuts for 82,500 francs (275 francs per kilogram). 

With the earnings, she hopes to strengthen her savings and support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy sacs of groundnuts

loans.name: Kajuju

texts.en:
Kajuju is a married woman with one child who attend school. She lives at her own  house that has piped water but no  electricity. She cites school fees and food being her greatly monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past two years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating of hairdressing skills in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: AZIZA R. lives near the Dar es Salaam International Airport. She makes and sells concrete bricks. She has employed four assistants in her business. She is married with five children, three of whom are in secondary school and two in primary school. Aziza started this business three years ago. Since then, the business had grown very slowly, contrary to what she anticipated, although concrete bricks are in high demand. She identified two main problems facing her business. One problem is inadequate capital and the second is irregular water supply. She now intends to combat these problems to make her business improve. Water is vital to her business. Concrete making uses a lot of water. Irregular water supply in her area makes her business difficult. She wants to build a concete water tank to act as a reservoir when the water supply is irregular. To implement her plan, Aziza is in need of $550.

loans.use: To purchase materials for a concrete making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agnes would like to buy farm inputs i.e. fertilisers, planting seeds and farm tools

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en: Q. Allahverdi is one of the oldest people in his town. He is 68. He is married and has 7 children. He already has as his small business a small herd of sheep. But for better life for his children he wants to purchase also 1 cow and 1 calf. He is applying for a 1200 USD loan from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Usmon

texts.en: Usmon P. is 33 years and is married with 4 children.  He has had a shop in a Yavan market where he sells auto car parts for 6 months.  For the loan amount for $1000 Usmon plans to obtain new auto parts for new types of cars, which are in great demand.  This business brings locals benefit; it is means that they do not need go far from the district to obtain necessary auto parts. Usmon plans topay off the loan amount in 10 months.

loans.use: to obtain auto car parts

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Mr. S. Him has had a fish business since 1979. He started fishing by learning from the older members of his family. In addition, he raises cows in his village. His wife helps him sell fish in the market; sometimes she sells the fish wholesale to the middle man. Mr S.'s oldest son helps him look after the cows. Mr. S. was married in 1980 and has 5 sons.

This is Mr S.'s first request for a loan from MAXIMA, and he is requesting $500. He will use this loan to purchase fishing net to expand his existing business, and to repair his fishing boat.

loans.use: Purchase fishing net to expand his existing business and repair the fishing boat.

loans.name: Alberto Félix

texts.es:
The responsibility with which they work and the service they bring to their clients, are the principal characteristics of Alberto's well-known printing shop and his family's work.

Alberto is 53 years old, and ever since he married Paulina, he decided to open up a printing shop. They used to run this shop in the city of Arequipa, but later decided to move it to the city of Juliaca. With the help and dedication of their 4 children (all adolescents), little by little the small shop grew due to the requests and needs of their many clients. At present, it is one of the busiest print shops in their city, and it is for this reason that this printing family wishes to improve their services to meet with the great number of requests and solicitations they're receiving. To this end, Señor Alberto would like to receive a loan, which he will use to purchase materials of good quality (paper and ink).
