He promises to reimburse the loan amount within a period of 6 months.

With your help, Alberto and his family, will be able to find the means that they have proposed.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La responsabilidad con la que trabajan y el buen servicio que brinda a sus clientes, son las principales características por la que es conocida la imprenta del señor Alberto y su emprendedora familia.Alberto de 53 años de edad, desde que se casó con Paulina, su fiel esposa decidió abrir una imprenta, taller que en un principio funcionaba en la ciudad de Arequipa, pero que por cuestiones familiares decidieron trasladarla a la ciudad de Juliaca.Ahora con apoyo y dedicación de sus cuatro hijos ya adolescentes el pequeño taller fue implementándose poco a poco y obteniendo gran cantidad de clientes y pedidos; en estos momentos es una de las imprentas más concurridas de su ciudad y es por esa razón que esta emprendedora familia desea ampliar e implementar aún más su pequeño taller para cumplir con la gran cantidad de pedidos y solicitudes.Para llevar a cabo este hecho el señor Alberto desea obtener un préstamo que utilizará para adquirir materia prima (papel, tinta) prometiendo reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses.Con vuestra ayuda Alberto y su familia podrán conseguir la meta que se han propuesto.

loans.use: To purchase ink and paper to satisfy the needs and requests of their dear clients. (Compra de tinta y papel para satisfacer las necesidades y pedidos de sus queridos clientes.)

loans.name: Kely Amelia

texts.es:
Kely Amelia A. G. is a single 24 year old with one child. She finished high school and currently lives in Caserio Tupac Amaru in the Carabama district of Julcan province of the state of La Libertad.

After finishing school Kely began selling soaps, detergents and milk. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300.00 ($100.00) she expanded the selection in her small grocery store to include food products such as: rice, sugar, candles, wheat, oil, etc. Little by little her business has grown and she currently sells curds and shoes which she brings from Trujillo. She also has begun raising and selling small animals (sheep and pigs).

With the loan of S/. 1000.00 ($350.00), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy wholesale clothing in Trujillo along with three bags of sugar, two of rice, barley, “chochos,” etc. Kely dreams of one day owning a home and business in Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Kely Amelia A. G. tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño, estudió secundaria completa. Vive en el Caserío Tupac Amaru del distrito de Carabamba, provincia de Julcán, departamento de La Libertad.

Al salir del colegio, como no pudo continuar estudiando, se dedicó al negocio y comenzó vendiendo una docena de jabón, detergente y leche. Con su primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300.00 compró otros productos para continuar surtiendo su bodega con arroz, azúcar, velas, trigo, aceite, etc. Poco a poco ha ido creciendo y ahora vende también cuajada y zapatos que los lleva de la ciudad de Trujillo además se dedica también a la crianza y venta de animales menores como carneros y cerdos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará ropa al por mayor en la ciudad de Trujillo, tres bolsas de azúcar, dos sacos de arroz, cebada, chochos, etc. La señora Kely sueña con tener una casa y un negocio grande en la ciudad de Trujillo.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and other dry goods (sugar, rice, barley, etc).

loans.name: Juana's Group

texts.en:
Juana, Dina, and Liliana are members of the community bank “Desarollo”. They have been associates for four months, two years, and four years respectively. In that time they have learned good business practices such as saving, punctuality, and responsibility. They have also learned values such as respect.

Juana is 27 years old and has three children. She has had a business making bricks for the past five years. She learned this trade while working in a larger brick-making operation but prefers having her own business.

Dina is 22 and has two children. She owns a bakery. Dina makes bread and then sells it from a stand in the town market.

Likewise, Liliana is in her 20s. She is 24 and has one child. Four years ago Liliana used a loan from her community bank to start a business selling fish. She sells the fish from a stand in front of her house.

Juana, Dina, and Liliana need loans of 800, 1000, and 800 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying more business supplies. With the loans they will able to buy in bulk and receive a lower price. With the community bank each women has an interest-earning savings account. Juana, Dina, and Liliana plan to use their savings on their homes. They all dream that their children will have better lives and continue to move up in the world.

loans.use: Juana, Dina, and Liliana need loans of 800, 1000, and 800 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying more business supplies.  With the loans they will able to buy in bulk and receive a lower price.

loans.name: Angela's Group

texts.en: Angela F.’s group is made up of four female entrepreneurs in the Buguruni area of Dar es Salaam. Angela is the leader of the group, and she runs a bar that sells soda, beer, water, and other beverages. The group is requesting a loan to help fund their businesses.

loans.use: Fund business expansion.

loans.name: Nubia Raquel

texts.es:
In the town of Five Pines in Chinandega city, Mrs. Nubia G. works selling clothing out of her home. She is the mother of two children (a girl and a boy). She is very proud of her kids, as they are excellent students.

Mrs. Nubia G. has begun renovating her house. Yet due to the low income she generates from selling clothes she doesn't have the resources to continue with the renovation. For this reason she seeks support from Ceprodel. She aims to buy construction materials with the loan she receives. This way she will be able to finish what she started and provide her kids and family with a decent place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Nubia G. se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa en su casa de habitación. Es madre de dos pequeños (un niño y una niña) los cuales se siente muy orgullosa debido a que son excelentes alumnos.

Actualmente la señora Nubia G. ha iniciado la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación habiendo invertido en el inicio de esta actividad pero a pesar de sus bajos ingresos económicos que percibe de la venta de ropa no logra obtener los suficientes recursos para continuar con la reconstrucción. Es por esta razón que busca apoyo crediticio en Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener recursos económicos para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así terminar la actividad que comenzó para brindarle a sus hijos y familiares un techo digno donde vivir.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 46 years old. He has 4 children. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. Hussein is in the agriculture business. This is the first time he has applie for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to prepare his land and buy fertilizers for his business.

loans.use: to prepare a land and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Nuraly

texts.en: M. Nuraly lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. Mr. M. Nuraly, as many his fellow villagers, raises and sells livestock. It is the family business where his wife helps him. Mr. M. Nuraly is 47 years old, is married and has 6 children. He dreams of having a large flock. He has the appropriate skills and he has 30 years experience in livestock. He also works in the collective farm. Mr. M. Nuraly applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull

loans.name: Geny Del Rosario

texts.es:
Geny del Rosario took over her sister’s general store 3 years ago in order to generate income without having to leave her children unattended. She has two daughters, ages18 and 16, and two sons, ages 23 and 12. She wanted to help out with the family expenses. Because of her efforts, both her client base and the demand for her products have grown thanks to her great service.

She now needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase a greater quantity of goods and meet customer demand. With your help, Geny will reinforce her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Geny del Rosario inicio su tienda de abarrotes hace 3 años, ya que antes era de su hermana ella la adquirio para poder tener un ingreso sin dejar a sus hijos solos es madre de 2 mujeres que actualmente tienen 18 y 16, y de dos varones uno de 23 y uno de 12, ella deseaba contribuir con el gasto familiar, debido a su esfuerzo su clientela ha aumentado y la demanda de productos tambien gracias al buen servicio que les proporciona.

Ahora ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir mayor cantidad de mercancía para cubrir la demanda que tiene. Con tu ayuda Geny consolidara su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene entered the field of textiles at a young age, and her great experience and practice has made her into a textile-producing "machine," as her quality work is in high demand. She is 34 years old, and is the mother of 3 children. Marlene and her husband, who is a construction worker, work hard to offer their children quality education and happiness, as they are still students. To compliment her income, Marlene is learning how to decorate fabric, and her goal is to have her own workshop one day. To do so, she wants to increase the types of fabrics with with she works, and later enlarge and improve her small business. To achieve this goal Marlene hopes that you trust her and offer her the loan that she is seeking.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Marlene se inició en el arte textil desde muy temprana edad de forma empírica, sin embargo la experiencia y la práctica hicieron de esta mujer una máquina de trabajo, ya que es muy solicitada por su buena labor. A sus 34 años es madre de 3 niños, que aún están estudiando, por la que ella y su esposo Néstor, quien trabaja en la construcción, dan todo su esfuerzo por brindarles una buena educación y felicidad.Para complementar su negocio, Marlene está aprendiendo decoración de telas, su meta es tener su propio taller, pero para ello quiere implementarse con diversos materiales y posteriormente ampliar y mejorar el lugar donde tiene su pequeño negocio, para realizar esta meta espera que confíes en ella brindándole el préstamo que solicita.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and rent space for her workshop.

loans.name: Rupa

texts.en:
Rupa G. lives in a single family household with her husband and two daughters in Bagdol, Lalitpur.  Her husband's name is Bin Bahadur G. and he is currently in Dubai to earn money.  Both of her daughters are studying in grade 12.

Mrs. G. opened her poultry farm 2 years ago to upgrade the standards of her family.  Her aim is to send their children to a good college.  Mrs. G. sells her chicken in the local market.  Her daughters also help her in her work. 

Nowadays, in Nepal, the demand for chicken is increasing rapidly.  To meet the demand she has to expand her business.  So, Mrs. G. is requesting a Rs 15000.00 loan to buy small chickens for her business.

loans.use: To buy small chickens to expand her business.

loans.name: Maguno's Mpaji Ni Mungu Group

texts.en:
Maguno is 48 and divorced with 5 children between 29 and 3 years old. She has been a charcoal and clothes seller since 1999. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Magunao now requests a loan to buy more charcoal and clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Neema, who has a business dealing with clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fatima Argentina

texts.es: La Sra. Fátima tiene 41 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Monte Cristo, de la capital de Managua,  tienen un hijo que esta estudiando  y es madre soltera pues ha tenido que trabajar para salir adelante con su hijo, pero ha tenido el apoyo de su familia pues ha logrado tener su propio negocio que es una librería con nueve años de experiencia en las ventas. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en la librería  quiere comprar productos de cosméticos y perfúmenes para diversificar los productos y captar mas clientes. A largo plazo poner otra librería y crecer en inventario como en ventas, también tener salud para poder ayudar a su hijo con los estudios.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatima M. is 41 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Monte Cristo in the capital city of Managua. She has one son who is currently in school. She is a single mother who has had to work in order to move forward with her son, but she has had her family’s support. She has managed to open up her own bookstore, and now has nine years of experience in sales. She will invest this loan in the bookstore, and also wants to purchase perfume and cosmetics in order to diversify her products and attract more customers. In the long run, she hopes to open up another bookstore and increase both her inventory and sales, as well as be healthy enough to help her son with his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies and cosmetics

loans.name: Costancia

texts.en:
Costancia M. is 45 years old and lives in Dar es Salaam. She is married and has two children, one of whom is already 24, while the other one is only 6 and a half years old. Additionally, she is responsible for taking care of two other children whose parents do not have the means to support the family. 
Costancia earns income through various businesses, including raising kuku (chickens), making baskets, and making vinyagos. 
Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chicken in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. The activity requires little start-up capital and space, and, while the chicken are growing, they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. 
Due to Costancia's business skills, she has also managed to develop a successful vinyagos-sales venture. A vinyago is a beautiful, hand-crafted statue made from wood by members of the Makonde tribe who come from southeastern Tanzania. Woodcarving is an important part of Makonde life, both in ancestor worship and in their own myth of creation. Their wooden statues are of three main types: traditional masks, motifs of female ancestor worship, as well as more abstract, modern forms.

Costancia works 9-12 hours a day, 6 days a week at her different enterprises with the assistance of one employee.  She currently needs a loan of US$550 in order to expand her businesses. Contancia thanks everyone for their support.

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokheang S., 33, and her husband, Mr. Neang Ny, 32,  live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2000 and have two daughters. One of them attends school and the other one is still young and stays at home.

Sokheang has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village who then takes it to sell at the Phnom Penh market. Her husband, Neang, has been selling pigs for ten years. He buys them at one village for resale at another village.

Sokheang is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase silk material for weaving and to buy pigs for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and to buy pigs for resale.

loans.name: Changamkeni Group

texts.en:
Eva Makidadi, age 45, is married with five children (ages 28, 24, 21, 14 and 8). She has businesses selling charcoal and clothes. She started these businesses 20 years ago and works daily from 6am until 8pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $285.

This will be Eva's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to build one room and to pay school fees and she has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a third loan to pay school fees and to increase stock in both businesses.

Eva will share this loan with her loan group, Changamukeni, which totals 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Eva is third from left standing.

loans.use: To pay her children's school fees and to increase her inventories of coal and clothes.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan P. is 40 years old and resides in Bati district, Takeo province, Cambodia, with her husband and three of her children. She works as a rice farmer to raises her standard of living, and earns around $1 every day. Her husband, Ny Sarith, 41, is a construction worker and typically makes $3 a day. This couple also gets support from their daughter, who is employed as a garment factory worker. Their other two children are students.

Mrs. Chan P. is asking for a loan of $900 to purchase cows to help plow the farmland.

loans.use: Purchase cows to help plow the farmland

loans.name: Achille

texts.fr: Mr Achille M. est né le 12/05/1974 à Aného. Il est marié et a cinq (05) personnes à charges. Il vit actuellement dans la ville de sa naissance avec sa famille. Il est mécanicien à deux roues. Mais avec la crise économique que traverse notre pays, son activité ne lui permet plus de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il veut associer à son ancienne activité le commerce de pétrole lampant qu'il achète à la pompe et le revend en détail. Ce commerce marche dans la préfecture à cause du délestage dont souffre particulièrement cette partie du pays. Les revenus qui découleront de l’exercice de cette activité lui permettront de rembourser son crédit et de faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Achille M. was born on May 5, 1974 in Aného. He is married and supports five people. Currently he lives in the city of his birth with his family and is a motorbike mechanic. But with the economic crisis cutting across our country, his business no longer allows him to provide for his family. He wants to add to his previous business by including commerce in lamp fuel, which he buys at the pump and resells. This commerce works in the prefecture because of the cuts in electricity from which this particular region of the country suffers. The income derived from this business will enable him to repay the loan and to cope with the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell kerosene

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila is a 51 year old food and vegetable vendor. She has been in this business since her first loan with ASHI. She sells vegetables from her backyard, has ventured into buying and selling, and makes Bandi (made of young coconut meat with muscovado sugar). 
	
	In addition to her food and vegetable vending business, she is also starting to raise hogs. Her loan will be used to purchase inventory and as start-up capital for her new business: raising hogs. Actually raising hogs is not new to her; she has lots of experience and ideas on raising hogs. 

	She dreams of expanding this business and having a space/stall in her town public market. She also dreams that her children will stay in school until they finish their studies. She knows that ASHI gave a woman like her an opportunity to have access to capital and gave her self-confidence and the realization that she is a woman to be trusted.

loans.use: To purchase of  a head of piglets, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 52-year-old divorced woman who lives in Tyre, in Southern Lebanon. Nada owns a grocery store. She has requested a loan of $2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise and diversify her stock. This is the first time that Nada has requested a loan.

Nada is distinguished in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she had difficulty finding the proper place to open her shop and find a cheap rent. In the future, Nada plans to expand her business.

loans.use: Nada will use the loan to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.en:
Dũng Vũ (632981251) is a 46 year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, Dũng owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a butcher shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling pork in the local community. Dũng has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 Vietnamese Dong a month from these activities.

In 1998, Dũng joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dũng has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business. Dũng is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 Vietnamese Dong which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Dũng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: To improve the family's living conditions

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.ru: Джумаева Угуло – женщина 43 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она наша давняя клиентка. Уже больше 6-лет, как она у нас кредитуется. 8 лет назад она начинала с уличной торговли возле школы. У нее был маленький столик, на котором она продавала бутерброды и сладости для школьников. Сейчас у нее есть маленький магазинчик на продуктовом рынке Спитаменского района. Товар ей привозит фирма, которая занимается поставкой продуктов питания оптом. В будущем Угулой планирует расширять бизнес, и открыть свой продуктовый магазин в центре Спитаменского района.
texts.en:
Uguloy J. is a 43-year-old woman, who is married and the mother of three children. She is a longtime client of MicroInvest, and for the past six years has been a loan customer. Eight years ago she became a street vendor after school. She had a small table from which she sold sandwiches and sweets to the students. Now she has a small shop at the Spitamen produce market. A company that engages in the wholesale supply of food products delivers the goods to her. In the future, Uguloy plans to expand the business, and open her own produce shop in the center of the Spitamen region.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of food products

loans.name: Razia Abdul Aziz Group

texts.en:
Razia baji and her husband, A. A., have lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Borewala is famous for its sweetmeat. A. A. has run a barber shop where he cuts people hair and trims their beards for the past 2 years. Razia baji is a tailor because she wants to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy items like chairs, tables and scissors for her husband’s barber shop.

Razia baji leads a group that includes two other women from her locality. Ramzanay baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sardaran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery store.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy items for a barber shop

loans.name: Gere

texts.en:
Gere L. is currently in the business of selling sandals and is requesting a loan to purchase clothes and earrings to sell. Gere is 29 years old and married; her husband is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a lorry to hire out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and earrings to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida P. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 50 years old, married, and has five adult children. Aida owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Aida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Aida is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 12th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Celina

texts.pt:
Celina C. nasceu em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de Suazilandia e viúva é mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 20 aos 35 anos de idade. Todos estão empregados no trabalho.

Inicia os seus estudos muito tarde devido à falta de transporte, pois ela nasceu numa localidade (Mandevo) que dista 10 km da vila do Município de Namaacha. Com 12 anos passa a viver em casa da sua tia e consegue iniciar com seus estudos, quando freqüentava a 3ª classe esta fica grávida e perde a sua vaga, no mesmo ano junta se com seu esposo este que era guarda fronteira, anos depois este perde a vida e Celina fica desesperada. Consequentemente ela ganha uma indimnizaçao proveniente do serviço do seu falecido marido e inicia seu próprio negócio de venda de roupas, calções e almofadas adquiridas na áfrica do sul gastando em todas as viajem um valor de 10.000.00MT e revendidas na cidade capital maputo, tendo de lucro um valor mensal de 5.000.00MT, pois seus clientes têm pagado em dois prestações cada peça que forem a levar. tem contribuído para colocar o produto mais perto  do consumidor reduzindo desta forma os custos de deslocação,e aliviar algumas despesas familiares. Para alem dos seus netos responsabiliza se pelos seus bisnetos que vivem com ela em sua casa.

Este e o terceiro empréstimo de Celina na Hluvuku e Primeiro com kiva. Estes 15.000.00MT serão usados para aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria e satisfazer mais ainda a necessidade do cliente a tempo. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para construir um salão de beleza e boutique, tornar se numa grande comerciante e criar postos de trabalho para os outros.
texts.en:
Celina C. was born in Namaacha a village at the frontier with Suazilandia, she is a widow and has 5 children who are between 20 and 35 years old. They are all working. She started her studies very late because of the lack of transportation, she was born at Mandevo which is 10km from the municipality of Namaachaa. When she was 12 she went to live to her aunt's house and was able to start studying. When she was on the 3rd grade she got pregnant and lost her school vacancy, the same year she started living with her husband who was a guard at the frontier, years later he lost his life and Celina ended up desperate. She received an indemnity from his husband's service and started her own business selling clothes, underwear and pillows she gets from South Africa, she spends on each trip 10,000.00MT and sells them in the city of Maputo, obtaining a monthly profit of 5,000.00MT, because her clients pay her in two parts any piece they buy, this has facilitated product placement closer to the consumer reducing this way the costs and helping with her family expenses. This is why two of her grandchildren take care of her great grandchildren who live with her at home. This is the third loan of Celina with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. These 15,000MT will be use to increase the volume of her merchandise and satisfy the necessities of her clients on time. She is sure she will pay the loan before the time established and will request a new loan to build a beauty parlor and boutique, she wants to turn into a great business person and create employment for others.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in her businesss

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah sells building material and house paints. She has been in this business for years and she has been able to use her years of experience to retain her customers. Hannah is 27 years old, married, and has one child. Hannah has been borrowing from LAPO for the past 2 years and the loan has positively increased her business. She hopes for the loan amount of 70,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more building materials and house paint to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials and paint to sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est mariée à Paul, chauffeur de profession. Marie vit avec sa famille à Cocotomey non loin de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Marie vend chez elle à la maison des produits vivriers (riz, haricot, maïs, sorgho…) et des savons. Marie a besoin de mieux développer ses activités afin de fidéliser sa clientèle. Mais pour y arriver, Marie a besoin de moyens financiers. C’est pourquoi, Marie sollicite de crédit de la part d’ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de cartons de savons et de sacs de haricot.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
“Use all your opportunities to attain your goals” says Lydia T. of Barangay Kinacao Baretbet, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. After her graduation from college, she married Mario T. Sr. and they are blessed with four children. Being an industrious mother, the three oldest children have already finished their college studies and have begun their chosen professions. The youngest has not yet completed school. Lydia is really proud of all of them.

Her husband cultivates their farm lot by planting rice and vegetables for two crops a year. Lydia uses her time to manage their community based store and operate direct selling of AVON products in their village. She is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 from Kiva lenders to provide additional capital for her store and direct selling business. She hopes that lenders will provide her the loan in order to improve her livelihood and allow her to be of further help to her husband.

loans.use: To provide additional capital

loans.name: Samuel's Group

texts.en: I. Samuel is a 49 year old man and married with 6 children aged 30 – 14 years with 4 still in school. He is a business man involved in the sale of coffee and goats from Nabuti village for 20 years now and this kind of exposure has won him more customers. He has his own suppliers that bring the goods from the villages to his store hence saving on the would be transport. He makes sure that he pays cash to those that supply to him and in this; he ensures that he does not run out of stock. Samuel has a dream of buying a lorry to be used to collect the goods from the farmers at their farms as well as rent it out for more earnings. He also hopes to start a poultry farm in the near future. At the moment, Samuel needs a loan to help buy more fresh and dry coffee for increased stock.

loans.use: Buying more coffee for increased stock.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary tiene 49 años, está separada de su pareja, pero tiene 4 hijos con los que vive. Desde el momento de su separación tuvo que doblegar sus esfuerzos en sus cultivos, pese a eso sus frutos cítricos como la naranja y mandarina no le eran suficientes para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos. Entonces emprendió un negocio de venta de ropa de segundo uso, dedicándose a ofrecer de casa en casa de los pueblos rurales cercanos a su localidad, por lo que debe de trasladarse a pie durante varias horas. Esta actividad le ha resultado ser muy rentable, pero no por ello deja de cuidar sus sembríos, ya que en algunas fechas claves le generan ingresos satisfactorios. Por eso, Mary se siente muy feliz con ambas actividades, ya que mediante ellas a sus hijos no les falta nada.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, donde ha demostrado ser muy responsable en cada uno de sus pagos; asimismo, asiste a todas las reuniones programadas de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa, además de fertilizantes para sus plantas cítricas.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería y compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel es casado, tiene una niña de una año, de profesion Ingeniero Civil, habitante de la de zona 4 de Nueva Guinea, solicita su primer crèdito a AFODENIC y espera ser beneficiado por  el fondo Kiva para comprar una computadora, necesita obtener su propio equipo de trabajo para fortaler sus labores diaria pues indispensable para poder cumplir con sus compromisos, él  labora en la Alcaldía municipal desempeñandose como consultor de diseños y presupuesto de construcciòn en general, Abel es un joven de buenos principios religiosos, de familia reconocida, honesta, y muy querido en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Abel is married and has a one year old daughter. He is a civil engineer, and he lives in Zona 4 in New Guinea. He is asking AFODENIC for his first loan. He hopes to benefit from Kiva funds to buy a computer. He needs to obtain he own work equipment in order to strengthen his daily work. It is indispensable to be able to complete his obligations. He works on the general construction budget and as a design consultant at the municipal town hall. Abel is a young man with good religious principals, is from a well known family, is honest, and is very loved in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 63 years old and married. She runs a small eating place in Kajiado, a small town near Nairobi. She prepares and sells chapati, tea, and mandazi (a Kenyan doughnut). She has been in business for ten years and successfully completed a previous loan through Faulu for 20,000 KES. This loan is for 20,000 KES, and she will use the funds to expand her eating place and add stock.

Grace describes herself as hardworking, innovative, and self-driven. Her goal is to have the best hotel in town.

loans.use: To expand eating place & add stock

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
A L. vivienda D. L. señora Francisca D. L. R. le está haciendo falta lo elaboración D. una cuarto, ya que es madre D. familia y tiene dos hijas adolescentes que necesitan su propio espacio en L. casa.
Desea construir L. recamara D. material ya que es más segura y duradera para ellas. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagar le a L. persona que contratara para realizar L. mejora. 
Doña Francisca trabaja D. limpieza en una casa particular este es le ingreso con el que pagara el préstamo, ya que su esposo el señor Faustino González se encargara D. los gastos familiares con el ingreso D. su negocio D. reparación D. aparatos electrónicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca D. L. R.'s home needs an additional room built so that her two teenaged daughters can have their own space in the house. She would like to build the room out of mortar and brick so that the girls are safe. She is requesting the loan in order to buy the materials and hire the person who will build the addition to the house. Francisca works as a housekeeper and with her income, she will repay the loan. Her husband, Faustino González, will cover the family expenses with the income he receives from his electronic appliance repair business.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room in her home

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime, de 22 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es apoyar en los gastos del hogar para que su familia pueda salir adelante.

Junto a su inseparable carretilla, Jaime sale todas las tardes a vender su delicioso popcorn, él se ubica en una de las esquinas más transitadas de la plaza central de la ciudad, donde tiene muchos clientes, ya que vende porciones mejor servidas que la competencia, además que es muy amable a la hora de atender a sus clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de la mañana para continuar con sus estudios universitarios, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar por las noches soportando las lluvias y el intenso frío. 
Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero necesario para tener una tienda donde pueda vender su popcorn con más tranquilidad.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Jaime con MFP, él está muy feliz de la oportunidad de crédito y por ello está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es muy querido, ya que es el más alegre del grupo. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para elaborar una mayor cantidad de sus deliciosas palomitas de maíz.
texts.en:
Jaime, 22, is an unassuming, hard-working young man who lives with his parents. His greatest wish is to help with household expenses to that his family can get ahead. With is trusty cart, Jaime goes out daily to sell his delicious popcorn. He sets himself up on one of the city's main square's busiest corners where he sees many customers, who come to him because he serves better portions than his competitors and, in addition, he is very personable while tending to his customers. What he likes the most about his work is that it leaves his mornings free to pursue his university studies. He has been engaged in this line of work for 3 years and he considers the most difficult part of his job having to work nights withstanding the rains and intense cold. In time, he hopes to gather enough money to have a store from which to sell his popcorn more comfortably. This is his third loan with MFP. He is very happy to have credit and is willing to repay punctually. He is well liked in his communal bank because he is the most cheerful of them all. With the 1000 soles requested he will buy the ingredients needed to produce larger amounts of his delicious popcorn.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy popcorn ingredients.

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
Haidee G. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 30 years old and single. To make a living, Haidee owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Haidee has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $62 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Haidee joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Haidee has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Haidee is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to add to her products for sale. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to add to her products for sale.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Mrs. Lon P., who lives in Snuol Khpos village in Takeo province, is 40 years old. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a silk weaver.

Since her silk-weaving business is going well, Mrs. Lon P. needs a loan to expand it by purchasing more silk and to hire weaving laborers.

Mrs. Lon P. is a widow with two children, one of whom is a silk weaver while the other is too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To purchase more silk and to hire workers

loans.name: C8323 Abunzubumwe Group

texts.en:
Elie is 47 years old. He is married, but does not have children. He lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda. Elie is the representative of group called Abunzubmwe in Kinyarwanda, the local language.This loan group has 10 members who have different business.

Elie has his own clothing shop in the Gakenke district of the Northern Province, which is approximately 2 hours drive from the capital city. He has 6 years of experience selling various styles of clothes. His shop is open from 6:00 AM to 16:00 PM every day except Saturday.

Elie is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance to expands his business by purchasing more various styles for men and woman. With this loan, Elie hopes to attract more customers to his shop and, hopefully, to earn more profit in the process. This, in turn, will help him to save money to buy a car to be used in his business.

loans.use: To buy various styles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Sovin

texts.en:
Mr. Sovin P. (pictured here), 51, and his wife, Mrs. Nary Din, 45, live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 1979 and have 4 children: 2 sons and 2 daughters. Two are married and live in their own homes. One son is a mechanic and one daughter goes to school.

Sovin and his wife have been selling dessert for almost ten years. They sell their products at Phnom Penh market. Sovin previously requested a loan to purchase a motorbike for his daughter to drive to school. His daughter uses the motorbike every day. 

He is now asking for another loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his son to drive to work. He will also use the loan to build a kitchen.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his son to drive to work and to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  Emilio,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestro socio está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en el departamento de Cusco a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestro socio tiene  36 años de edad, el es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad,  Nuestro socio es una persona responsable y muy dedicada a la familia, el socio trabaja desde 1994 en una empresa de exportación de artesanía, el socio empezó de ayudante y hacia trabajos menores, pero poco a poco aprendió el arte y formar la arcilla y empezó a descubrir que sus manos podían elaborar maravillas y hasta hoy sigue trabajando considerado uno de los mejores trabajadores en su empresa, Nuestro socio desearía a futuro abrir su propio taller de artesanía, pero él siente que esta empresa le dio todo y le pagan muy bien y le permite seguir creciendo por lo que el poner un taller propio significaría la competencia del dueño a quien admira y respeta entonces no piensa hacerle la competencia, nos comenta que seguirá elaborando este arte en aquella que es su segunda casa, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la construcción de su casa.

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member Emilio belongs to “Los Solidarios” communal bank. He lives in Urubamba province in the department of Cuzco, an hour from the city of Cuzco. Our member is 36 years old and has a live-in partner. He has two children, aged 5 and 3. Emilio is a responsible person and very dedicated to his family. Since 1994, he has worked for a handicraft export company. He began as an assistant and did small jobs, but little by little he learned the art and how to shape clay, and he began to discover that his hands could make wonderful things. He still works there and is considered one of the best workers in the company. Our member would like to someday open his own workshop, but he feels that this company gave him everything, they pay him very well, and they permit him to keep growing, and he feels having his own workshop would mean he was competing with the company owner, who he admires and respects. Emilio does not want to compete with him and tells us that he will continue creating art for this company, which is like his second home. Emilio is asking for this loan to help build his house. He is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments at the scheduled times.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Manos Telarañas Group

texts.es:
ROCIO NOEMI, ES CASADA, TIENE 45 AÑOS Y DOS HIJOS D. 9 Y 20 AÑOS D. EDAD. ELLA ES PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO "MANOS TELARAÑAS" DENOMINADO ASI PORQUE LAS SIETE INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO;  SE DEDICAN A LA FABRICACIÓN D. PRENDAS D. VESTIR A BASE D. TEJIDOS MANUALES. 
ROCIO NOEMI, DESD. LOS NUEVE AÑOS, LE NACIÓ EL INTERES POR EL TEJIDO, APRENDIÓ DESD. MUY PEQUEÑA. HACE CINCO MESES ES UNA FUENTE INGRESO PARA SU ECONOMÍA, ELLA PREPARA LAS PRENDAS YA SEA CHOMPAS, POLITOS D. VERANO Y LOS OFRECE A SUS CONOCIDOS Y AMIGOS.
CON ÉSTE NEGOCIO HA LOGRADO MEJORAR ECONÓMICAMENTE, APOYAR A SU ESPOSO Y LO MAS RESCATABLE PARA ELLA ES QUE HA PODIDO CONOCER MAS GENTE Y ASI AUMENTAR SU CLIENTELA.
CON EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO COMPRARÁ MATERIALES PARA PRODUCIR MAS PRENDAS.
texts.en:
Rocio is 45 years old, married, and has two children, ages 9 and 20. She is the president of the “manos telarañas” (Spiderweb Hands) group. It’s called that because its seven members, who live in the Carabayllo district, make articles of clothing by hand. Rocio became interested in sewing nine years ago. She learned the art when she was a little girl. This has been an economic fountain for her for the past five months. She makes the clothing, such as sweaters and summer shirts, and offers them for sale to her friends and acquaintances. This business has allowed her to improve her economic status and to help her husband. What she likes most is that she’s been able to meet lots of people and increase her customer base. She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies to make more clothing items.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for making clothing

loans.name: Alma Nubia

texts.es: La señora Alma Nubia C., habita en las Pilas Orientales, Ubicado en Masaya, junto a esposo, él cual labora como Albañil, ellos tienes cuatro hijos dos de ellos ya independientes y  los menores estudian por la mañana,  y por las tardes le apoyan con los trabajos de campo, doña Alma desde hace siete años, se dedica al cultivo de yuca, y la mayor necesidad es la falta de recursos económicos para poder adquirir toda la madera, esa madera despues se reproducira en yuca, por otra parte se ve afectada por la escases de agua ya que es una zona muy alejada de la cuidad. Los planes hacia un futuro hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida  y reconstruir su vivienda para tener más privacidad.
texts.en:
Alma Nubia C. lives in Pilas Orientales, Masaya, with her husband, who is a bricklayer. They have four children, two of whom are independent and two still in school during the morning. In the afternoons, they help Alma with her farm chores; she has farmed manioc for the last 7 years. Her biggest concern is the lack of financial resources to buy wood which will later become manioc. On the other hand, she is also affected by water shortages because she lives very far from the city. Her plans for the future are to improve her family’s standard of living and to remodel her house in order to have more privacy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional sarongs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: 38-year-old Marilou is a married woman from South Cotabato, Philippines. She has children who go to school. She raises hogs for a living. She also retails rice at her sari-sari store. Last year, Marilou became a member of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines. She was happy to have gained access to this program. She particularly likes its low interest rate, which she thinks is very helpful to small businesses like hers. She recently applied for another loan amounting to PHP10,000. She will use this loan to buy feeds and additional piglets. She will also acquire rice that she caqn retail at her store.

loans.use: To purchase feed and additional shop merchandise.

loans.name: Delmy Maidel

texts.es: Delmy Maidel R. de 24 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo, sus dos hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar, y junto a su madre de 92 años de edad. Delmy posee una venta de productos varios como sandalias para niños, mujeres y hombres, shampoo, acondicionador para el cabello, crema para el cuerpo y gel para fijar el cabello, así mismo vende algunos cosméticos. Su negocio esta ubicado en Santa Tecla, perteneciente al mismo departamento en el cual reside. Delmy debe trabajar muy arduamente para poder brindarle el apoyo económico a su esposo así mismo para poder darle todo lo necesario a su madre quien necesita cuidados especiales debido a  su avanzada edad. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder aumentar sus productos, y así mismo mejorar sus ventas, ya que es esta la única opción que tiene para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de esta manera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Delmy Maidel R., 24, lives in Lourdes Colón, located in the La Libertad department. She lives together with her husband and her two children, who both study, and her 92 year old mother. Delmy has a shop that sells various products such as sandals for children, men and women, shampoo, hair conditioner, body cream and hair gel, and also sells cosmetics. Her business is located in Santa Tecla, which is in the same department where she lives. Delmy must work very hard to provide economic support to her husband, and to provide for her mother, who needs special care owing to her advanced age. Delmy is seeking a loan to be able to increase her products, and improve her sales, as this is the only option she has to help her husband with the household costs and improve their situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory such as sandals and creams

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Honorato

texts.es: Honorato tiene 45 años, es divorciado y tiene dos hijos. Residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la selva tropical cusqueña, donde tiene su propia casa. Honorato recuerda que hace mucho tiempo no tenía nada que ofrecer a su familia, pero sí conocimiento de las técnicas de sembrío y cosecha de Piña, desde entonces empezó a producir y comercializar este producto. Hoy vende su producto a los grandes mayoristas a un precio competitivo, y con los ahorros que obtuvo pudo adquirir un moto carro para ofrecer actualmente el servicio de taxi, de esa manera logró recibir otros ingresos extras. Su fin ahora es diversificar su mercado, por ello su hijo mayor se encarga del cultivo de piña, cuidándolos de las plagas que afecten su producción, siendo al final llevados a los centros de acopio de su misma localidad. Agradece a su familia por el apoyo y ayuda que le dieron en los momentos mas difíciles, por tal motivo es que desea abrir una tienda de venta de ropa, con el propósito de ampliar su mercado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pago, además agradece a la institución por la responsabilidad que  ejercen. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en comprar semillas de piña con la necesidad de mejorar en su producción, además desea darle un mantenimiento adecuado a su motocarro.
texts.en:
Honorato is 45, divorced, and has two children. They live in the town of Quimbiri, located in the tropical forest of Cusco, where he has his own house. Honorato remembers that it has been a long time since he has had nothing to offer his family but the knowledge of pineapple sowing and harvesting techniques, and since then he started to produce and sell this product. Today he sells his product to large wholesalers at a competitive price, and with the savings from this he was able to acquire a three-wheeled car. With it, he now offers a taxi service, and through this he has been able to earn extra income. His current goal is to diversify his market, so his oldest son is in charge of pineapple cultivation, keeping them safe from the plagues and pests that affect production. The pineapples are ultimately brought to collection centres in their area. Honorato thanks his family for the support and help that they give him in the most difficult moments, and for this reason he wants to open a clothing sales store, with the aim of expanding his market and improving his family's quality of life. This is his sixth loan with MFP, and he is committed to continuing to fulfill his repayment obligations. Furthermore, he thanks the institution for the responsibility. With the requested loan, he will invest in buying pineapple seeds with the need to improve his production, and he also wants to properly maintain his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pineapple seeds

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
La señora Justa, tiene dos hijos, tiene 33 años y vive en la cuidad de Huambutio. Su esposo Fredy trabaja en la municipalidad de Cusco. Su actividad económica principal es vender comida y tiene un pequeño restaurante que está ubicado en la avenida principal de la ciudad de Huambutio. Justa pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio” y ella es la secretaria del banco comunal. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo arroz, carne, vegetales y  muchos más.  
        
Justa se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Señora Justa Q. D. is 33 years old. She has two children and she lives in the city of Huambutio. Her husband Fredy works in the municipality of Cusco. Her principal business activity is selling food and she has a small restaurant in Huambutio's main street. Señora Justa Q. D. is a member and the secretary of the “Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio” community bank. She needs a loan to buy supplies such as rice, meat, vegetables and so on. She is grateful for this opportunity and is therefore committed to making the loan repayments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies such as rice, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Felicidad's Group

texts.en:
Felicidad S., 57 years old, is from the village of Tabon. She is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Felicidad is widowed. She owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it. In 2008, Felicidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicidad has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP (her portion of the group loan) which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase her working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Felicidad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Clive Road Womens Group A -Jinja

texts.en: To achieve any kind of flood tide of success in any business, constant planning measures are needed. As a result of 29 year old W. Justine’s good blueprint plans for her 2 year old clothing sales business, she now has a settled means of subsistence. She has succeeded in making profitable use of her short time in business. If comparisons are drawn with her previous source of income-being a cook, all the signs are evident that she has come a long way. The odds of her making more profits in the future are looking good given the 30,000 she makes in a week as profits notwithstanding the competition she faces from other business people. This high spirited single mother of 2 school going children is holding her head high with optimism that with this loan, she will be in a better position to buy more bales of clothes for resell.

loans.use: the buying of more bales of clothes for resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year old single woman living with her parents in Lebanon. She has 15 years of experience working as a farmer. She has been running her own farm since 2001. She uses plastic tents to grow her products. These tents also allow her to better monitor product quality as well as grow her products for more months during the year. She cultivates all type of vegetables and fruits all through the year. She works independently in her business. 

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed supplies for her agricultural work and seeds for the next cultivation. She estimates that the loan will help her increase her profits by 20%. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase needed supplies for her agricultural work and seeds for planting

loans.name: Dewonpele#3 Group

texts.en:
Kumba P., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Dewonpele#3. Kumba is 39 years old, married and has four children who range from 12 to 23 years old. 

She was only able to attend school through 7th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For seven years, she has been selling baby blankets, powder and soap in the Waterside market in Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 16,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 80,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cartons of baby blankets, powder and soap. 

She describes herself as a jovial woman.

Her goals are to improve her business and build a house. In the photo that accompanies this profile, P. M.'s picture is in the inset because he was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of baby blankets, powder and soap

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel L. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is 30 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a service-based business, providing motorcycle transportation to local community members. Ruel has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ruel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide his service

loans.name: Gumercindo Segundo

texts.es:
Gumercindo Segundo Barragán M. tiene 71 anos. Es casado y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos de 50, 45, 42, 40, 39, y 37 anos.  

Gumercindo es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Isidro, que está ubicada a una hora y media de San Miguel. Son 10 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y trigo.
Gumercindo se dedica a la agricultura y a la cria de animales (ganado) como fuente de ingresos de su familia. Lo que mas siembra es el maíz. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en la comunidad mas cerca, San Pablo. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos y un ganado pequeño. Con el apoyo de este credito espera mejorar las condiciones economicos de su familia. Su meta para los proximos anos es que haya el sosteniento del hogar y que hay medicinas. Un desafió es que el mercado de ganado se ha bajado de precio. 

Le gusta participar en las costumbres únicas de su comunidad como San Isidro, el patron de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Gumercindo Segundo Barragán M. is 71 years old. He is married and lives in San Miguel Canton in the province of Bolivar. He has 6 children; they are 50, 45,42, 40, 39 and 37 years old.

Gumercindo is a member of the San Isidro rural ventanilla ( rural loan group), which is an hour and a half away from San Miguel. There are 10 members, the majority of the members farm corn and wheat.

Gumercindo works in agriculture and raises animals (livestock) as a source of income for his family. He also plants corn. He makes purchases and sales of his products in a community closer to him, in San Pablo.

He is requesting this loan in order to buy fertilizer and a small amount of livestock. With the support of this loan, he hopes to improve the economic condition of his family. His goal for the next few years is that the household will be sustained and that there are medications. The challenge is that the prices have fallen in the livestock market.

He likes to participate in the unique customs of his community like the San Isidro celebration, who is the patron saint of the community.

loans.use: to buy agricultural fertilizers and a small amount of livestock

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca R. is from the village of Sto.Domingo, Echague, Isabela. She is 52 years old. Francisca is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Francisca owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables in the community. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Francisca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables for sale

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is a resident of Mughalpura, which is a small area located in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She has lived there with her family in a 2 room brick house for the last 5 years. She is a seamstress by profession. She collects orders from her neighboring clients and provides them with the finished work in the given time period and earns income from it. She does this work to financially support her family.
  
Her husband is a private entrepreneur and has a fruit sales business. He buys seasonal fruits from the fruit wholesale market and sells them on different streets of the city by putting them on a four-wheeled cart. He has been doing this business for over 4 years and works very hard every day to earn good income for the family.
  
Shahida has given birth to 3 sons and a daughter. Her sons are studying in 6th, 2nd, and kindergarten respectively, while her daughter is just 1 year old. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits for his business. Shahida is hopeful that this will help her husband to make more sales and more income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She hopes that it will be a step towards more profits for her husband’s business. She is part of a group loan of four.

Note: “In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Shahida”.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For snacks, meats and rice.

loans.name: Rise And Shine Group - Kayunga

texts.en:
Edith N. is a 57-year-old stickler of diligence who is affiliated with the Rise and Shine group - Kayunga. She has been operating a retail shop for the past decade in Kayunga Town. This growing retail business brings in 120,000 shillings for her on a weekly basis. Edith says to take root in this business, she took a page from a close friend. 

Edith also operates a farming business. As a matter of fact, the farming business was her first business and it's savings from that business that enabled her to start up the retail shop. Edith is happily married with three kids and says this loan is going to help her buy more general merchandise stock for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail merchandise for resale at her shop

loans.name: Solomon Azenga

texts.en: Solomon M. is 35 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom attend school.  For five years, he has been in the business of making new shoes, repairing shoes, and shoe shining.  He also has a farm and sells the produce for additional income.  Solomon is requesting  his first loan from KADET,  which he will use to buy materials for shoe making and shoe shining.  His future plan is to own a shoe shop in town where he will be sell new shoes and employ others to assist him.

loans.use: To purchase shoe making materials

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
B. Deo is a secondary school teacher offering educational services to students and the community. His school is Bwogyera Secondary School. He also has a retail shop and farms, and he is able to make 392,036/= in monthly profit. He has been in business for 28 years as a teacher after going through training. 

B. Deo is an individual client from Ntungamo. He is 58 years old and married with four children. He is very hardworking and dependable. He needs a loan to restock his retail shop for the season so that he can pay school fees for his children come February next year.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TARPUY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila; ella tiene 58 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pijamas de dormir, ella vende en la feria del altiplano, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pijamas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lucila belongs to the Tarpuy Communal Bank.  It is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Lucila is 58 years old, divorced, and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling pajamas.  She sells at the Altiplano fair.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.

She wants to expand and improve her business of selling pajamas.  She is requesting the loan in order to buy merchandise.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro vive en casa propia en Achacachi, en la comunidad de Tipampa de la Provincia Omasuyos, es casado, tiene dos hijos, el señor es chofer y su esposa es productora lechera, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantienen, en anterior crédito realizó la compra de ganado lechero. Ahora necista un nuevo crédito para comprar una hectárea de terreno para su ganado. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Genaro lives in his own home in Achacachi, in the community of Tipampa of the Omasuyos province.  He is married and he has 2 children. He is a driver and his wife is a dairy producer. The income that he earns is able to support them. The previous loan was to purchase a dairy cow. He requests a new loan to purchase a hectare of land for his livestock. He is very happy with the loans he has received. 

His personal history qualifies him to access a new loan and he is considered to be a good client.

loans.use: To purchase land for his livestock.

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en:
Chhen S. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offsprings and for slaughter. In addition, she also assists her husband in the cultivation of crops on her farmland in Kompong Tom province. The couple has two children who are both single and are still studying in the local school.  

Due to the fact that rice harvesting season is coming, Chhen S. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva for capital to buy more rice to store while prices are low, to be used for future sales.

loans.use: To buy rice while prices are low for future sales

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en: Yelena is married with a grown daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol where she runs a small venture selling men’s tops in one of the local markets. All her merchandise is characterized by high quality and reasonable price. Yelena is a workaholic. She works in the worst weather conditions and is ready to sacrifice time and rest to achieve even better results. She has been in the trade for 14 years. Currently, her gross income is about 30,000 grivnyas. Her monthly net profit amounts to 9,000 grivnyas. Yelena has benefited from previous lending assistance. This time she is requesting a loan of 16,000 grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for her kiosk. She hopes to receive additional income and help her elderly parents.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 31 years old, married and has two children aged seven and ten. She has been running a posho mill business for three years and employs one person to help her in her tasks. She was previously running a salon business. As a member of Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in good customer care and as a result is able to attract more customers to her business. Susan is determined to grow her business so that she can earn a better income. She has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy maize.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana H.  es una mujer de 24 años que vive en el municipio de Soledad  y tiene una hija de un año de edad. Diana apoyada por su cónyuge quien le regaló hace  3 años su cesantía , para que aprovechara su potencial emprendedor y se sintiera útil y productiva, logro iniciar su negocio  de venta de mercancías  con una u primera compra de 18 pares de calzado y 6 juegos de cubrelechos que vendió y  como enseguida percibió su buen ingreso; esta inversión fue exitosa l  gracias al aprovechamiento de su clientela potencial doméstica,  oriunda del municipio de Luruaco , Sabanalarga en el departamento del Atlántico y en  La Loma en el departamento del Cesar , donde habitan familiares de ella y de su cónyuge.  En la actualidad en estos municipios ha logrado desarrollar su clientela y como hoy la conoce perfectamente  otorga créditos logrando  el retorno de su inversión cada 15 días. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará electrodomésticos que tiene encargados por sus clientes mas rentables, asegurándose así que  su inversión sea exitosa y logre aumentar su capital de trabajo y con ella sus ingresos.
texts.en: Diana H. is a 24-year-old woman who lives in the municipality of Soledad and has a one-year-old child. With the help of her husband, who was laid off 3 years ago, and to help him take advantage of his entrepreneurial potential and feel useful and productive, Diana was able to start her business selling merchandise with an initial purchase of 18 pairs of shoes and 6 sets of bedcovers, which she sold. Following this, she was able to achieve a good income; this investment was successful thanks to the good response from her potential customers for home products in the municipality of Luruaco, Sabanalarga in the Department of Atlántico, and La Loma in the Department of Cesar, where some of her family members and those of her husband live. Currently, in these municipalities, she has been able to develop her customer base, and since she knows them very well, she can grant them credit and obtain the return on her investment every 15 days. This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and she will use it to buy small home appliances which have been ordered by her most profitable customers. Therefore, she is confident that her investment will be successful, and she will be able to increase her working capital and thus her income.

loans.use: to buy small home appliances which have been ordered by her customers

loans.name: Luvuni

texts.en:
Luvuni is married but has no child. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
