For the past eight years, Luvuni has operated a vegetable and fruit selling business, selling at retail to local customers. She also operates a water distribution business and real estate houses, which contribute to her income. Luvuni dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Luvuni plans to use this 30,000 KES loan to purchase potatoes, cabbages, mangoes and building materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, cabbages, mangoes and building materials

loans.name: Las Toby Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento "LAS TOBY  " se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la Institución, compuesto por 9 personas en la cual todas son mujeres,  sus actividades están entre venta de comida, de bebidas,  venta de cosméticos, son de la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa de tres socias: La Sra. Dora quien es la  presidenta del banco de emprendimiento le eligieron por ser una persona muy responsable solidaria con sus compañeras,   se dedica a la venta de ropa y así mismo el ingreso que genera sustenta su hogar y la educación de sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del crédito comprar ropa de invierno por cantidad ya que se esta acercando la época de frio y ya tiene varios pedidos, es una persona muy trabajadora con ganas de superación su deseo es el de crecer en su negocio y generar mayores ingresos económicos y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The "LAS TOBY" community bank is starting its first loan cycle with the institution.  The group has nine members who are all women.  Their business activities include selling meals, selling drinks and selling cosmetics.  They are from Plan 3000 neighborhood.

This group was founded on the initiative of three members.  One of these members was Dora, the bank's president.  Dora was chosen as the bank's president because she is a responsible person who is supportive of her fellow group members.  Her business is selling clothes and her income supports her household and pays for the education of her school-age children.  She will use her loan money to buy winter clothes in bulk since the cold season is approaching and she already has several orders.  Dora is a very hard-working person who has a desire to better herself.  Her wish is to grow in her business and make more income.  In this way, she will be able to improve her quality of life.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support she has been given.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes in bulk

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
Mustahpa is 46 years old and married with 4 children from ages 4 to 23. He runs a store at Kissy in Sierra Leone.

Mustapha has been in this business for 15 years and sells milk, Ovaltine, sugar, and cocoa at his provision store. He also earns income from renting a house. He says that the main challenge to his business is price increases.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provision items. Mustapha says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living. In the future, he would like to expand and grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cheese, biscuits and drinks.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda,  vive en unión libre con el señor Wilfrido con quien procreo dos hijos que aun están asu  responsabilidad  y son: Carlos Iván  de dieciseis años de edad en cuarto de primaria y Cristian  Jeovanni ni de siete años de edad en segundo de primaria.


      Ella  se dedica ala venta de tacos  en donde lleva  cuatro años y cuatro eses  y solicito el préstamo  para apoyarse en la compra de los ingredientes que utiliza y son: carne, repollo. Tortilla, chile verde, aceite, entre otros, en donde  comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido buenos resultados de ganancias.

     Comenta que cuando antes que se casara  trabajo con una señora que vendía tacos y aprendió como se prepara  y veía que le daba buena ganancias  por eso ella tambien se dedica a lo mismo y si le va bien.

      Lo que mas desea es que con esta  actividad logre salir adelante y  tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda is in a common-law marriage with Wilfrido, with whom she has two children still in her care:  Carlos Iván, who is ten and in fourth grade, and Cristian Jeovanni, who is seven and in second grade.

She dedicates herself to selling tacos, which she has been doing for over four years.  She requests this loan to support herself in the purchase of the ingredients that she uses such as:  meat, cabbage, tortillas, green chilies, and cooking oil, among others.  She comments that things are going well with the business, and she has had good results income-wise.

She tells us that, before she married, she worked with a woman who sold tacos.  She learned how to make tacos from her, and saw that a good income could be generated, which is why she decided to embark in the same type of business.

What she wishes the most for is that, with this activity, she will manage to get ahead and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: buy ingredients for making tacos such as: cooking oil, meat, tortillas and green chilies, among others.

loans.name: Abduabos

texts.en:
Abduabos is a hardworking man who is married and has four children. He is engaged in animal husbandry. Abduabos sells cattle and sheep as well as provides transportation services.  He buys livestock and feeds them for a certain period to fatten them up then sells them. His wife helps him in this business. In addition to this business, he also cultivates vegetables such as potatoes and wheat. Abduabos would like to get a loan of 6,000 TJS to purchase more sheep to expand his animal sales business. With the profit he will make, he plans improve his living conditions. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy more sheep

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 52 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos y desea que terminen de estudiar y sean profesionales ,las socia quiere ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar las mensualidades de su estudio de sus hijos y para comprar productos para cocinar para el restaurant. 
                                                        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member belongs to the "Yahuar Maqui" community bank in the district of Cusco, Peru. She is 52 years old, married and has four children. She dedicates herself to a restaurant business, preparing breakfasts, lunches and dinners from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. Through this business she has been able to make headway for her children, whom she wants to see complete their education and become professionals. She wants to expand her restaurant and is requesting the loan to pay her children's monthly education bills and to purchase cooking products for her restaurant. She feels happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to pay her children's monthly education bills and to purchase cooking products for her restaurant.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 45 years old.  She is married and has 2 adult children.  Rufina has a transportation service business. She has been running this business for 17 years and earns PHP 4,500 a month from this work.

Rufina is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy tires and a sprocket for her motorcycle to maintain the good service she offers in her community.

In the future, Rufina hopes that her business will improve so she can better sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: buy tires and a sprocket for her motorcycle

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys has operated her clothes shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years, selling both new and used clothes. She is 54 and the single mother of one child.

She was introduced to KADET by a field officer and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy clothes in bulk for resale.

In the future, Gladys hopes to grow her shop and open a big boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mery; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agencia de viajes, la socia vende boletos turísticos a los diferentes turistas nacionales e internacionales, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de agencias de viajes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar boletos turísticos para viajar a machupicchu.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of the "Puntualito" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Mery is 40 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her travel agency business.  She sells tourist tickets to domestic and foreign tourists.  She works from 9.00am to 7.00pm and, through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Mery would like to expand her travel agency business.  She is requesting this loan to buy tourist tickets for traveling to Machu Picchu.

Mery is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets for traveling to Machu Picchu

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygame à  Konfon, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, MAIMOUNA, la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Klè, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi 3 Group ("harmony") are married women who, on average, are 35 years old and have five children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Konfon, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Maïmouna, the second woman sitting at the right-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.5 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. Maïmouna expects to make an average profit of around 60,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Mary Cler

texts.en:
Mary Cler, 23 years old, is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has 3 school-aged children to care for. She raises pigs to earn a living and it is her passion to do so. While not her only source of income, Mary Cler earns PHP 6,000 a month from raising pigs.

Earlier this year, Mary Cler joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. For her first loan, she is requesting PHP 5,000 to purchase feed for the piglets. A bigger portion of her monthly income comes from selling the grown animals. Feeding the animals properly provides a good return when sold. Mary Cler hopes to raise them all well and sell them at a very good price. When she receives adequate revenue, Mary Cler will buy more piglets to grow.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the piglets.

loans.name: Soraida

texts.es:
La señora Soraida vive en un barrio en donde celebran la fiesta del  San Francisco de asís  en el mes de   agosto. Ella es casada con el señor Rubiel  y con quien procreo tres hijos que aún están a su responsabilidad.

    Ella invirtió el préstamo en la actividad de venta de cosméticos de la marca avon y jafra en donde lleva practicando 9 años y 8 meses y comenta que le va muy bien ya que le ha dado un buen rendimiento y ha tenido una mejor ganancia.

   Para dedicarse a esta actividad se inspiro ella sola ya que quiere  apoyar a su esposo  quien trabaja en la construcción de block y ella deseaba apoyarlo con los ingresos de la casa para así darle lo mejor a sus hijos.

    Lo que le gustaría es que con el tiempo se distribuidora  de cosméticos para darle empleo a otras personas y también puedan iniciar un negocio.
texts.en:
Soraida lives in a neighborhood where the celebrate the festival of St. Francis of Assisi in August. She is married to Rubiel and with him she's had three children who are still in her care. 

She invested the loan into the business of selling Avon and Jafra cosmetics for nine yeas and eight months, and she says that she has done well and gotten a good salary. 

She motivated herself to do this business because she wants to support her husband who works in block construction and she wants to help him with the household costs in order to give her children a better life. 

What she would like is that, with time, to distribute cosmetics herself to give employment to others and they can also start a business.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of avon, jafra, and other types of cosmetics.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and married. She has five children. She runs a tailoring business in Kilifi. She has been in the tailoring business for the last six years. Her business is faring well, helping her to support her family.

This is Josephine's third loan in KADET. She has repaid her previous loans successfully. This loan will help her purchase a sewing machine and clothing material for her business. Anticipated profits will help her repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a 40 years old mother who is engages in direct selling of AVON, NATASHA and MSE products in her village to generate income. She has three school-age children who are now in secondary education. Despite financial difficulty, she wants to continue sending her children to school because she wants them to earn degrees and become professionals someday. 

Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, Sally aimed to improve her business to increase her income. She wants to ask an additional capital of P15,000 to buy lotions, body sprays, underwear, roll-on, bags, shoes and jewelry to sell in her village. She believes that through her patience and sacrifices, she will improve the business and makes it viable and a profitable source of income.

loans.use: to buy lotions, body sprays, underwear, roll-on, bags, shoes and jewelry for sale

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge de 43 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en su casa propia, no cuentan con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Morropón, una zona agrícola y ganadera que se encuentra situada en el departamento de Piura.

Jorge brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior, la actividad que realiza lo hace durante todo el día hasta las 6 de la tarde, a pesar de la competencia trata de obtener los ingresos necesarios para solventar su necesidades familiares.

Desea solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para usarlo en el mantenimiento y cambio de algunos accesorios para su mototaxi. Necesita mantener sus moto en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda del préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 43 years old.  He lives with his family in their own home, where they don't have electricity or running water.  They live in the district of Morropón, which is an agricultural and livestock region in the department of Piura.

Jorge provides passenger transportation with his mototaxi.  This is a vehicle which has a motorbike and a cabin for passengers.  He does this work every day until 6 p.m.  In spite of the competition, he tries to earn the income necessary to cover his family's expenses.

He wants to request a loan of 1,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he will use to do maintenance and replace several accessory parts on his mototaxi.  He needs to keep his mototaxi in good condition, to be able to provide his customers with good service.

With the help of this loan, he hopes to increase his income and continue moving his family forward in life.

loans.use: to do maintenance and replace some accessory parts on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Bonface is married and blessed with two children. He has been practicing dairy farming for the last two years to make a living. Previously, he was managing a retail shop. He has employed one person to help him manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Bonface is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Arsenal Group

texts.en:
Safina, who is in her early 50s is married with four children and seven grand children. She has been selling fish and charcoal for one year now.  She works from 5 a.m to 8 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzani.  She used the previous loans to increase on the fish stock and also started selling charcoal as well. She has paid back all her loans succesfully. She wants a loan to buy more stock of fish and buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.  Her dream is to one day be able to make her business big.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Arsenal" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fish and buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente, de 34 años de edad, casado, tiene 1 hijo de 5 meses de edad, vive en el Campo del Níspero Santa Bárbara.
Don Vicente tiene una fuente de ingresos que es una finca de café y adicionalmente cultiva granos básicos como frijoles, para el consumo y venta. su padre le dio una herencia de 4 manzanas de terreno donde tiene su cultivo propio. Su motivación a sido que el café esta dejando muy buenas ganancias, tiene 10 años de mantener esta finca aunque su experiencia es de mas años ya que desde pequeño a trabajado la agricultura con su padre.
Su meta es que su finca se mantenga y cosechar buena producción y de las ganancias poder comprar más tierra para cultivos y reparar su vivienda.
Es su primer préstamo y lo va invertir en mantenimiento y limpieza a la finca de café y a sus cultivos de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Vicente, age 34, is married and has a five month old son.  He lives in the Níspero municipality in Santa Bárbara.

Vincente’s source of income is a coffee farm.  Additionally, he grows basic grains like beans for consumption and to sell.  His father gave him an inheritance of four “manzanas” (one 'manzana' = 1.68 acres) of land where he has his own crops.  His motivation has been the fact that coffee is giving him very good income.  He has been cultivating this farm for ten years.  However, he has more than that in years of experience because, ever since he was very little, he has worked in agriculture with his father.

His goals are for his farm to be maintained, to have a good production at harvest, to be able to use the income to buy more land for crops, and to repair his home.

This is his first loan.  He will use it to weed and care for his coffee farm and his basic grains crops.

loans.use: to pay for the expenses to weed and care for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila, de 42 años es una mujer trabajadora. Tiene 4 hijos, pero solo vive en con 2 de ellos, a los que cría sola, pues es madre soltera. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ullusca. Vivir en el campo es lo que más le gusta, su pasión por la agricultura, sembrar diversas variedades de maíz, papa y habas le gusta mucho. Sus extensas áreas de terreno agrícola el ayudó a salir adelante y forjarse un futuro, pues vende su producción a buen precio. “Hay días en los que pierdo mucho, es por las plagas que azotan el lugar”, comenta. Pero eso no la desanima, sabe que con esfuerzo puede salir adelante, también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como 2 toros y 2 vacas que hace poco dieron 2 terneras muy fuertes. Con ello obtiene un dinero extra, pues los vende cuando están maduros. Ahora desea obtener una cosecha buena, ya que viajar a la capital para negociar sus alimentos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Manantiales” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, pues hace posible que continúe con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le agrada trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias. Cirila de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Cirila, 42, is a hardworking woman.  She has four children but only two of them live with her.  She raises them alone because she’s a single mother.  They live together in her own house located in Ullusca.  

Living in the countryside is what she likes the most; her passion for farming, to plant several varieties of corn, potatoes and lima beans is what she most likes.  Her extensive fields helped her get ahead and forge a future for herself because she sells her crops at a good price.  “There are days when my losses are large because of the pest infestations that attack the area,” she comments.  But that does not discourage her; she knows that with effort she can get ahead.  She also raises small farm animals like two bulls and two cows which recently gave birth to two very strong calves.  This produces extra income because she sells them when they mature.  She wants to obtain a good harvest now to go to the capital to sell her food.  

She belongs to the “Manantiales” communal bank and this is her first MFP loan.  She thanks all of your for your support because it makes it possible for her to continue with her work.  She promises to be punctual with her payments because she enjoys working with responsible, mutually supportive people.  If Cirila were to receive your support, she will use the requested loan to buy natural fertilizer to spread among her potato crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Nemesiana

texts.en:
Nemesiana is a 59-year-old married woman with three children. The oldest child is 19. Nemesiana's husband is a farmer.

Nemesiana has had a sari-sari store business for 11 years. She sells various items like sugar, coffee, soap and shampoo. She also grows vegetables and helps her husband sell rice at the market. Nemesiana does her best to help provide for her family.

Nemesiana requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell. Nemesiana hopes for her sari-sari store business to grow and to have a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married and has two children in school.  To earn a living, she sells cereals.  She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person.  Previously, she used to farm to earn a living.
  
She hopes to expand her business for more income generation in the future.  She has requested 65,000 Kenya shillings to buy cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Celso David

texts.es:
Celso David tiene 31 años es Soltero, vive con los padres no tiene hijos. Vive en el Recinto América  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla UNIDOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto América, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Celso  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace 10 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y  arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es  tener una casa.

Le gusta mucho hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Celso David is 31 years old and single.  He lives with his parents, and does not have children.  He lives in the América district in the Ventanas canton.

The communal bank "UNIDOS VENCEREMOS" ["United We Will Overcome"] is located in the América district, which is part of the Ventanas canton. The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Celso has been working in agriculture growing corn for the last ten years.  He purchases her supplies in Ventanas, and sells his products in the the market there.

The requested loan is for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice. The loan will help him to increase her income for use by his family and for investment.  His dream is to have a house.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda.  Her personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent residential house.  She has been running a phone accessories business for the last four years and her major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, high fuel costs, and inadequate capital to meet the high demand. However, she has goals of diversifying her business into a telecom company and hiring employees to help expand the business.The purpose of this loan is to buy phones and accessories to resell.

loans.use: to buy phones and accessories to resell.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: El señor Wilfredo se dedica a la construcción es albañil contratista  tiene bastante experiencia en esta actividad por cual es conocido y contratado para realizar obras ya que realiza un buen trabajo; el señor Wilfredo vive con sus hijas en casa de familiar  en la zona Loreto, indica que el es la única persona que sustenta su familia con sus ingresos gracias  a ello sus hijas se encuentran estudiando a nivel universitario lo cual lo hace sentir orgulloso de ver que sus esfuerzos están dando frutos, con el dinero del crédito comprar herramientas que le hacen falta ya que las que tiene ya cumplieron su vida útil,  actualmente el señor Wilfredo necesita el crédito para comprar herramientas y mejorar sus equipos de trabajo.
texts.en: Wilfredo works in construction as an experienced contractor. He has a good reputation for doing quality work. Wilfredo lives with his daughters in the Loreto zone. Thanks to his business, which is the family's only source of income, Wilfredo is able to pay for his daughters' university fees and he is very proud to see the fruits of his labor. With this loan, Wilfredo will buy tools to replace ones that have worn out. This will allow him to improve the equipment he uses in his work.

loans.use: To buy tools for his business.

loans.name: Dialabaton Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe DIALABATON II sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Kobili, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SOUNGOURA, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare d’arachide.
La production sera vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 130.000F CFA environs par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Dialabaton II Group are married women with an average of 41 years and five children, who for the most part live in polygamous families in Kobili, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, part of the Koulikoro region.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to better organize their early winter activities. They grow millet and groundnuts. This is their seventh collaboration with the institution.

Soungoura, the first person standing on the left, plans to use her new loan to buy inputs, small equipment and pay tilling costs to cultivate around 0.75 hectares of groundnuts (approx. 2 acres).

After harvesting the crop will be sold in the town of Fana, to both men and women customers. She expects to make an average profit of around 130.000 FCFA per crop.

Her profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: Pay for tillage, seed, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is married and has four children. Se is 33 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City.

Jovelyn sells rice to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.

In the future, Jovelyn hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.

loans.name: Ayoro Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYORO composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pierrette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 31 ans. Pierrette est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Mathias. Le couple a trois enfants, scolarisés et à leur charge. Pierrette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Pierrette vend du gari (farine de manioc) et du maïs depuis cinq ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Pierrette s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Pierrette sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe AYORO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et du gari.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila, is a 48-year old married woman and has five children. Of which two are still attending school.She owns a "carenderia" or know as eatery. She prepares and sold home meals to the locals in her community.  
Aside from managing an eatery, she also raises hogs, as supplemental income.


 
She has requested a loan to purchase feed and materials like plastic tables and supplies like meat, spices and soft drinks. These will help boost and improve her earnings. Thus, she could provide her family with nutritious meals and continue support their respective studies.
Petronila could start to manage her finances and set aside for emergency use.

In the future, Petronila  is aiming to have a sustainable livelihood .

loans.use: to purchase feed and materials like plastic tables and supplies like meat, spices and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Shilliakah would like to buy cereals, beverages, laundry detergents and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rahab would like to purchase a dairy cow and animal feed for it.

loans.name: Geshem

texts.en:
Geshem, 41 years old, is married and has 3 children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He is settled in the Kayidish village, built for IDPs.
Geshem has been in the cattle-breeding business for 5 years. This business provides income for his family. Azim is asking for a loan of US$725 to buy a pregnant cow to increase the size of his cattle.

loans.use: Purchase of a pregnant cow

loans.name: Cruz

texts.en:
Cruz and her sister opened this store about 4 years ago. There they sell all types of products to the community ranging from jewelry to office supplies. Cruz and her sister started off by putting together savings and selling just paper, pens and other school supplies. As they grew, they began to invest in many different products to sell.

Although the business was going well, Cruz’s sister married about a year and a half ago and made the decision to move to a new city. Obviously, this affected Cruz. She had to make monthly payments to her sister in order to repay for the capital she put up. Instead of having two people invest in the business, Cruz found herself alone and limited by the payments. She used a loan from Kiva and Mifex to help her get past the tough times and this resulted in a great deal of help for her.

Cruz is now seeking this loan in order to invest in completely new products now that she is finished paying her sister. She is confident in her ability to sell and assures lenders that there is sufficient demand to justify an investment. She is happy to be able t provide for her two children.

loans.use: Diversify her product line

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. B. Vuthy has been married since 1990 and has a daughter. He was a wooden-house construction worker before he got married. In1995, he started his own wooden-house construction business. Mr. B. makes contracts with villagers to repair and build wooden houses. In addition, he also grows rice and catches fish, while his wife is a garment factory worker.   

Mr. B. is asking for a loan from MAXIMA for the first time. He will use the US$200 to purchase zinc and pillar to repair his house.

loans.use: Purchase of  zinc and pillar for house repair

loans.name: Jose Pilar

texts.es:
Don D., as he’s called by those who know him, has always been a hard-working man, who has made sure, from his young age, that his family never goes without the daily bread. For a long time he dedicated himself to agriculture, saving little by little, until he managed to start a business selling tomatoes.

With a starting capital of US $ 25, which he accrued with great effort, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise 25 years ago, in order to support his parents. He initially established his business at outdoor premises that lacked protection and were unsuitable for any kind of business. Nonetheless, D. set his mind to condition it and, according to his capacity, he has improved it little by little. To this date, he is the only support of his son and father.

For the past 2 years, CEPRODEL has been part of the progress in D.’s business, providing him with the needed capital at the right time. This collaboration between the financial institution and the client is what has made this business prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Don D., como es llamado por las personas que lo conocen, sin duda alguna ha sido un hombre trabajador que se las ha ingeniado desde muy joven para que a su familia nunca le falte el pan de cada día. Se dedicó mucho tiempo a la agricultura, ahorrando poco a poco hasta lograr comenzar con un negocio de venta de tomates.

Hace 25 años él tomó esta iniciativa para poder sustentar a sus padres, y comenzó con un capital de US$25.00, que le costó reunir y que logró gracias a su perseverancia y dedicación. El local donde inicialmente colocó su negocio era al aire libre, sin ninguna protección y sin condición alguna para un negocio. Sin embargo D. se propuso acondicionarlo según sus capacidades, y poco a poco lo ha mejorado. A la fecha él es el sustento de su hijo y su padre.

CEPRODEL ha sido parte de este avance en el negocio de D. desde hace 2 años, brindándole el financiamiento necesario en el momento oprtuno. Este trabajo en conjunto (Institución Financiera-Cliente) es lo que ha llevado a prosperar el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of products.

loans.name: Fofoga

texts.en: Fofoga M. is a thirty-eight year old mother from the village of Elise Fou. Her business is a food stall at Savalalo Flea Market, five days a week. Her husband helps out with the business every week. She usually manages to get about $600 WST ($240 USD) net profit a week plus remittances from her sister in New Zealand. Her customers are the public coming to town for shopping and especially the school children who come to catch their buses. She is still struggling because all of her children are attending school. This is her second loan and she is doing well with her loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients for her food stall business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Doña María Elena is 51-years-old. She is a single mother of 2 sons, one who is 25, and one who is 30. Both are now independent. Her 25-year-old son helps her at her grocery store after work. They live in the Monseñor Lezcano neighborhood, one of the largest and oldest neighborhoods of Managua. Doña María Elena has had this grocery store for more than 15 years, and it has grown over the years. In her store, she sells basic products for the home and cosmetics. Doña María Elena is requesting this credit to buy school supplies like notebooks, pencils, uniforms, shoes, etc., since classes are about to start. This is the right moment to invest in this merchandise and to obtain profits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Maria Elena tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, uno de 25 años y otro de 30 años, ambos ya son independientes. Su Hijo de 25 años después de horas laborales le ayuda en la pulpería, habitan en el barrio Monseñor Lezcano uno de los barrios más grandes y más antiguos de Managua. Doña Maria Elena tiene ya más de 15 años de tener esta pulpería que con los años va creciendo un poco más. En su pulpería ella vende productos básicos del hogar y cosméticos. Doña Maria Elena solicita el crédito para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapices, uniformes, zapatos, etc. ya que las clases están por empezar, y es el momento adecuado para colocar esta mercadería y obtener más ganacias.

loans.use: Purchase of school uniforms and notebooks

loans.name: Olufunmiayo

texts.en: Olufunmilayo I. is a mother of 4. She is 48 years old and comes from Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and wine. She has been a LAPO member for 3 years. She requests a loan in the amount of $450 to buy more provisions and wine for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and wine for sale

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea S., 30, is a mother of one child and, together with her husband, works selling groceries in a busy market. They earn around $5 a day of profit. Her child is a student.

She will use this loan money to buy cashew nuts in stock and resell for profit to make extra income. This will give her family savings for the future and provide a good condition of living.

loans.use: To buy cashew nuts in stock.

loans.name: Mwanaidi's Nyota Ndogo Group

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is 30 years old and is a single woman. Mwanaidi is a timber seller. She started her business in 2000. She works from 6am to 6pm at her business each day. She can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

In the past, Mwanaidi has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more timber for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Enesia, who also has a business dealing in timber sales.

loans.use: To buy more timber for her business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Adama Ndiaya, a 41 year old widow with 6 children in her care, has been a member of the village bank of Médina Plateau in Ziguinchor for 5 and a half years. She buys baobab fruit, hibiscus, ginger, sugar, bags of sweets, and flavoring to make ice cream. Adama also buys and sells food products such as palm oil and vegetables. With her income, she contributes to the care of her family. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Adama N., 41 ans, veuve, 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Médina Plateau à Ziguinchor depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle achète le pain de singe, du bissap, du gingembre, du sucre, des sachets et essences pour faire des crèmes glaces. Adama achète et revend aussi des produits alimentaires comme l’huile de palme et des légumes. Avec ses revenus elle participe à l’entretien de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, vegetables, sugar, baobab fruit, hibiscus flowers, ginger, flavoring, and bags of sweets

loans.name: Vuong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vuong Thi N., 51 years old, is one of the first members of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in her cluster. She fully understands the importance of TYM Fund. Mrs. N. has 6 children. FIve of them got married and moved out. Mrs. N. was able to provide all of her children good financial support before they moved out. Her youngest child, who is still going to school, still lives with Mrs. N. and her husband. Mrs N. has always used her loan to breed pigs. At the beginnings, she only raise pigs to breed. Later on, she has more profit and she decides to also raise pigs to sell for meat. At the moment, her family has two breeding pigs and 20 piglets. She is applying for a loan of 925 USD to expand her farm. On average, her family earns 188 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vương Thị Nghĩa 51 tuổi, là những thành viện đầu tiên tham gia cụm, nên chị nhận thức rất rõ lợi ích khi tham gia vào Quỹ, chị sinh được 6 người con, 5 con đã được chị xây dựng gia đình và cho ra ở riêng, các con chị khi ra ở riêng đều được chị làm cho 1 cơ ngơi rất khang trang, 1 con đang sống cùng vợ chồng anh chị và con đang đi học, các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn nái, ban đầu gia đình chị chỉ chăn nuôi lợn nái, nhung qua các vòng vốn việc chăn nuôi co thu nhập, và dần dần gia đình chị tiêp tục đầu tư thêm vao chăn nuôi lợn thịt, hiện tai gia đình chị đang có 2 con lợn nái và 20 con lợn con. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình. 3000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es:
Aquiles is a first time father, his daughter has become the engine of his daily work. He grows potatoes, and maize, work with which he is hopeful of making progress and provide what is necessary for his young family that needs it. For that reason he wants to invest in his production, expand his crop fields and improve the quality of his products. Achiles knows that if he takes care of his land and works diligently he will reap excellent products that will have a better reception in the marketplace. The request Achiles makes is to purchase fertilizers necessary for his land. Support this new father so his effort is worthwhile.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Aquiles es un joven que acaba de ser padre por primera vez, su hija se ha convertido en el motor de su trabajo diario, él siembra papas, alverjas y maíz, trabajo con el cual tiene la esperanza de progresar y ofrecer lo necesario a su joven familia que tanto lo necesita. Por ello desea invertir en su producción, ampliar sus terrenos de cultivos y mejorar la calidad de sus productos. Aquiles sabe que si cuida de su tierra y la trabaja con esmero podrá cosechar excelentes productos que tendrán mayor acogida en el mercado. El pedido que hace Aquiles es para la compra de los abonos necesario para sus terrenos. Apoya a este nuevo padre para que su esfuerzo, al final, valga la pena.

loans.use: Purchase compost for his fields.

loans.name: Sehr

texts.en: Sehr Baji is the wife of M. who is a butcher by profession. Sehr baji is a housewife and sews clothes. She lives with her family in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She lives in a rented house. Sehr Baji is a mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are getting an education. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy livestock (cows and goats) to enhance her husband's business. Sehar baji plans to use the loan to help her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy livestock to expand the business

loans.name: Fat-Hia

texts.en:
Fat-hia is 23 years old and single. Since 2005, she has been earning income running her own shop. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 5:30 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$35 from the sales.

Fat-hia currently needs a loan to buy additional commodities for sale at her store.

loans.use: Purchase of additional commodities for sale

loans.name: Juanny

texts.es:
La señora Juanny pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juan Zaplana Belliza”, ubicado en el Jr. Abner Monrroy Cachay Mz. D Lt. 5, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años y es madre de 2 hijas menores de edad que aun dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo  trabaja como Técnico Agropecuario. Juanny con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pollos. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el Banco.
.
En la actualidad ella cuenta con el negocio de venta de ropas, usualmente se levanta temprano para atender a sus pequeñas hijas, para luego dedicarse a repartir las prendas a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2.500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses comprará: prendas de vestir al por mayor, 2 doc de blusas, 3 doc de pantalón, 2 doc de polos, y otros para damas, caballeros y niños.

Juanny agradece al Banco de Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional que le brinda.
texts.en:
Mrs Juanny is a member of the Communal bank "Juan Zaplana Belliza" located at Jr. Abner Monrroy Cachay Mz. D Lt. 5, in the district of Yarina Cocha in the department of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and the mother of two young girls who are dependent on her. She is married and her husband work as a Technical Agriculturist. With the first loan of S/. 300 that Juanny received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in the sale of chickens. She has been working with the bank for five years. Currently she is involved in the selling of clothing, and typically wakes up early in order to take care of her little daughters, after which she then dedicates herself to the needs of her customers. With this loan of S/. 2.500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase larger quantities of garments: two boxes of blouses, 3 boxes of pants, 2 boxes of polos and other clothing for women, men and children. Juanny is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos bank for unconditionally supporting her.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing garments

loans.name: Dalini

texts.en:
Dalini A., 26 years old, is from Dar es Salaam. She is divorced and has two children, 5 and 8 years old.  Additionally, she is responsible for supporting another child. Dalini has been running a snack stand since last year.  She sells items such as soda, water, and chipisi (French fries) on the side of the road.  
Dalini works 9 to 12 hours a day, 6 days a week. She now needs a loan of US$250 in order to expand her business.  Dalini is thankful to everyone for supporting her.

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris E. is 26 years old and is married with two children. Doris lives with her family in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Doris sells drinks and snacks, and also sachets of water. This is the festive season and she hopes to make additional sales during this season.

Doris needs a loan in the amount of 30,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She wants to express her gratitude to everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Yen S. is the group leader of four people who all live in Aleng village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a basket maker who can make a small income to support the family. Her husband, Mr. Heng Mao, is a construction worker. Because his work place is far from home and he usually spends a lot of money on transportation, Mrs. Yen S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a bicycle for her husband to use to go to work. Mrs. Yen S. is 30 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is only a year old. Mrs. Yan K. did not come to take her loan, but her husband did, so he is in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle for her husband to use to commute to work.

loans.name: Abulljalel

texts.en:
Abdulljalil is 46 years old. He is married and the father of three children. He lives with whole family in Khewa Nangrahar province. He studied hard in ten classes, and now he has an electrician's shop in Jalalabad city. He is a hard worker.

To expand his shop and increase his income, Abbulljalil has invested 180000AF of his own capital in his shop. He is requesting an individual loan of 30000AF for a period of 27 months to buy electrician's tools for his shop. He thanks the lenders of Kiva.

loans.use: Buy tools for his electrician's shop

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: El señor Oscar Danilo P. tiene la edad de 35 años, habita en el Kilómetro. 13 Carretera a Masaya, junto a su esposa e hijas, la esposa de él trabaja como domestica para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar ya que ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijas mujeres las cuales tiene  10 y 12 años de edad y necesitan la educación adecuada para que sean dos profesionales y no trabajen tan duro como yo,  los planes de don Oscar es poder terminar su casa ya que le hace falta materiales de construcción para poder realizar sus sueños ; el trabaja como guarda de seguridad en una casa privada. Con esta solicitud va invertir en infraestructura para hacer las mejoras y gozar de una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Oscar Danilo P. is 35 and lives on Carretera a Masaya with his wife and daughters. His wife works as a housekeeper to help out with the household expenses, as they have two daughters, 10 and 12, who need to get a good education so they can become professionals and not have to work as hard as their parents. Oscar would like to be able to finish his house, but lacks the construction materials he needs to realize his dream. He works as a security guard in private home. He plans to invest his loan in infrastructure for his home improvements so he can enjoy a decent house.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make improvements on his house

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila B. is 50 years old. She is divorced and has two children. All her children are still in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits etc. It has been her dream to expand by adding other food stuffs to her existing products. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. She also hopes to receive GH¢900 to restock her inventory. Jamila belongs to a village bank called ‘Ayi Adakyew’ which means ‘Do what you are doing now well because of Tomorrow’.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water, and boxes of biscuit etc.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria M. como mujer nicaragüense se dedica a laborar arduamente en su negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos los que son comercializados por ella misma y elaborados con la más alta calidad por tener ella amplia experiencia en la cocina.

Es importante destacar que ella ha logrado mejorar su situación económica y hoy en día espera en que Ceprodel le brinde un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así continuar mejorando su negocio de venta de alimentos.
texts.en:
Candeleria Membreno, a Nicaraguan woman, works hard at her business making and selling food. She sells what she makes, food made with the utmost care and with wide experience of the kitchen. It's important to point out the strides she's made to improve her economic situation and she now hopes that Ceprodel will provide a loan so that she can buy basic supplies to make her dishes and continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic supplies for food business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has owned a small restaurant in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to the Subira ni njema loan group (Group code 2022). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Each day she works at her business for 14 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more meat, white flour, cooking oil and other items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.

Asha is 25 years old, married, and has two children, ages 7 and 4. She also cares for two additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy food and other supplies

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Frola is a soft drink seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. She currently earns very little monthly profit.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more soft drinks to add her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Frola  is 34 years old, married, and has three children, ages 12, 8 and 1.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member Elizabeth who has her own small business selling fruits in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to add her current stock.

loans.name: Sonia Veronica

texts.es: Sonia Verónica tiene 25 años de edad, ella es soltera, ella no cuenta con sus padres, y vive con sus hermanos y hermanas.   Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa típica como güipiles, y también los elabora.  Esto lo ha venid haciendo  desde hace mas de seis años. Ella vende en diferentes municipios y en el departamento de Chimaltenango.  El propósito del préstamo es para incrementar su negocio en compras de más ropa típica como cortes. Sus sueños son tener un local para su negocio, y que su negocio sea mas grande para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sonio Verónica is 25 and single. She does not have her parents, and she lives with her brothers and sisters. She makes and sells typical clothes like güipiles (ponchos). She has been dong this for more than six years. She sells in different municipalities and in the Chimaltenango department. The loan is to expand her business by purchasing more typical clothing like cortes (skirts). Her dreams are to have a place for her business, and that her business grows so that she can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business of selling typical clothing

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
La señora Águeda P. A. tiene 52 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria Incompleta, no tiene  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Águeda se dedica a la Venta de Golosinas también a cocinar para el Comedor Popular de los Wawasis, este negocio se inicio hace 5 años, su negocio se desarrolla en afueras de la Posta Médica.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos como galletas, caramelos, frutas.
El crédito de 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra productos como  galletas, caramelos, frutas.
Águeda  tiene como sueño tener su Bodega para crecer como microempresaria
texts.en:
Águeda P. A. is 52 years old, and lives in the Víctor Raúl II settlement of the Porvenir district, in La Libertad, Perú. She did not complete her primary school education, and does not have any children that depend on her financially. Águeda dedicates herself to selling snacks/sweets, and also cooks for the Popular Cafeteria of the Wawasis. She started her business 5 years ago, which she runs outside a medical post. She invested the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from her cooperative bank Leaders in Action II into the purchase of products such as cookies, caramels, fruits. She will invest the loan of 800 soles into the purchase of the same types of products, cookies, caramels, fruits. Águeda’s dream is to have a grocery store, so she can grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products such as cookies, caramels, fruits.

loans.name: Obasoro

texts.en: G. is a widow. She is 42 years old and has four children. She sells underwear for ladies and children and has been in this trade for four years. She has been borrowing from LAPO for three years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more underwear to sell.

loans.use: To purchase underwear to sell

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
T. Hoàng Thị (1304020082) is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, T. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising water buffalo for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (about $170 US) a month from these activities.

In 2001, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. T. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. The loan will be the seventh she has taken out from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business

loans.use: To buy baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.pt:
Nasceu no município da vila de namaacha na fronteira da swazilandia tem 40 anos de idade vive maritalmente e é pai de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 5 e 18 anos encontrando se todos a estudarem.

Eduardo teve que interromper os seus estudos na 7 classe quando foi recrutado para cumprir o Serviço Militar Obrigatório em Zambezia durante 2 anos, apos concluir é afecto para trabalhar como guarda prisional na mesma província durante 10 anos. É transferido para capital maputo, e consegue continuar com os seus estudos e sendo assim promovido, devido ao seu nível, para a categoria de sargento da policia de Moçambique auferindo um salário mensal de 4.109.00MT.
 
Já teve empréstimo no Banco comercial (BIM millennium no valor de 25.000,00MT para inicio da sua obra) que pagou através de debito no salário e quando concluiu não solicitou mais credito devido às condições exigidas que não permitam um rápido desenvolvimento. (prazo obrigatório de 5 anos para pagar o credito).

Em conversa com seu colega que, é cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema, soube da existência e aproxima se solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00MT para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
 Para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pelos seus dois sobrinhos que vivem com ele em sua casa e não consegue poupar nenhum valor devido à construção da sua obra.

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir novos empréstimos para conclusão da obra, incluindo o murro do seu quintal.
texts.en:
Born in town of Naamacha on the border with Swaziland he is 40 years old and is married. He is the father of 4 children with ages between 5 and 18 years old, all of whom are in school. Eduardo had to interrupt his studies in the 7th grade when he was recruited to complete Mandatory Military Service in Zambezia for 2 years. After finishing this he worked as a prison guard in the same province for 10 years. He was transferred to the capital Maputo and was able to continue with his studies and through promotions, due to his level, rise to the rank of police sergeant of Mozambique earning a monthly salary of 4.109.00MT. He has already had a loan with the Commercial Bank (International Bank of Mozambique with the value of 25.000,00MT to start his project) which he paid by debiting from his salary and when he finished he did not request another loan as the required conditions do not permit rapid development (mandatory terms of 5 years to repay the loan). In a conversation with his colleague who is a client of Hluvuku-Adsema he learned about its existence and approached requesting a loan of the value of 12.000.00MT to continue with the construction if his house. Along with his children, he is responsible for his two nephews who live with him in his house and he is not able to save any money due to the construction of his house. He is confident that he will repay it before the time forecasted and will apply for new loans to finish this project, including a wall around his backyard.

Translated from Portuguese by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: Denise est née en 1966 à Ouidah au Sud du BENIN. Denise est mariée à Louis, commerçant à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Denise est mère de 5 enfants. La famille vit à Godomey dans la Commune d’Abomey-Calavi, non loin de Cotonou.  Denise vend des condiments de sauce ainsi que de poissons fumés au marché de Godomey. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Denise achète ses produits. Denise sollicite de prêt d’ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et accroître le volume de ses produits pour le bonheur de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Denise was born in 1966 in Ouidah, in southern Benin. Denise is married to Louis, a merchant in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Denise is the mother of 5 children. The family lives in Godomey, in the neighborhood of Abomey-Calavi, not far from Cotonou.

Denise sells sauce condiments and smoked fish in the market of Godomey. Denise purchases her products in Dantokpa, Benin's large international market. Denise is requesting a loan from Alidé in order to increase her rolling funds and grow the volume of her products to please her clientele.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a case of fish, crates of fresh tomatoes, crates of hot peppers, sacks of onions and spices.

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji B., a 39-year-old woman, is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has four children who all go to school. She is currently in the business of selling maize flour and is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins N. is a 25-year-old man who is married to Elizabeth Wairimu and together they have a two-year-old son. 

Collins has been selling second hand clothes for the last five years.

With no previous borrowing from any micro finance institution, he got to know about KADET through various marketing and promotional activities done by KADET staff in Naivasha town. 

This will be Collins’ second loan from KADET and he plans to use this loan to add more stock.

His future dream and aspiration is to open a boutique with different kinds of stock.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Anver

texts.en:
Anver H. is a young entrepreneur who started his own business selling foodstuffs and detergents thirteen years ago, as a way to help his mother. With hard work and a lot of effort, he has succeeded in growing his business. This is also thanks to daily improvement in the quality of the service and products he offers his clients.

Anver is now married and has two children. This is his motivation for continuing to improve and grow his business. To cover current demand from his clients, Anver is requesting a loan of 1607 AZN.

With your help, Anver will improve the quality of the service he offers his clients and will continue to grow his business. He appreciates the opportunity your support offers him.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: William Edmundo

texts.es: William está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para  Terminar de construir  una habitación, trabaja como docente de educacion primaria desde hace 3 años, a pesar que no tiene hijos ayuda, a su madre con los gastos de la casa, ya que son de  escasos recursos económicos , William es muy responsable, honesto y muy trabajador, se siente agradecido con AFODENIC  ya que con el credito anterior logro componer  su casa que se encuentraba en mal estado,  su sueño es seguir estudiando, salud para su familia y tener estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
William is seeking refinancing of his second loan to finish construction of a bedroom. William has worked as a primary school teacher for three years, in spite of the fact that he has no children. He helps his mother with household expenses because money is tight.

William is very responsible and hardworking. He is thankful to AFODENIC for the previous loan, which allowed him to fix up his house, which was in bad condition. His dreams are to continue studying, health for his family, and to have steady employment.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Azucenas” esta representado por la señora Hilda y conformada por 17 miembros la mayoría vecino del mismo barrio, por lo que el grupo posee con un grado alto D. confianza entre sus miembros. En general una mayoría D. las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades como la elaboración y distribución D. artesanías tejidas a mano, fabricación D. muebles, a la albañilería, soldadura, confección D. prendas D. vestir, cosméticos y comida. En la ciudad D. Tarija son bastantes personas que se dedican a esta actividad y están prosperando en sus negocios D. manera lenta, por eso es que requieren D. un nuevo capital para sacar sus productos a otros mercados mas rentables, es por esto que requieren adquirir maquinas como hiladoras cortadas y otras herramientas que ayuden a realizar un producto terminado D. mejor calidad y con buen acabado para competir en un mercado mucho mas rentable y así poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya habían trabajado bajo la modalidad D. grupos solidarios por lo que tienen amplio conocimiento D. la forma D. trabajo pero se encuentran agradecidas por el apoyo económico y la confianza que les brinda la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The “Azucenas” (White Lillies) group, represented by Hilda, is maD. up of 17 members who are, for the most part, neighbors from the same neighborhood which allows the group to have a lot of trust amongst themselves. In general, most of the members are involved in various activities such as the making and distribution of hand-knitted crafts, furniture manufacturing, masonry, welding, clothing manufacturing, cosmetics and food sales. There are many persons in the city of Tarija who are involved in similar activities so their businesses are progressing slowly. Because of this they need new capital so that they can move their products to new, more profitable, markets. They need machinery like spinning machines and other tools which will allow them to produce better finished items to be able to compete in higher producing markets thereby providing their families with a better quality of life. The members have credit experience having worked under communal bank modalities so they are amply aware of the methodologies of working this way. Even so, they are grateful for the economic support and the trust which fundación Agrocapital offers them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Iulieta

texts.en:
Iulieta A. is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Puleia.  She is married and has 5 school-aged children.  Iulieta runs a fishing business, 
selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Iulieta has been in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 360 Samoan tala (about $143 US) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Iulieta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Iulieta is requesting a loan of 1000 tala which will be used to purchase a fishing boat.  This will be her first loan from SPBD. Iulieta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao S., 54, is married with three children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. S. is employed in a Christian institution, earning an income of US $4 per day. Her husband operates his motorbike as a taxi driver at a local market in the city, earning an income of US $3 per day. With his available time from his current work, he uses his skill painting to generate more income. Both sources of income help cover the family expenses, especially those for the children’s education. S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase painting equipment to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy painting equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 45 year old man who lives in Bekaa with his wife and their four children. Since 1997, he has owned and operated a home product shop where he sells dishes, tissues, home decorations, and other goods. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region, and they feel comfortable buying from his shop because he offers a wide variety of products. 
   
When Hussein first started his business, he faced no difficulties. He started the business because he wanted to have independent work, and because he realized there were no shops like his in his region. 

Hussein requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. Hussein has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time. Hussein's previous loans helped him improve his shop by diversifying his merchandise. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Natalio

texts.es:
Natalio vive en la zona Alto Llojeta, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y   sus hijos menores, los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar.
 
Trabaja como chofer propietario de taxi en una de las céntricas rutas de la ciudad, su esposa tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la reparación del motor de su vehiculo ya que por el constante uso sufre de mal funcionamiento.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, y el segundo vía KIVA;  la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Natalio lives in the zone Alto Llojeta of the city El Alto. He lives in his house with his wife and their young children who are school age. He works as a driver and owner of a taxi in one of the central routes of the city. His wife has a small grocery store in their home. The loan will be used to repair his vehicle’s motor, as it is malfunctioning due to constant use. This is his second loan with Impro and the second via KIVA. The completed evaluation qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of repairing the motor of his taxi

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester G. is 31 years old, divorced, and has two school-aged children. She is currently in the business of selling green vegetables at the market, and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice and beans to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Ester hopes to be able to build a house.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en:
Exaltacion B. is from the barangay of Bangko, Panaon Municipality, Misamis Occidental Province. She is 65 years old. Exaltacion is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Exaltacion owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconuts for sale.
