Exaltacion has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Exaltacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Exaltacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional business capital. Exaltacion is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Exaltacion from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Carmen Eddy

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Carmen es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Carmen tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la selva ayacuchana actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, además Carmen tiene carros que realizan transporte interprovincial.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
El sueño de Carmen es construir su casa para alquilar.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Banco Comunal Bienestar” (Well Being Communal Bank). She is 50 years old, married, and has five children. Carmen has a small grocery store in the “Ayacuchana Jungle, which she runs with her husband’s help. Carmen also has cars that they use to provide interprovincial transportation. She needs this loan of 3,000 PEN ($1,075) to invest in rice and sugar. Carmen’s dream is to build a house to rent out.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Martha Jovanis

texts.es: La Sra. Martha Jovanis Sánchez Alegría ella se desempeña como Enfermera del centro de salud S.R.S. ella tiene de laborar para esta institución  catorce  años, es madre de un hijo en edad escolar, ella es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  seis  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación y este crédito ella lo quiere para hacer una construcción de un porche  en su casa de habitación  y así tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Jovanis S. A. has worked as a nurse at the S.R.S. Health Center for 14 years. She is married and has one son, who is of school age. So far, she has had six loans with CEPRODEL, and each one has served to make improvements to her house. Currently, she is requesting a loan to build a porch for her house, in order to have a decent and respectable home.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials, such as cement, sand, gravel, stones, etc. for home improvements

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera, vive en una casa arrendada, ubicada en el centro poblado de Rosario, Ayacucho. Hace un tiempo decidió emprender un proyecto propio que le ayudase a mejorar su condición de vida, desde entonces se dedica a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de Cacao y la Hoja de coca; por lo que en temporada de siembra y cosecha necesita de peones para que le puedan facilitar en un menor tiempo la recolección de sus productos. Rocío dedica todo su tiempo en su chacra desde las 7:00 AM  hasta las 6:00 PM, durante toda la semana, motivo por el cual sus ventas crecieron paulatinamente, ya que su producción son vendidos en los centros de acopio de su comunidad. En el futuro anhela comprar una casa propia, de esa manera evitará alquilar vivienda. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, en la cual espera cumplir con sus pagos, asimismo agradece a su grupo comunal por el respaldo que le brindan. Con el crédito que solicita, hará un mantenimiento a su terreno de cultivo para reforzar su siembra y asegurar una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Rocío is a 26-year-old single woman who lives in a rented house located in the small town of Rosario, Ayacucho. She decided to start her own business a while back in order to improve her living conditions. Since then, she has been working in agriculture, namely cultivating cacao and coca leaves. During planting and harvesting season, she needs the help of farm workers. Rocío is at her small farm from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM during the week, which is why her sales have been gradually increasing since her produce is sold at the wholesale centers in her community. In the future, she would like to purchase her own house so that she will avoid having to rent a place. This is her first loan with MFP, and she hopes to be able to fulfill her payments. She also thanks this microfinance institute for the support that it has given her. With this loan, she will provide maintenance to her fields so that she can strengthen her crops and ensure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crop field maintenance

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena D., 55 years old, raises pigs. She has seven children. She said she has piglets in her barn and she also has a one-hectare farm. She grows rice to be able to supplement the family income. She would like to request a loan of 6,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her harvest. She likes the CEVI services because it gives micro-insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Los Lideres Group

texts.es:
Banco Comunal los Lideres conformado por 8 integrantes 6 mujeres y 2 varones todos los socios viven en la zona del Torno en distintos barrios como ser barrio 6 barrio, libertad, barrio Bolivia, MiraF., 27 de mayo y cuentan con negocio de venta de verduras, frutas, cosméticos, pan, y servicios como ser moto taxista, albañil trabajan con su negocio hace 4 y 5 años este banco de emprendimiento conformado por una mesa directiva.
 
El Presidente: Sr. Juan cuenta con el servicio de transporté en la comunidad del torno en la P. de moto puerto rico trabaja con nuestra institución hace 4 secuencia y es de estado civil soltero vive en la localidad de puerto rico barrio libertad con el dinero del credito realizara el arreglo de su moto.

La Secretaria: es la Sra. Maria vive en el barrio 6 de mayo y cuenta con el negocio venta de pan y venta de tarjetas telefónicas cuenta con este negocio hace 1 año, La señora es madre soltera y cuenta con 3 hijos a su poder y también es muy estricta que hace cumplir los reglamentos internos, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia en tarjetas.

La Tesorera: Sra. Elena cuenta con el negocio venta de pollitos en el mercado central el torno por las noches la Señora vive en el barrio Bolivia y cuenta con 3 hijos a su poder su esposo se encuentra trabajando en Argentina dentro de un año estará de vuelta aun así la señora a salido adelante y es una clienta antigua que esta trabajando con nosotros 3 secuencias compra de mercaderia para incremento de capital de trabajo.

Este banco de emprendimiento esperan perdurar mucho tiempo y cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas sin problemas, esta muy agardecido con emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Lideres (leaders) community bank is made up of eight members: six women and two men. All of the members live in the Torno area in different neighborhoods such as neighborhood 6, Libertad (liberty), Bolivia, MiraF., May 27, and they have businesses selling produce, fruit, cosmetics, bread and services such as taxi and bricklayer. They have worked in their businesses for four or five years. This venture bank is made up ofr a board of directors. The president: Juan has a motorbike transportation service in the Torno community. He has worked with our institution for 4 rotations. He is single and lives in the Puerto Rico area in the Libertad neighborhood. With the money from the loan, he will fix his motorbike. The secretary: Maria lives in neighborhood 6th of May and has a business selling bread and selling phone cards. She has worked in this business for one year. She is a single mother with three children in her care. She is very strict and makes sure the rules are enforced. With the money from the loan, she will buy phone card merchandise. The treasurer: Elena has a business selling chicks in the central market in Torno at night. She lives in the Bolivia neighborhood and has three children in her care. Her husband can be found working in Argentina. Within a year, he will be returning. Elena has got ahead and is an old customer who has been working with us for three rotations. She will buy merchandise to increase her working capital. This venture bank has endured a long wait and will make their payments without problems. They are very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided by granting them a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es: Esta emprendedora joven Rosa Estela es una joven madre de 25 años tiene una niña de apenas 3 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio desde que inicio con su negocio  le ha ido muy bien se siente muy contenta, pues es el primer crédito que tiene  con Fundación espera incrementar su actividad cada día más por lo que está ubicado en su vivienda en donde diariamente es visita por diferentes clientes. Su deseo es tener un triciclo para ofrecer sus tortillas de manera ambulante. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como leña, cal, maíz, comal, bolsas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
This young entrepreneur, Rosa Estela, is a young mother 25 years old with a daughter barely 3 years old. Her business is making and selling tortillas. She has done this business for more than 3 years, and it has gone very well for her since she started it, she is quite content. With this first loan she has taken through the Fundación, she hopes to increase her business activity more every day, since it is located in her house and is visited daily by different clients. She hopes to have a three-wheel bicycle cart to sell her tortillas as a street vendor. The financing is to purchase raw materials such as firewood, lime, corn, hotplates, and sacks among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Fortunata;  ella tiene 35 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos menores la socia se dedica a apoyar a su conyugue en la carpintería, ella también realiza algunos pequeños trabajos en el taller, la socia junto a su pareja tienen una carpintería en su casa y ella da los acabados finales, de laqueo y cepillado, o barnizado, también agrega jaladores a los muebles y mucho más. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de madera, herramientas para la carpintería. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member pertains to the communal bank, Virgen Purificada-Angostura. She lives in the district of Angostura, in the province of Saylla, a department of Cusco. Her name is Fortunata y she is 35 years old. She has 4 young children. She helps her husband with their carpentry business and does some small projects in their workshop. She, along with her spouse, have a carpentry shop in their home and she does the final touches on the pieces: the lacquering, the brushing, and/or the tarnishing, and much more. She is seeking out a loan to invest in the purchase of wood and other carpentry tools. She is grateful and deeply values the loans that she has been offered and from which have permitted her business to grow and her and her family's quality of life to improve. She promises to make timely payments on her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood and carpentry tools.

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en:
Roseminda S. is from the village of Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 50 years old, married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Roseminda owns & operates a farm. Roseminda has been engaged in her business for 22 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Roseminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Roseminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers for her farm. Roseminda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Roseminda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 
       
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not in school. Milly has a business selling phone air time, which she has had for two years.

To help expand her business, Milly is requesting a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more air time for selling. Milly hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to add more capital to her business. In the future, Milly hopes to open up another business (a saloon).

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva that funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan.

The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterwards, ELA participants can receive micro-finance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional micro-finance.

Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in micro-finance.

loans.use: To buy more phone air time.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl C. is from the village of Mozzozzin Norte. She is 26 years old. Sheryl is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Sheryl owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Sheryl has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sheryl joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sheryl has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sheryl is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Sheryl from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a 73-year-old mother with four children. Her children range from the age of 27 to 46 years of age. Two of her children are in school. The rest of her children are married. 

She sells soft drinks and with the loan she hopes to buy more soft drinks in order to make more profits. With the profits, Bernadette plans to renovate her house. She says that her business is well-known because it’s located in a trading center.

loans.use: Purchasing more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry M. is a 26-year-old single man. He is a motorcycle transport operator and has been in operation for two years. Most of his income is utilized in paying school fees for his siblings.

Henry is borrowing his second loan from KADET with which he plans to service his motorcycle, expand his business, and open a retail shop in Magongo.

Henry hopes to buy a tuk tuk (a motorcycle-based taxi) for his transportation business in the future.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle and open a retail shop

loans.name: 12 De Junio Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó gracias a la invitación que recibieron  algunas de las integrantes D. comité Mujeres Emprendedoras con Esperanza el cual se encuentra en el 15° ciclo D. programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, estas señoras  una vez que se enteraron D. programa decidieron formar un  comité invitando a otras vecinas y amigas. 
 De esta forma se inicia el comité 12 de Junio Barrio San Carlos de Yka´a de la ciudad de Luque.
 
La señora Lorena C.  quien es una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de carbón es cual es una actividad que ella le conviene mucho en todo sentido, porque la realiza en su casa, le deja buena ganancia y además es muy fácil manejar y vender este producto.
Todos los días la mayoría de las vecinas quienes cocinan a carbón compran de ella para utilizarlas en sus casas ya que actualmente el precio D. gas es muy caro en nuestro país y todos lo  pagar.
Es por ello la importancia para ella en adquirir este producto en gran cantidad para no dejar de proveer este producto a sus clientes, y para ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de carbón en gran
Cantidad.
texts.en:
This group formed thanks to an invitation the members received from some of the members of the Mujeres Emprendedoras con Esperanza group, which is in its 15th loan cycle through the businesswomen's group loan program. Once these women joined the program, they decided to form another group, inviting their friends and neighbors. In this way the 12th of June group was founded in the Barrio San de Yka'a in the city of Luque. One of the members is Lorena C., who makes a living selling charcoal, which is an activity that is convenient for her in every way because she can do it from her home and earn good profits, and it's also very easy to manage and sell this product. Every day the majority of her neighbors who cook with charcoal buy it from Lorena to use in their homes, since the price of gas is very expensive in this country and everyone pays. Therefore, it's important for her to acquire a high quantity of charcoal so she will be able to fully provide this product to her customers. For this reason, she is requesting the loan to purchase charcoal in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase charcoal in high quantities

loans.name: Yokana

texts.en:
The hard-working O. Yokana has operated a growing spare-parts business in the Butunduzi trading centre in Kyenjojo for two years. With a monthly net profit of 180,000 Ugandan shillings, this married father of two children has enjoyed a heightened standard of living through running this lucrative business. He sells spare parts for bicycles and motorcycles.

As a result of his success, he has made enormous progress building his home and paying his family's bills. His first priority after acquiring this loan is to purchase a larger stock of spare parts, with the sole objective of turning his business into a bid supplies store for motorcycle and bicycle parts. This will help him gain more sales revenue to cater to his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase a larger supply of spare bicycle and motorcycle spare parts for his shop

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon S. is a 43-year-old woman, married to Mr. Vin Mao, age 47, and they are living in Battambang Province. Phon S. lives with three school-aged children and earns a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. Phon S. is currently planting a potato crop, which she will harvest and sell when they are mature. She has a life partner in her husband who works in motorcycle repair, earning approximately US$ 3 per day. This couple also takes time to fish around the river from which they are able to make additional income. 

Phon S. has hired a neighbor’s boat to support her in her fishing activities. She wants to be the owner of a boat which will allow her to cut out the hiring cost. In order to ensure that is possible, Phon S. would like to request a Kiva loan in the amount of US$ 400 to be used to buy a boat, as well as buying more fishing gear.

loans.use: To buy a boat, as well as buying more fishing gear

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino, de 42 años, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Aidé de 27 años y su querida hija Tania de 10 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En la ciudad de San Francisco, el hombre con más experiencia en los levantamientos de paredes y techados de casas es Faustino, todos los días junto a los trabajadores que él comanda, construyen las casas de los moradores de esta ciudad, los cuales conocedores de los bueno trabajos que realizan, siempre los contratan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es construir, ya que así siente que ayuda en el progreso y expansión de su ciudad natal, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es manejar objetos pesados, como ladrillos, fierros, etc. Con el tiempo, desea poner un negocio, con el cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Es el primer crédito con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar productos de primera necesidad, para ayudara a su esposa tener un negocio, y para ello instalarán una tienda.
texts.en:
Faustino, 42, is a cheerful, hard working man.  He lives in his own house with his wife, Aidé, 27, and his beloved daughter, Tania, 10, who are the motivating forces behind his every effort.

Faustino is the most experienced person in erecting walls and installing roofing in the city of San Francisco.  Every day, with the laborers he leads, they build houses for residents of this city who, knowing the good work they do, always hire them.

What he likes best about his work is building because he feels he’s helping his native city grow and expand.  He has been in this business for 8 years and considers the most difficult part of it carrying the heavy objects, like bricks and metal rods, etc. In time he wants to set up a business that will improve his income.

This is his first loan with MFP and he feels able to repay all his installments.  He is one of the most active members of his communal bank so he is highly respected and esteemed.

He will use the requested 100 new soles to buy basic need items to help his wife have a business; they will open a store.

loans.use: To buy stock items for his wife's store.

loans.name: Marcia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marcia es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde hace años trabaja en la costura, y también está trabajando en un recorrido de niños que viajan a la escuela medio tiempo, teniendo este otro ingreso. Así como el apoyo de su esposo el cual trabaja como conductor
Las mejoras a su vivienda ha sido su objetivo, el cual ha venido mejorando con las ganancias de su pequeño negocio de costura y la venta de ropa usada que lo hace cuando su cuñada le envía del extranjero paca con lo que se ha ayudado mucho.
Con este nuevo financiamiento seguirá con  la mejora del cuarto ya que no logro con el crédito anterior terminarlo, aun falta terminar paredes, y techo. Lo que hará con este nuevo financiamiento en donde comprara: perlines, zinc, golosos, bloques, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Marcia is a hard working woman. She has been sewing for several years and has also had a school bus route for students as a part time job.This provides additional income for the household along with her husband’s support who is also a driver.

Home improvements have been her goal which she has been doing utilizing the profits from her sewing and the sales of used clothing sent by her sister in law from overseas. These have been great help to her.

She is requesting a new loan to continue the improvements in her home since it was not possible to finish them with the previous loan. Walls and the roof are still needed, so the loan will be used to buy purlins, corrugated metal roofing, bolts, sand, cement and iron to start the work.

loans.use: To buy corrugated metal roofing, purlins, bolts, cement and sand for a room’s roof to improve living conditions

loans.name: Ursulla

texts.en:
Ursulla J. is 48 years old, married to Alloysuis Kipkemei who is a farmer and provides additional income for the family. They have five school going children, and they live in Edoret, Kenya. She has been operating a general shop, and has been in this business, for 10 years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs.20,000.

Ursulla learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area and so she is applying for her third loan of Kshs. 80,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy 16 boxes of cooking oil, eight bags of sugar, and other stock needed. The anticipated profits she plans to use to expand the shop business.

In future, Ursulla wishes to have a dairy cow since both businesses have proven to be very profitable in the area. Her deeper desire is to see her children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy 16 boxes of cooking oil, and eight bags of sugar.

loans.name: Khatmeh

texts.en:
Khatmeh is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a vegetable stall business for the past one year, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby.  Khatmeh faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her business.  She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions and potatoes.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Iddai

texts.es:
La señora Iddai S. Guzmán, es casada con el señor  Bernardo Pérez Díaz, en donde procreo dos hijos que  aun están a su responsabilidad y son: Elver Javier de catorce años y el otro es  Edwin Jais de ocho años de edad.

            Invertirá el préstamo en la comercialización de ganado como es el marrano, para engordarlo y luego venderlo en la misma región, con esta actividad lleva  siete años y  ocho meses  el cual le va bien haya que ha tenido buenas ganancias de ello.

           Empezó con esta actividad ya que para tener ingresos en su hogar tiene que tener un trabajo del cual pudiera tener resultado mejor que sus actividades anteriores.
 
           De  lo que gana de su venta por cada cerdo lo invierte comprando mas y así  mejor sea su ganancia, como también  se negocio aumente día con día ya que de ello depende  para sus  ingresos.

          De lo que pueda ahorrar lo estará guardando para comprar un lugar más amplio en donde los pueda criar con mas habilidad.
texts.en:
Iddai S. Guzmán is married to Bernardo Pérez Díaz.  They have two children together who are still in their care.  Elver Javier is 14 years old and Edwin Jais is 8 years old.

Iddai will invest her loan in buying pigs which she will fatten and then sell in the same region.  She has been in this business for seven years and eight months.  Her business is doing well and she makes good profits from it.

Iddai started this business because, in order to have income for her household, she needed to have a job which would give better results than her previous activities did.

Iddai invests all the money she makes from selling each pig into buying more and she thereby makes more profits.  Her business grows day by day.  She depends on it for her income.  Iddai is keeping the money which she is able to save so that she can buy a larger place where she can better raise her livestock.

loans.use: To buy pigs to fatten and then sell in the same region
